loans.name: Angel Andres

texts.es:
Hoy en día se hace cada vez más evidente el constante esfuerzo por salir adelante en este mundo de pocas oportunidades para las personas jóvenes y con poca experiencia.
A esto es lo que se enfrenta Ángel, un joven de 19 años que se destaca por su coraje y hambre de progreso. El desea iniciar un negocio de cría y producción de cerdos de levante para posteriormente venderlos, de esta forma puede obtener los ingresos necesarios para sostenerse e iniciar sus estudios universitarios ya que quiere capacitarse y ser un profesional en temas agrícolas.
Su admirable perseverancia es clave para su desarrollo como empresario. El solicita un crédito para comprar algunos cerdos de cría y de este modo tener un capital para empezar.
texts.en:
Today it is made more evident than ever the constant strain to come out ahead in this world of little opportunity for people who are young and have little experience. 

This is what Ángel finds himself confronted with. He is a young man of 19 who stands out for his courage and hunger for progress. He wishes to begin a business of raising and producing pigs to later sell them. This way he can obtain the necessary income to support himself and begin his university studies since he wants to qualify and be a professional in agriculture. 

His admirable perseverance is key for his development as a businessman. He is requesting a loan in order to buy some pigs for rearing and this way to have capital to begin.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Ghenwa

texts.en: Ghenwa is a 29-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and 2 children. Ghenwa is trying her best to be as helpful as she can. She started her own job at an earlier age. She has opened a room in her house to give private education since 2012. Today, she’s looking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase a new laptop for her business. In the future, she plans to open an educational center in order to attract more students.

loans.use: to purchase a new laptop

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
Haidar is a 32-year-old married father of one child who is enrolled in a private school. He is the sole earner of the three-member family. Two years ago, Haidar started working in an aluminum shop to provide his family with the best living standards. He has 20 years of experience in this field and he is a reliable worker with a good reputation. 

Haidar has successfully repaid one loan with Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua and he's already acquired a new loan to pay for the high cost of his daughter's school tuition. In the future, he intends to establish his own aluminum shop to help his family

loans.use: To pay his daughter's school tuition

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Дилором начинающий предприниматель из сельского района Гончи. Ей 51 год. Она работает учительницей в средней школе своего села на протяжении 22 лет. Ее муж и сын работают в одном из российских городов. За счет их перевода денег она накопила немного сбережение и теперь собирается параллельно начать новый бизнес. Ее интересует откорм и продажа скота. Это прибыльный бизнес со стабильным доходом, так как на мясо всегда имеется спрос. Дилором еще нуждается в кредите, чтобы купить 5-голов крупнорогатого скота и их корма. Она уже составила свой план откорма и продажи скотов. Она сейчас только ждет поддержки, чтобы сразу же приступить к новому бизнесу. Имея дополнительный источник дохода, она будет в состоянии улучшить условия жизни.
texts.en:
Dilorom is a new entrepreneur from the rural region of Gonchi. She is 51 and has been working as a high school teacher in her village for 22 years. Her husband and son are working in a city in Russia. She has saved some of the money they have sent her and now is preparing to start a business fattening and selling livestock. It is an income-generating business with stable revenue, since there is always demand for meat. 

Dilorom still needs a loan to buy five head of cattle and enough to feed them. She has already made her plans and now needs support to make her business happen. With an additional source of income, she will be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy livestock and feed to start a new business

loans.name: Nita Carlota

texts.es:
En la Estancilla del cantón Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito La Estancia, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Nita, tiene 53 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de  edad e independientes, con ellos vive una nieta de tres años. Su esposo no trabaja por discapicad.
Doña Nita con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante en el hogar y mas desde que su marido no puede trabajar  se dedica a la preparación y venta de bocadillos, estos los fabrica bajo pedido de tres  a cuatro veces por semana, ella también prepara comida para fiestas y recepciones por lo general una vez a la semana. Lleva  más de 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana se gana la vida.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar víveres necesarios para preparar los alimentos. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha
texts.en:
In La Estancilla in the canton of Tosagua, the lending group La Estancia meets every 15 days. This locale is know for being very dynamic. The majority of its inhabitants work in agriculture and animal husbandry, because it is an area with a lot of vegetation.

Nita, 53, lives here. She is married and has three grown children; she also has a three year old granddaughter who lives with her. Her husband doesn't work because he is disabled. Nita, in order to earn a living and sustain her home, and to keep her husband from having to work, prepares and sells snacks. She makes them to order three or four times a week. She also makes food for parties and receptions, usually about once a week. She's been doing this for 20 years and it is her source of income.

This loan will be used to buy the groceries needed to prepare her foods. She has been with the lending group since the beginning and likes it because the loans are very helpful.

loans.use: to buy grocery items.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en: Linet is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be experienced. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes to sell. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a viable location and her primary customers are area residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of capital. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy tailoring materials. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 53-year-old single parent with four children who are all orphans. Three of the children are going to school and live in Bundibugyo, Uganda. John is a farmer who practices farming, mainly growing cocoa. In addition to that, he runs a drugstore and restaurant in his free time. He started the businesses to meet his family's daily expenses. He dreams of constructing a residential house, buying a car and educating his children to a higher level of understanding like any loving father. He is faced with a challenge of high competition in his businesses and he is so hard working. John wants a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Chari

texts.en:
Chari is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over two years, she has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.en: Maimuna appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more gallons of kerosene for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of kerosene for her business

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Don Francisco, tiene 60 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 9 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Gracias Lempira junto con su esposa y cuatro de sus hijos. El siempre se a dedicado a la agricultura y a la comercialización de granos básicos y ganado. Lleva aproximadamente 26 años de cultivar café y esta producción la vende en el mercado de la zona. Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo que es por 20,000 Lempiras y lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes, insumos y pago de mano de obra para elaborar viveros de café. Con esta inversión espera ampliar el cultivo y lograr mayor producción de café. Su plan es mantener esta actividad para poder ayudar a sus hijos menores a que realicen sus propios cultivos.
texts.en: Francisco is 60 years old and married. He has nine children and lives in a village in the municipality of Gracias Lempira together with his wife and four of his children. He has always worked in agriculture, focusing on the commercialization of basic grains and livestock. He has about 26 years of experience cultivating coffee and sells his crops in local markets. He is requesting his second loan and plans to use it to purchase fertilizers and other supplies, and pay for labor to prepare his coffee crop. With this investment he hopes to expand his crops and achieve better coffee production. His plan is to continue this line of work to be able to help his younger children start their own crops.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and supplies, and to pay for labor to prepare coffee crops.

loans.name: Marjory

texts.es: Es una señora alegre, tiene 46 años de edad, casada, tiene 6 hijos, de los cuales 3 son mayores de edad e independientes y 3 adolescentes que estudian su primaria.  Desde hace 5 años estableció su negocio de ropa nueva, en un tramo que alquila en el mercado municipal de Puerta Cabezas, inicio con capital propio y con un primer financiamiento que le otorgó PANA PANA en la modalidad de grupo solidario. Con el objetivo de incrementar su inventario, solicita su primer financiamiento en la modalidad de crédito individual, para comprar mercadería en Managua: ropa de cama, pantalones para varones, shorts, camisetas, ropa interior para hombres y mujeres y zapatos para niños y mujeres. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en: This is a happy, 46-year-old woman. She is married and has six children, three of whom are grown up and independent and three of whom are still in school. For the past five years she has had a business selling new clothes at a post she rents at the municipal market in Puerta Cabezas. She started the business with her own capital and a portion of a group loan from Pana Pana. With the goal of increasing her inventory, she is requesting her first individual loan to purchase merchandise in Managua, such as linens, men's pants, shorts, T-shirts, undergarments, and women's and children's shoes. Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in Managua, such as linens, men's pants, shorts, T-shirts, undergarments, and women's and children's shoes.

loans.name: Karen Margarita

texts.es:
Ella es Karen Margarita es un persona la cual no tiene los suficientes recursos para tener una educación adecuada, a ella le gustaría tener una profesión y con eso ayudar a futuro a la mama que la ha ayudado en los estudios con mucho esfuerzo, le interesa estudiar auxiliar de enfermería. 
Esta interesada en el convenio con kiva para tener un mejor medio de pago porque la situación económica de la mama no es la mejor porque es la única que esta ayudando para salir adelante en el futuro es por eso que necesita el convenio de kiva.
texts.en: Karen Margarita is a person who doesn't have sufficient funds to have an adequate education. She would like to have a profession and support her mother, who has tried very hard to help Karen Margarita with her studies. She is interested in studying to be a nursing assistant. She is turning to Kiva in order to have a better means of payment, because her mother's financial situation isn't very good and she is the only person who is helping her build toward a better future. It is for this reason she is turning to Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Ikram

texts.en:
Ikram is a 19-year-old Lebanese woman living with her parents. She has been working for two years, having opened a beauty salon in her house to help her parents meet the needs of life. She has her loyal customers, and she is well known in her region for her brilliant talents. 

Today, Ikram is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase equipment such as scissors, hair brush, dryer for her business. In that way, she will be able to serve her customers with a high quality of work.

loans.use: to purchase equipment such as scissors, hair brush, dryer for her business.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a hardworking woman who greatly appreciates Kiva lenders for supporting her financially. Besides the tailoring business, she also sells fried potatoes. She is requesting a loan to purchase more sacks of fried potatoes and cooking oil for her business.

She joined Yehu to boast her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of fried potatoes and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 31-year-old Lebanese woman living with her parents. She has been working so hard to provide her family with extra financial support by operating a beauty salon in her house for four years. 

She is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l.to purchase new accessories for her project such as make-up, dryer, in order to improve her productivity. These changes will increase her returns and result in higher profits in the future.

loans.use: to purchase new accessories for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Freshia

texts.en:
Freshia is a 30 year old married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and shoes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a favorable location. 

Freshia will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy stock of clothes and shoes. Her business goal is to expand the business and to have several branches within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a profitable business. This is her second loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank.

loans.use: buy stock of clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a married man. He describes himself to be philanthropic. He operates a retail business where he sells vehicle spare parts and other items. He is also a mechanic. He has been involved in this business for 16 years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of vehicle spare parts and other items. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be independent. He will use the anticipated profits to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vehicle spare parts and other items

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit lives in Goravan village with her husband and two sons. She has been involved in agriculture for 5 years already. The farm that she runs includes 100 sheep and cultivation of tomatoes. With the help of her husband, Anahit offers the agricultural products for sale in the local market. 

As the family's needs are growing with time, Anahit wants to expand her agri-business in order to more effectively meet the family's needs. She needs a loan of USD 2900 to pay for cultivation costs, to purchase fertilizer and more sheep. Anahit and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain and develop their agri-business.

loans.use: to pay for cultivation costs, to purchase fertilizer and more sheep.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is married woman with five children, four in school and one underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past eight years, Zawadi has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. With the loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice, beans, cooking  oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice, beans, cooking  oil for resale.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio tiene 46 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus hijos de 14 años y 7 años de edad. Julio trabaja en construcción desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Julio desea construir un cuarto dormitorio por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de arena, ladrillo, cemento y hierro para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en: Julio is 46 years old and lives in his own home along with his children, ages 14 and 7. Julio has worked in construction for a long time, and that is how he makes a living and provides for his family. Julio wants to build a fourth bedroom, and he is requesting a loan to purchase sand, bricks, cement and iron in order to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase sand, bricks, cement and iron to build a fourth bedroom.

loans.name: Enny Jasmira

texts.es:
En la Estancilla del cantón Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito La Estancia, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Enny, tiene 47 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 27, 17 y 15 años, los dos menores estudian en colegio. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña Enny es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para que su marido lo utilice en su labor,  el se dedica a la agricultura y venta de sus productos en toda época del año, actualmente tiene sembrado maíz, maní y verduras ya en la época del verano el siembra verduras, tomate, melón, sandia y varios productos ya que cuenta con  bombas para llevar el agua hasta sus cultivos, es así como el se mantiene todo el año y les da lo necesario a su familia, actualmente está por recoger los productos que sembró  a inicios del año.
Este crédito es para pago de mano de obra para la recolección de los frutos y para semillas para sembrar nuevamente.  Lleva 8 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así sale adelante con los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia
texts.en:
In La Estancilla in the canton of Tosagua, the lending group La Estancia meets every 15 days. This is a locale known for being very dynamic. The majority of the inhabitants work in agriculture and animal husbandry, because of the great vegetation in the area.

Enny, 47, is married and has 3 children, ages 27, 17 and 15; the youngest two are still in school. Her husband is a farmer. Enny is a very good wife and is taking out the loan for her husband's work. He farms year round and sells his products. Currently he is planting corn, peanuts and vegetables since this is the summer season and time to grow tomatoes, melon, watermelon and other products that he can grow now that he has a way to irrigate his fields. This is how he earns his income and provides for his family. Currently he is harvesting the products that he planted at the beginning of the year. This loan will be for labor to harvest the fruits, and seeds to plant anew. Enny has been in the group for 8 years and likes it because the credits help her to move forward. Her dream is to give the best to her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for labor.

loans.name: María Celenita

texts.es:
En la Estancilla del cantón Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito La Estancia, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera de un  hijo  mayor  de edad  que estudia en la universidad. 
Doña María es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma para salir adelante, ella tiene un bazar y papelería  en su casa donde vende ropa, perfumes, bisutería y cosas para regalos, así como también útiles escolares que en esta época es lo que más vende, razón por lo cual necesita de este crédito para tener de todo para cuando lleguen sus clientes a comprar los útiles. Tiene más de 30  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual ha sacado a delante a su hijo y en la actualidad le da para salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa,  perfumes y útiles escolares. Esta desde hace tres años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son mejorar su negocio y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
In La Estancilla in the canton of Tosagua, the lending group La Estancia meets every 15 days. This locale is known for being very dynamic. Most of the inhabitants work in agriculture and animal husbandry, because of the vegetation in the area.

Maria, 43, is a single mother with a grown son who is in university. Maria is very hardworking and values herself and her improvement. She has a bazaar and stationary store in her house where she sells clothing, perfumes, costume jewelry and gift items, as well as school supplies which are most popular right now. She needs this loan so that she is stocked with the supplies her customers need. She's been doing this for 30 years and it has allowed her to care for her son, and she still supports him. She has been in the group for 3 years and likes it because the payments are easy to make. Her dreams are to improve her business and to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfumes and school supplies.

loans.name: Varduhi

texts.en: Varduhi is from Dalarik village of Armavir region. She lives with her retired mother and her only brother is a migrant worker. Varduhi is running their family farm. She works hard to earn a living for the family. Their salaries, however, are not enough to fully cover the increasing needs of the family. She currently wants to expand her agribusiness in order to meet the needs of her family more effectively. A loan of USD 3000 will support this hard-working woman and her family enabling her to purchase 7 oxen and forage for the livestock. The family relies on the good will of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for 7 oxen and forage for the livestock

loans.name: Nelli

texts.en:
Nelli is an experienced farmer from Araqs village in the Armavir region. She lives with her two daughters and a son. Together with her son, Nelli is engaged in land cultivation. Nelli's husband is a migrant worker in a neighboring country. 

Nelli and her son work hard and sell their agricultural products in the local market, which is a very important source of income for the family. As Nelli needs to prepare her agribusiness for the coming agricultural season, she needs a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase fertilizer and seeds and to cover cultivation costs. 

Nelli and her son rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will be very thankful to them for their goodwill and support.

loans.use: to cover cultivation costs and to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator to start a small business.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is 39 years old and is a married woman. She is from the village of Ninotsmminda. She has a husband and school-aged son. Tamar's husband works on the farm as a private worker and generates 400 GEL monthly. 

Tamar is involved in agricultural activity, she raises chickens and sells eggs locally. She has a great desire to expand her business and start dairy farming. Tamar requested 3,000 GEL for purchasing two milking cows to produce milk products. She will sell cheese and yogurt locally. 

The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased thanks to Kiva lenders. Tamar and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them maintain their farming business.

loans.use: to buy 2 milking ows and produce milk products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more spray, cream, and grease hair

loans.name: Elsa Balvina

texts.es:
Elsa tiene 34 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora que  vive en Cañete.
Desde hace varios años trabaja en los campos agrícolas de la zona donde reside, cultivando productos de la mejor calidad.
Tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, se levanta muy temprano para ir a trabajar y ahorrar para poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
Elsa estará eternamente agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva ya que con el apoyo brindado ella podrá terminar de construir su casa y así sentir mayor comodidad y seguridad y así poder cumplir su más grande sueño: “Terminar la remodelación de su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Elsa is 34, and is an enterprising woman who lives in Cañete.

For several years she has worked in the agricultural fields of the area where she lives, cultivating good quality products.  

She is eager to get ahead; Elsa gets up very early to go to work and she saves so that she can improve the quality of her life.

Elsa will be eternally grateful to Kiva lenders because with their support she can finish the construction of her house and feel more comfortable and secure. She will thus achieve her greatest dream: "To complete the remodeling of her home."

loans.use: to complete the construction of her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To fix up her house and small business.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à KOKOUNA un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt de campagne  avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec madame SALIMATA assise au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 2. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  105 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 2 group are married women who on average are 42 years old with three children. For the most part they live in traditional families in Kokouna, a village in the municipality of Loulouni, which is part of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They have been working with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their ninth agricultural loan cycle with Soro Yiriwaso, and all previous loans have been repaid in full.

The selected crop is groundnuts featuring Mrs. Salimata, who is sitting in the middle of the picture of this Benkadi 2 group of women. She will use her loan to buy two 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, two cans of herbicide, and pay the tilling costs to maintain three quarters of an hectare (about 1.85 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level in the markets of Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects to make an average profit of 105,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will enable her to pay off the loan and its interest, and also help her husband with the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, agricultural inputs and pay for tilling

loans.name: Jonathan Javier

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos el Cantón del amor se encuentra ubicado al noroccidente de la provincia de pichincha, este Cantón es muy visitado por turistas nacionales y extranjeros a disfrutar de la variedad de flora y fauna silvestre, uno de los lugares más visitados es la cascada del amor. 
En este Cantón vive y tiene el negocio el señor Jonathan un joven luchador de 21 años, mantiene una sólida relación en unión libre con la cual tienen una pequeña hija de 4 meses por la que cada día se esfuerzan para salir adelante y poder ofrecerle un gran futuro, él trabaja en una carpintería del sector y junto con la esposa también tienen una pequeña granja de pollos, de este negocio aprendieron en su niñez junto con los padres, entre el empleo y negocio trabaja un promedio de 10 horas por día, a Jonathan le gusta mucho la carpintería por lo que sueña un día tener su propio taller, con este crédito iniciara con su sueño ya que con una parte del mismo se comprará una máquina que le hace falta para realizar trabajos adicionales en sus días libres. 
Con esta inversión podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y el de su familia ya que podrá obtener un mejor ingreso económico, Jonathan agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas.
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos, the love canton, is located in the northwestern part of the province of Pichincha.  It is visited frequently by national and foreign tourists who want to enjoy the variety of wild flora and fauna.  One of the most visited places is "love falls".  This canton is where Jonathan has his business.  He is a hard-working young man, 21, who has a solid relationship with his wife.  They have a four-month old daughter who he works hard for every day to offer her a bright future.  

Jonathan works at a carpenter shop and he and his wife also have a small chicken ranch.  They learned the trade when they were young from both of their parents.  Between his job and his business, Jonathan works an average ten hours a day.  He enjoys carpentry and hopes to have his own workshop one day.  With this loan he will start fulfilling his dream because he will use part of it to buy a machine to do extra jobs in his free time.

The investment will improve his family's quality of life as it will increase their income.  Jonathan is grateful to the Fundacion Alternativa and Kiva for this support.

loans.use: To buy a machine to do more work.

loans.name: Freddy Keen

texts.es:
Freddy tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero, vive en Yarinacocha con su hermana.

Es un joven trabajador, labora en una tienda comercial desde hace 5 años, siempre demostrando responsabilidad, puntualidad y amabilidad, con el dinero ganado cubre los gastos de su hogar.
Freddy se independizó cuando tenía 15 años y con mucho esfuerzo adquirió un terreno para que pueda vivir él y su hermana.

Freddy está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que con el apoyo brindado él podrá aperturar un pequeño negocio de abarrotes en su domicilio, así tendrá un ingreso adicional que lo ayudará a remodelar su casa y tener una mejor calidad de vida y más adelante cumplir su gran sueño: “Tener su propio negocio”.
texts.en:
Freddy, 25, is single and lives in Yarinacocha with his sister.  He is an ambitious young man who has been working at a store for five years.  He always demonstrates his responsibility, punctuality and kindness, and uses the money he earns to cover household expenses.

Freddy became independent when he was 15 years old and, through much effort, bought land so he and his sister could have a place to live.

He is grateful to Kiva lenders because he will use the loan to open a small grocery store in his home.  That will give him extra income to help renovate the house and enjoy a better quality of life.  His goal for the future is "To have his own business.".

loans.use: To open a grocery store.

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à KOKOUNA un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec madame DJENEBOU débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 3. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter, des semences, 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  105 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 3 group are married women who on average are 32 years old with two children. For the most part they live in traditional families in Kokouna, a village in the municipality of Loulouni, which is part of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They have been working with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their ninth agricultural loan cycle with Soro Yiriwaso, and all previous loans have been repaid in full.

The selected crop is groundnuts featuring Mrs. Djenebou, who is standing in the first position from right to left in the picture of this Benkadi 3 group of women. She will use her loan to buy seeds, two 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, two cans of herbicide, and pay the tilling costs to maintain three quarters of an hectare (about 1.85 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects to make an average profit of 105,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will enable her to pay off the loan and its interest, and also help her husband with the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for tilling

loans.name: Kotognogontala I Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans et ont en moyenne 6 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à FACHORIBOUGOU un village dans la commune de KABOILA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec madame AFOU assise au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme KOTOGNOGONTALA I. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter, des semences, 4 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 4 bidons d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  140 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Kotognogontala I group are married women who on average are 42 years old with six children. For the most part they live in traditional families in Fachoribougou, a village in the municipality of Kaboila, which is part of the Sikasso circle, in the third administrative region of Mali.

They have been working with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their eleventh agricultural loan cycle with Soro Yiriwaso, and all previous loans have been repaid in full.

The selected crop is groundnuts featuring Mrs. Afou, who is sitting in the middle of the picture of this Kotognogontala I group of women. She will use her loan to buy seeds, four 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, four cans of herbicide, and pay the tilling costs to maintain one hectare (about 2.5 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects to make an average profit of 140,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will enable her to pay off the loan and its interest, and also help her husband with the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for tilling

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. Besides the fruit and vegetable selling business, Ruth operates a retail shop.
She is requesting for a loan to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, maize flour, and soap for her business .Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, maize flour, and soap for her business

loans.name: Lery

texts.es:
La señora Lery tiene 34 años de edad, vive en Yarinacocha con su pequeña hija.
Es una mujer muy trabajadora que ha sacado adelante sola a su hija y que día a día lucha para brindarle un futuro mejor.
Actualmente se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda y también tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio, ya viene laborando 4 años en este negocio.
Gracias al apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva la señora Lery comprará insumos para surtir su negocio de venta de ropa y así poder ampliarlo y tener mayores ingresos para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su pequeña hija, quien es su mayor orgullo y por quien está dispuesta a seguir luchando para convertirla en una profesional exitosa y en una persona de bien.
texts.en:
Lery, 34, lives in Yarinacocha with her small daughter.  She is a hard-working woman who has raised her daughter on her own, struggling day after day to give her a better future.

She currently sells used clothing and also has a small grocery store in her home which she has been running for four years.  Thanks to the support of Kiva lenders, Lery will buy supplies to stock her clothing business so she can expand and earn more income.  She wants to give her daughter, who is her greatest source of pride, a better quality of life.  Lery is willing to working so her daughter can become a successful professional and good person.

loans.use: To stock more products to attract more customers.

loans.name: Rohel Francisco

texts.es: Rohel, tiene 30 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos y vive en una aldea de la comunidad de Gracias Lempira. El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, anteriormente compraba y vendía vacas y cerdos. Pero hace mas de 10 años se dedica al cultivo de café.  La producción es vendida en grano en el mercado local de la zona. Esta solicitando el segundo ciclo de préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras, el cual lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes y abonos y pago de mano de obra para hacer nuevos viveros de café para sembrar. Con esta inversión el espera aumentar el cultivo y mejorar la producción de café a futuro. Su meta es ampliar el cultivo de café para tener bienestar en su familia.
texts.en:
Rohel, 30, is married, has two children and lives in a village in the community of Gracias Lempira. He has always worked in agriculture, before he bought and sold cows and pigs. But for the last ten years he has worked cultivated coffee. 

He sells the coffee as beans in the local market in the area. He is requesting his second cycle of loans for 15,000 Lempiras, which he will invest in the purchase of fertilizers, supplies and to pay for workers to make new coffee nurseries for planting. With this investment, he hopes to increase his crops and improve his future production of coffee. His goal is to expand his coffee crops to support the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for workers to build coffee nurseries for planting.

loans.name: Wilman Francisco

texts.es:
Pedro Vicente Maldonado un Cantón hermoso, de clima es cálido húmedo lleno de gente amable y trabajadora este Cantón es el punto de llegada de muchos turistas ya que a los alrededores del mismo tienen muchas hosterías en las que se puede descansar y ser tratados con amabilidad y respeto. 
Aledaños a este Cantón tenemos varios Recintos, uno de ellos es el Recinto la Célica, en este Recinto vive y tiene el negocio el señor Wilman un hombre luchador de 52 años es casado de esa larga relación tiene 3 hijos ya todos son mayores de edad el mayor tiene 26 años y el ultimo tiene 19 años, la esposa es quien le ayuda en el negocio. 
Don wilman se dedica a la producción de leche aprendió de este negocio en su niñez junto con los papás ya que fue criado en una finca ganadera ayudando a los padres, a este negocio le dedica un promedio de 8 horas diarias durante este tiempo recibe la ayuda de la esposa en el ordeño de las vacas.
Solicita este crédito para invertir en la vivienda para realizar cambios de techo y arreglo de interiores, con esta inversión podrá ofrecerle una mejor vida a su familia, Don Wilman agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
The Pedro Vicente Maldonado Canton is a beautiful place with a warm, humid climate and kind, hard-working people.  This canton is the arrival point for many tourists because there are many hostels where they can rest and be treated with kindness and respect.

Close to this canton are several enclaves, one of which is Recinto la Celica.  This is where Wilman, 52, lives and runs his business.  He is married and has three adult children, the eldest of which is 26 and the youngest, 19.  His wife helps run the business.

Wilman produces milk and learned the trade from his parents when he was a young man.  He was raised on a cattle ranch and helped his parents.  He spends an average eight hours a day on the job and his wife helps milk the cows.

The loan he is requesting is to fix the roof and renovate the inside of his house.  This is so he can provide his family with a better quality of life.  Wilman is grateful to Fundacion Alternativa and Kiva for their support and this opportunity.

loans.use: To fix the roof and renovate the inside of his house.

loans.name: Kotognogontala Ii Group

Les 10 membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 47 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à FACHORIBOUGOU un village dans la commune de KABOILA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec madame SANATA débout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme KOTOGNOGONTALA II.

Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  73 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.

For the most part they live in traditional families in Fachoribougou, a village in the municipality of Kaboila, which is part of the Sikasso circle, in the third administrative region of Mali.

They have been working with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their eleventh agricultural loan cycle with Soro Yiriwaso, and all previous loans have been repaid in full.

The selected crop is groundnuts featuring Mrs. Sanata, who is standing in the second position from right to left in the picture of this Kotognogontala II group of women. She will use her loan to buy seeds, one 50-kilo bag of fertilizer, one can of herbicide, and pay the tilling costs to maintain one-half hectare (about 1.24 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level in the markets of Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects to make an average profit of 73,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will enable her to pay off the loan and its interest, and also help her husband with the family's daily expenses.

loans.name: Kotognogontala Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA IV sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à FACHORIBOUGOU un village dans la commune de KABOILA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec madame AFOUCHATA débout à la deuxième position  de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme KOTOGNOGONTALA IV. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter, des semences, 3 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 3 bidons d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  105 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Kotognogontala IV are all married women who are, on average 40 years old and have five children.  Most of the women live in traditional families in the village of Fachoribougou, Kaboila commune, Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

In order to improve their agricultural businesses during the winter months, the women work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their eleventh loan, the previous loans were all fully and correctly repaid.

Afouchata (standing second from the right in the photo) grows peanuts.  She plans to use her loan to buy seed, three 50 kg sacks of fertilizer, three drums of herbicide, and pay labour costs for 0.75 hectares of land.  She sells her produce in the village and at the markets in Sikasso, to both men and women, for cash or on credit.

Afouchata expects to make an average profit of 105,000 francs CFA over the loan period.  She will use this to repay her loan and interest, and to help her husband to pay for the day-to-day expenses of their family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed and other agricultural products, and pay labour costs for her agricultural business.

loans.name: Kotognogontala Iii Group

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr:
Akouavi est âgée de 39ans. Mariée à un enseignant, elle tient sa boutique depuis 7 ans déja. Afin de s'approvisionner et en manque de liquidité elle sollicite un microcrédit d'un montant de 600000FCFA.
Akouavi espère tirer davantage de profits de ses ventes de produits alimentaire . Elle est maman d'un enfant de 8ans et espère un meilleur devenir pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Akouavi is 39 years old and married to a teacher.  She has been running her food shop for seven years now.  Akouavi has requested this loan of 600,000 francs CFA to solve her problem of lack of liquidity.  She will use the loan to buy stock for her shop.

Akouavi hopes to be able to earn larger profits from selling her food products.  She is the mother of an eight-year-old child and would like to see a better future for her family.

loans.use: to buy food products for resale.

loans.name: Kotognogontala Vi Group

texts.fr:
Les 5 membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA VI sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à FACHORIBOUGOU un village dans la commune de KABOILA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali.

The selected crop is groundnuts featuring Mrs. Rokia, who is sitting in the first position from left to right in the picture of this Kotognogontala VI group of women.
