loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize for resale and to pay transportation costs.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with five children, four of whom are in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family. 

For the past ten years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Raúl Lorenzo

texts.es:
Raúl tiene 53 años de edad, es un hombre muy trabajador, se dedica a la agricultura y además trabaja en carpintería. Actualmente vive con sus 7 hijos de edades entre 3 y 24 años. Su esposa solo se dedica a los oficios del hogar y 3 de sus hijos estudian y le ayudan en la siembra de granos básicos.
Raúl se ha dedicado  a la agricultura desde corta edad, oficio aprendió de su padre. Además de la agricultura también sabe el oficio de carpintería y lo aprendió viendo como trabajaba su tío y fue así como hoy en día hace muebles como: camas, sillas, jugueteras y tallados de madera.
El préstamo será utilizado  para comprar 3 sacos de abono, fórmula  y  2 de sulfato,  un litro  de herbicida  para el control de malezas, el resto  del dinero  será invertido  en mano de obra para la siembra. 
Su sueño es seguir cultivando granos básicos para la alimentación de sus hijos
texts.en:
Raúl is 53 years old, and is a very hardworking man. He makes a living in agriculture, and also works in carpentry. 

Now he lives with his 7 children who are between 3 and 24 years of age. His wife only works running the household, and 3 of his children study. They help him with planting basic grains.

Raúl has worked in agriculture from a young age, a trade he learned from his father. In addition to agriculture, he also knows the trade of carpentry, and he learned it by watching his uncle work. This is how today he makes furniture such as: beds, chairs, toy chests and wood carvings. 

The loan will be used to buy 3 bags of fertilizer, formula and 2 bags of sulfate, a litre of herbicide for weed control, and the remaining money will be invested in labour for planting.

His dream is to continue cultivating basic grains to feed his children.

loans.use: to buy 3 bags of fertilizer, formula and 2 bags of sulfate, a litre of herbicide for weed control, and to invest the remaining money in labour for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more plastic bowls, buckets, plastic chairs and food containers for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchases more used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, pure water and soap.

loans.name: El Roble 1 Group

texts.es:
Santos es un agricultor de 63 años de edad del departamento de Ahuachapan,el es lider del grupo solidario conocido como "El Roble 1", todos se dedican al cultivo de granos basicos, principalmente maiz, maicillo, frijol.
Santos tiene 35 años de casado, sus estudios los realizo hasta tercer grado de primaria, dado que sus padres eran agricultores de muy escasos recursos economicos,el desde muy joven tuvo la necesidad de apoyarlos en sus actividades agricolas,Santos tiene 6 hijos entre las edades de 19 y 37 años,en la actualidad solo 2 de los 6 hijos dependen economicamente de el.
Santos tiene mas de 50 años de experiencia en la agricultura y es atravez de esta actividad como ha dado sostenimiento a su grupo familiar.
Santos solicita el credito para la adquisicion de insumos agricolas a utilizar en la siembra de los cultivos de maiz, maicillo y frijol, para generar los ingresos que requiere para apoyar a su familia, principalmente a el ultimo de sus hijos que esta en la escuela.
texts.en:
Santos is a 63-year-old farmer who lives in the Ahuachapan department. He is the leader of the credit group known as "El Roble 1". All of the members make a living by growing staple grains, like corn, sorghum, and beans.

Santos has been married for 35 years. He attended school until the third grade because, since his parents were farmers with few financial resources, he had to begin working in agriculture to contribute. Santos has 6 children between the ages of 19 and 37. Currently, only 2 of the 6 children rely on him financially.

Santos has more than 50 years of experience in agriculture and this activity has supported his family. Santos requests a loan to purchase agricultural supplies to use for planting his corn, sorghum, and bean crops. This will allow him to generate the income that he needs to support his family, mainly to support his last child who is still in school.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es: Blanca tiene 33 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y su pequeña hija de 11 años de edad. Blanca es empleada de una empresa cercana de su localidad y su esposo es agricultor por lo que juntos mantienen la economía del hogar. Blanca solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un cuarto dormitorio para el cual necesita materiales como: ladrillos, cemento, hierro, arena y  pago de mano de obra para  para la construcción.
texts.en:
Blanca is 33 years old and resides in her own home along with her husband and 11-year-old daughter. She is employed at a company near her town and her husband is a farmer. Both of them partner together in maintaining the household expenses.

Blanca is requesting this loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in the construction of a bedroom. She needs materials such as bricks, cement, iron, and sand. Blanca will also pay for the labor that is required for construction.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and pay for labor in order to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Lynie

texts.en: Lynie has always enjoy selling variety a of items. Being married and having a family to feed, Lynie has found joy in supporting her family through her little store. In need of capital, she has reached PMPC. She wants to avail a loan to purchase inventories of milk, oil, soap and canned goods to sell. Having enough inventory is an opportunity to boost her income. Lynie hopes to sustain her store and has a deep desire to support to also the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase inventories of milk, oil, soap and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en: Noralyn has owned and operated farmland, planting and harvesting cassava and coconuts for sale for more than eight years. She was able to provide her family and had successfully repaid her previous loan used for farming. She earns well from her investments. Noralyn wants to improve her farm for she wants to ensure a better and greener farm. She took a new loan recently to purchase organic fertilizer to improve the farm. In the future Noralyn wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to improve the farm

loans.name: Nelybeth

texts.en:
Nelybeth is a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Bernard, a company driver, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Nelybeth operates a food stall. In the Philippines the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition, but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 800 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy quantities of products like pork, rice, condiments and seasonings. Also, she is planning to buy another Piso Net unit (Piso Net is basically the merge of PC rental and Arcade rental services wherein customers can pay the services by inserting coins to the machine).

Nelybeth hopes to promote and grow more businesses in the coming years. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed for her business.

loans.name: Medie

texts.en:
Medie previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would now like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy merchandise such as clothing, footwear, and undergarments needed in her business. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and cover their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Medie hopes to have a vehicle and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise such as clothing, footwear, and undergarments needed in her business.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 17 years old and she is 1st of three children in the family. 

She is borrowing Php 2102.5 to pay for tuition fees for the first semester of the school year 2014-15.

Mary Ann is currently in the 1st year of  her 4-year Bachelor of Secondary Education course.

When she graduates, Mary Ann plans to be gainfully employed

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 31 years old and has a live-in partner with three children. With two children currently in school, Edna works very hard to provide for them.

Edna's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Edna has restarted her food vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Edna has taken a PHP 5000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Edna is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en:
Evelina is 50 years old and has seven children. Evelina is married and has four children who are currently in school.

Evelina and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Evelina is taking out a housing loan amounting PHP 7,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Evelina has been an NWTF borrower since 2007 and plans to recover through her fishing business.

With your help, Evelina can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José de 70 años de edad,  no estudio, esta acompañado, su pareja trabaja en los parqueos de los buses vendiendo frutas, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales solamente una depende de él, los otros dos tienen sus hogares ya que están acompañados. 

José trabaja la agricultura y lo ha hecho por mucho tiempo y lo aprendió de sus padres y decidió trabajar para que su familia pudiera tener granos básicos para la alimentación, también tiene parcelas de café que son propios y él las trabaja. No tenia negocio antes, la distancia a donde cultiva maíz esta a 1 ½ km y donde tiene le cafetal esta como a 3 ½ km y viaja a pie, no se involucra nadie de la familia. Su horario es de 6.00am a 12.00md. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar abono, herbicidad, pesticidas, foliares para cultivar maíz.  Le mejorara ya que tendrá el producto para cultivar y así su familia podrá tener granos básicos y tendrá menos preocupaciones por la alimentación de su familia. 

 Sus sueños son seguir trabajando con el apoyo de Credicampo con los prestamos, espera que sus hijos también trabajen para que les den un buen futuro a sus hijos o sea nietos para él. Las ganancias las utiliza para ir pagando el préstamo ya que le ayudan mucho y espera seguir trabajando con Credicampo con los prestamos.
texts.en:
José is 70 years old, did not attend school, and is married. His wife works at the bus stops selling fruit. They have three children, one of whom depends on them financially; the others have their own households since they are married.

José has worked in agriculture for a long time. He learned from his parents and decided to work in this area so that his family could have staple grains for food. He also has his own coffee fields where he works. He did not have a business before this. His corn fields are located 1 1/2 kilometers from his home and the coffee fields are located 3 1/2 kilometers. He travels there on foot and no one else in his family works there. His schedule is from 6:00 am to 12:00 noon.

He is requesting the loan from CREDICAMPO to purchase fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, and leaf-applied fertilizers to grow corn. It will help him because he will have the products necessary to plant his crops and provide staple crops to his family, so he will have fewer concerns about providing food for his family.

His dreams are to continue working with Credicampo's support. He hopes that his children will also continue to work so that they can provide a good future for their children, who are his grandchildren. He will use the income to repay the loan since it is very helpful and he hopes that he can continue working with loans from Credicampo.

loans.use: to purchase manure, herbicides, pesticides, and leaf-applied fertilizers to grow corn.

loans.name: Abahizi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Léonidas fait partie du groupe Abahizi II et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il  a 27 ans  et est marié  à Marie, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants âgés de 1  à 5 ans.

Il fait le commerce de boutique (farine, haricot, manioc sec,…) depuis  10 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva  qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’articles de sa boutique (farine, haricot, manioc sec,…) à revendre   pour gagner plus.

Dans les années prochaines, il voudrait être importateur de haricot, de riz, et de manioc,  et  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Leonidas is a member of the Abahizi II group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 27 years old and married to Marie, a vendor. They have two children, one and five years old.

Leonidas has been selling grocery items (flour, beans, manioc/cassava etc) for 10 years.
This is his first loan with Turame.  Thanks to this Kiva loan, he will bolster his capital and buy a lot of groceries (flour, beans, dried manioc/cassava etc) for resale so as to increase his earnings. In the years to come he would like to become an importer of beans, rice, and manioc, and provide for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy groceries (flour, beans, dried cassava etc) for resale.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 45 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Evelyn's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Evelyn is taking out a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Evelyn has been with NWTF since 2010 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. Evelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Mohamed G

texts.en:
This is 29 year-old Mohamed. He is married and has 2 children who are 10 and 4 years old.  

In 2013, Mohamed established his mobile phone accessories, touch light, belt, and sun glasses business. He began his business because he used to assist his elder brother while in school.  After completing senior secondary school, he learned photography.  

He accumulated some money and bought a commercial motorbike.  He rode for some years and opened a shop.  He works 7 days a week and 12 hours a day to earn 1,590,000 SLL every month. He would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL to purchase different types of mobile phone accessories (batteries chargers, memory cards and touch lights). 

In the future, Mohamed plans to buy a piece of land, provide a quality education for his children, and expand the business.  This loan will help him to improve the business and generate more income. He has inadequate capital to meet customer's needs.  

He thanks you for supporting his business.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
This is 33 year-old Margaret.  She is married and has a 6-year-old child. She has 1 additional dependent who attends school and helps with domestic work.  

In 2012, Margaret established her drink business to help in the smooth running of the home.  She also works in an institution.  Though she normally receives a monthly income, she thought it better to have an additional income in order to improve her family's status. 

She works 7 days a week, 11 hours a day. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL  to purchase cartons of soft drinks. In the future, Margaret plans to acquire subsequent loans in order to improve her business.  The loan will provide additional capital for her business which is a great help for growth.   

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a variety of drinks.

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es: Doña Olga, tiene 55 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo y tiene dos hijos, reside en una aldea que pertenece a la comunidad de la Entrada, Copan, cerca de la Flecha, Santa Bárbara. Lleva 14 años de dedicarse a su propio negocio de venta de condimentos como especias, canela, azafrán, orégano, curri, pimienta, saborizantes etc. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa, compra el producto entero, luego lo procesa y lo vende. Tiene sus planes de ampliar el negocio y mantenerlo surtido, por eso ha solicitado un préstamo por 20,500 Lempiras para comprar producto entero como pimienta, ajo, comino, azafrán, canela, orégano etc. para procesarlo y venderlo en bolsitas. De este negocio espera seguir dándoles el estudio a sus hijos y poder vivir mejor.
texts.en: Olga is 55 years old and lives with her two children and her common-law husband in a small town that is part of the community of La Entrada, Copan, near La Flecha, Santa Bárbara, Honduras. For the last 14 years she has had her own business selling condiments such as spices, cinnamon, saffron, oregano, curry, pepper, flavor enhancers, etc. She runs this business from her house, buying the raw materials and then processing and selling them. She has plans to expand her business and keep it well-stocked, and this is why she is asking for a loan of 20,500 lempiras to buy raw materials like pepper, cumin, garlic, saffron, cinnamon, oregano, etc. to process and sell in small bags. With her earnings she hopes to be able to continue to send her children to school and have a better life.

loans.use: buy raw materials like pepper, cumin, garlic, saffron, cinnamon, oregano, etc. to process and sell in small bags.

loans.name: Mary Christ

texts.en: Mary Christ is studying secondary education at Medina College. She is single and lives  with her family.  She is determined and wants to finish her studies to have a bright future of her own. She has a part time job watching over her little cousin and she earns an extra income from this. She is thankful to GDMPC for giving every student a chance to continue studying with their services specialized for students. She took a new loan recently to cove the costs of her school uniforms, books and other needs for the first semester for this current year.  She hopes to be successful and be able to have a nice job gained from her untiring efforts.

loans.use: to cove the costs of her school uniforms, books and other needs.

loans.name: Miraflor

texts.en: Miraflor is 33 years old and lives in a small town of Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur with her husband and two children. Miraflor grows rice. She has been doing this for 10 years. She asks for a loan to pay for labor and to purchase fertilizer to improve the production. In the future, she wishes that her children will finish their studies and live a good life.

loans.use: to pay for labor and to purchase fertilizer to improve rice production

loans.name: Kotognogontala  B Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Kotognogontala  B  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Konzanso, un des villages de la commune Urbaine de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali : 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Sali assise à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et de semences agricoles pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 112.500 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Kotognogontala B are married women averaging 43 years of age, with four children. They all live in polygamous families in Konzanso, a village in the township of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali).
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to manage their agricultural business before the rainy season.
They are on their fourth loan with Soro Yiriwaso, having duly repaid their prior loans.

They cultivate corn, wish is what Sali does, for example. She is the second one seated from right to left in the photo. With her loans, she plans to buy agricultural inputs [such as fertilizers] and seeds to work 1 ha [2 acres] of land.
After harvesting, she sells her produce at the village, at the markets of Sikasso to a mixed clientele.
She plans to earn an average revenue of 112,500 West African francs per agricultural cycle.
This revenue will allow her to pay off her loan and help her husband with everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 44 years old and married with seven children. With three children currently in school, Jessica works very hard to provide for them.

Jessica's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Jessica has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Jessica has taken an 8,500 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family's home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction costs.

Jessica is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction costs.

loans.name: Rema

texts.en:
Rema is 37 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Rema works very hard to provide for them.

Rema runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Rema has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, sardines, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Rema would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gracita

texts.en:
Gracita has a live-in partner with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Gracita is 31 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Gracita's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her fishing business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Gracita is taking out a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Gracita has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. Gracita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her general store business and has been in NWTF since 2012. Now she is requesting a PHP 6,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Jocelyn will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Cidel Marie

texts.en:
Cidel Marie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling bamboo in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of bamboo to offer for resale.

Cidel Marie successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Cidel Marie's business again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bamboo for resale.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her fishing business  and is now requesting a PHP 6500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family. She has been in NWTF since 2009

With your help, Mary Jane will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

Mary Jane would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her food vending business and has been in NWTF since 2012. She is now requesting a PHP 6,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Loreta will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

Loreta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 48 years old and married with four children. With two children currently in school, Magdalena works very hard to provide for them.

Magdalena's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Magdalena has restarted her general store business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Magdalena has taken a PHP 4500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Magdalena is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 45 years old and married with five children. Four of her children are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosario is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosario has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marianita is 46 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Marianita's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her fishing business and is committed to regain what she lost in the typhoon. Marianita is taking out a PHP 8000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Marianita has been with NWTF since 2007 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. Marianita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling personal products in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from selling purified drinking water. Erlinda is borrowing 28,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more items like laundry soap, perfume, body lotion, and other items for her personal products business.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more items like laundry soap, perfume, and body lotion

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 61 years old and widow, with three children.

Evelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for 21 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Evelyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Matriatu

texts.en:
This is 45 year-old Mariama.  She is widowed and has 3 children who are 19, 16 and 13 years old. All attend school.  She has 3 additional dependents, to help with domestic work and attend school.

In 1981, Mariama started a local food business to sell beans, rice, millet, and palm oil.  She works 7 days a week, 11 hours a day and earns 5,595,000 SLL every month.   She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL.

Mariama has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans, and now requires a new loan to purchase 10 bags of beans, 10 bags of rice, gallons of palm oil and pay for transportation costs. 

Mariatu’s previous loan was fully and successfully invested into her business.  Repaying the loan proved to be a serious challenge because of her husband's  illness and death.  She did not build a house as she hoped but her business is in good form.  She had acquired a plot of land.    She is a hard working business woman because she has no financial support from any relatives.  

ARD is the only source she can lean on for positive change in her family.   She thanks ARD for rendering such service.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and beans to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bulk quantities of used clothing

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 27 year-old Fatmata.   She is married and has one three-year-old child, who attends school.  She has one additional dependent, who lives with her to be fostered.  

In 2010, Fatmata established her business to sell paracetamol tablets, blood tonics, vitamins, baby food, pain relief medicine, glucose, and other products. She was introduced to the business by her foster parents. She married and her husband helped her to establish the business.  

She works six days a week, 14 hours a day to earn 2,500,5000 SLL every month. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Fatmat has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans, and now requires a new loan  to purchase cartons of blood syrup, ciprofloxacin, and chloramphenical capsules.  

Fatmata has started building the house and she has taken an entrance exam for a nursing course.  This loan will help to generate more income. She is ambitious and committed to her business.     

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase  pharmaceuticals.

loans.name: Adiatu

texts.en:
This is 45 year-old Adiatu.  She is married and has 4 children who are 30, 23, 19 and 1 year old. She has 1 additional dependent, who lives with her to be fostered.  

Adiatu owns a business to sell rice, beer, stout, soft drinks, thread, poplin, and pure water.  She began her business when she got married.  Her husband introduced her to the business with some money to start a small grocery business.  She works 7 days a week, 16 hours a day to earn 1,995,000 SLL every month.  

She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL to buy bags of sugar, rice and cooking oil. This loan will help to improve the business.

In the future, Adiatu plans to provide a quality education for her children and buy a piece of land.  She is friendly and a family person.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of rice, sugar, cooking oil, soft drinks, and beer.

loans.name: Milton Javier

texts.es:
El arte culinario no es solamente para mujeres. Los hombres también se han destacado en el área de la cocina. Milton Javier es un ejemplo de ello. Prepara deliciosas recetas de sopas, pollo frito y otros platillos.  Su comedor siempre esta concurrido por el exquisito sabor de los alimentos que sirve diariamente.  Lleva cinco años vendiendo comida, al mismo tiempo disfruta en hacerla y obtiene buenas ganancias.
Su madre su mayor inspiración. Él trabaja arduamente para brindarle las comodidades necesarias. Entre sus metas esta establecer un pequeño restaurante, con el fin de ofrecerle al  público  una  variedad de platillos. Para lograr este proyecto, requiere de un capital, de esa forma su propósito se cumplirá. Milton solicitó un préstamo en KIVA MiCrédito. El dinero lo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos, vegetales, frutas y condimentos.
texts.en:
The art of cooking is not only for women. Men are also known for their work in the kitchen. Milton Javier is an example of this. He prepares delicious recipes such as soups, fried chicken, and other dishes. His eatery is always busy because of the exquisite flavor of the food that he serves every day. Milton has been selling food for five years. At the same time, he has enjoyed generating a good income.

His mother is his greatest inspiration. He works hard in order to provide the necessary comforts. One of his goals is to establish a small restaurant where he can offer a variety of dishes to the public. In order to pursue this project, he needs capital so that he can reach his goal.

Milton is requesting a Kiva loan from MiCrédito. The money will be invested in the purchase of basic grains, vegetables, fruits, and condiments.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, vegetables, fruits, and condiments.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es: Es una mujer sociable y emprendedora. Tiene 32 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingreso, desde hace aproximadamente 4 años estableció una pequeña pulpería en su vivienda. Inicio con capital propio y financiamiento otorgado por PANA PANA, en la modalidad de grupo solidario. Con el objetivo de incrementar su inventario, solicita su primer financiamiento en la modalidad de crédito individual, para comprar mercadería: granos básicos, papel higiénico,  huevo, chivería, leche en polvo, gaseosas, entre otros productos. Su sueño es ampliar y diversificar su negocio, vender artículos y utensilios de cocina.
texts.en:
Olivia is a sociable, entrepreneurial woman. She is 32 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. With the goal of having her own source of income, she opened a small grocery store in her home 4 years ago. She started it with her own capital and financing with a group loan from PANA PANA.

In order to increase her inventory, she has requested her first individual loan to purchase merchandise like staple grains, toilet paper, eggs, yogurt, powdered milk, sodas, etc. Her dream is to expand and diversify her business and sell kitchen supplies and utensils.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like staple grains, toilet paper, eggs, yogurt, powdered milk, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.es:
Saturnino tiene 33 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y muy responsable en su familia, el grupo familiar está conformado por sus 4 hijos entre edades de 2 a 12 años, y su esposa que se dedica al comercio ya que tiene una pequeña tienda con productos varios. 2 de sus 4 hijos le ayudan a cultivar granos básicos para la alimentación de la familia.
Saturnino siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde que tenía 13 años de edad. Lo que más ha cultivado toda su vida es maíz, frijol y maicillo. Así con la ayuda de sus 2 hijos alcanza a cultivar una hectárea y media de cultivo.
Con el préstamo, se le estará ayudando a Saturnino, para sembrar una hectárea y media de granos básicos, ya que tiene que comprar 4 sacos de abono y una caneca de herbicida.
Su sueño tener una tienda un poco más fuerte junto con su pareja y así poder tener más ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Saturnino is a hard-working and very responsible 33 year old family man. His family consists of 4 children between the ages of 2 and 12 and his wife who works in commerce as she has a small store with various products.

Two of his children help him grow his basic grains to feed the family. Saturnino has been farming since he was 13 years old. What he has grown most is corn, beans and sorghum. So with the help of his two children he manages to cultivate a hectare and a half. The loan will help Saturnino seed his hectare and a half with basic grains as he has to buy 4 bags of fertilizer and a container of herbicide. His dream is to have a bigger store together with his wife in order to have more revenues for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide.

loans.name: Diego Samuel

texts.es: Diego  es una persona de 36 años de edad, es casado, viven en el municipio de Chichicastenango, departamento de El Quiche, tiene 4 hijos, el primero de 12 años de edad, el segundo de 9 años de edad, el tercero de 7 años de edad, estudian nivel primaria en la comunidad y el cuarto de  3 años de edad todavía no asiste a la escuela, se dedica a la albañilería y se ha especializado hace cuatro años, la esposa se dedica a la elaboración de ropa típica y lo ayuda con los gastos de la familia, solicita un préstamo por un monto de Q. 8,000.00 para la comprar puertas, marcos para las ventanas,  y así mejorar la condiciones donde actualmente vive. Unos de sus retos es poder mejorar otras habitaciones y así tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Diego is a 36-year-old individual. He is married and lives in the town of Chichicastenango in the Department of El Quiche. He has four children. The first three children (ages 12, 9, and 7) attend a primary school in the community. The fourth child is 3 years old and has yet to attend school.

Diego is a bricklayer who has specialized in this line of work for four years. His wife makes traditional clothes and is able to help with the family expenses. Diego is requesting a loan in the amount of 8,000 GTQ so that he can buy doors and frames for the windows. This will improve his currently living conditions. One of his challenges is making improvements to the other rooms so that he can have a decent home.

loans.use: to buy doors and windows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farming supplies, among other things, to protect for vegetable crops.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a hardworking mother from Sindangan. She is 59 years old and operates a tailoring business to earn a living.  Nenita initiated a membership with PMPC for financial help to expand her business. 

Recently she applied a loan to purchase textiles, buttons, zippers and other tailoring items. This  inventory will help her to boost  her income especially now that it's the opening of the school year. 

Nenita hopes to maintain a good credit record with the Cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase textiles, buttons, zippers and other tailoring items.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
Мавлуда 35-летняя женщина из села района А.Джоми. Она трудолюбивая женщина, зарабатывающая на жизнь честным трудом. У Мавлуды высшее образование и она работает учительницей в местной сельской школе. Мавлуда имеет одного трехлетнего ребенка. Ее муж сейчас работает вдали от семьи, в одном из городов России. 
Мавлуда помимо преподавательской деятельности еще и занимается другим бизнесом. Вот уже ровно 7 лет как она выращивает коров и бычков при дворе своего дома. Эта деятельность специфична для жителей сёл и районов, где сама местность благоприятствует этому виду деятельности. Мавлуда приобрела хороший опыт и теперь думает о расширении бизнеса. Она просит кредит, на сумму которого планирует купить несколько крупнорогатых скотов. Она надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Mavluda is a 35-year-old woman from the village of A. Jomi. She is a hardworking woman who earns a living by honest labor. Mavludi has a higher education and she works as a teacher in the local village school. Mavluda has a three-year-old child. Her husband is currently working away from the family in a town in Russia. 

Aside from teaching, Mavluda also works in business. For exactly seven years, she has been raising cows and calves in her yard. This kind of work is specific to the residents of villages and regions where the terrain is favorable. Mavluda has a lot of experience and is now thinking about expanding the business. She requested a loan with which she is planning to buy some cattle. She looks forward to your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle to increase her herd.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
This is Vilma, 52,who is a  resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Diomes and they have children. She and Diomes manage their household while operating the business. She works hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Vilma operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons, when buying cooked rice  cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she requests 15, 000 PHP to buy  meat, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen food products. 

Vilma dreams of expanding her business and having businesses in other locations. She hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets weekly  with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work  and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase rice, pork, chicken and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 56 years old and is very responsible with her household obligations since she has always been known to provide the best for her family. She currently lives with her husband and three children. She is a farmer who plants corn and beans.

Esterlita, together with her husband, wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer, among other items, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma, age 58, is happy tending her little store. She is married, but has no children. The store is her means of earning a living in support of her family.  Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood and so she makes promising daily sales.  Thelma keeps running the store well, even though there is increased competition from other stores. Thelma believes that with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative's (PMPC) support, as one family, they will sustain and beat the competition.  

Thelma has reached her fourth year as a member of PMPC. She has applied for a loan of PHP 3,000 to pay for additional stocks of canned goods for the store. Expanding her inventory should result in additional income. 

She has confidence that she can maintain the label of 'member in good standing.' "It's already tested", she said.  She is hard-working and wishes to sustain her business.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of canned goods.

loans.name: Edemar

texts.en:
Edemar is 58 years old, with three adult children. He is a farmer who produces rice to provide for the needs of his family. Edemar lives in Mahayag Zamboanga del Sur and his rice field is just nearby. 

Edemar asked for a loan to purchase fertilizer for rice production, so that he can produce a good harvest. He hopes that, someday, he will have a better life with his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for rice production.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 59-year-old,widow from Sindangan. She has a small sari-sari store that serves as a source of income. She earns  7,000 PHP per month.

Teresita enjoys her membership with the Cooperative to gain access to insurances and meet capital needs. Recently, she requested a loan to restock her store with basic inventories of rice, canned goods and noodles. 

She hopes to have a daily promising income so she can continuously provide for the family.

loans.use: to restock her inventory.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 58 years old and married with six children. 

Leonora and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was destroyed. 

Leonora is taking out a 5,500 PHP housing loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction costs to build a house for her family. 

Leonora has been an NWTF borrower since 2012 and plans to recover through her fish vending business.

With your help, Leonora can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction costs.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Edna works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income raising pigs. Edna is borrowing 21,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Edna has sustained her business activities through 14 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise like clothing and beauty products from catalogs to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and been in NWTF since 2012 and requests a 9,500 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction costs so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Lydia will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Lydia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction costs.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a 34-year-old married woman with five children; 4 attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Merlinda's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her fishing and food vending businesses and is committed to regain what she lost. Merlinda requests a 8,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction costs to build her family's house.

Merlinda has been with NWTF since 2012 to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Merlinda would like to save enough money  to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction costs.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a 48-year-old married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Helen has a food vending business in the Philippines. Helen has been in this business for 25 years and requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

 In the future, Helen would like to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more wood to increase his sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to care for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina requested a 30,000 PHP loan through PMPC to buy more variety of fruits to sell. Gina has been in this business for 10 years now. She requested a loan to purchase additional fruits to sell. Gina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits to sell

loans.name: Juntas Por Una Vida Mejor 2 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JUNTAS POR UNA VIDA MEJOR 2” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Delia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, venta de ropa, tejido de mantas, servicio de transporte, tienda de barrio, cosméticos, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Delia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su zona y formo un grupo. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  tejido de mantas y chompas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre, hace varios años, ya que ella producía y comercializaba estos mismos productos. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido de la clienta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “JUNTAS POR UNA VIDA MEJOR 2” (“Together for a Better Life 2”) will begin its first cycle at Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Senkata. The group is composed of eight members and is headed by a board in which Delia is President. The businesses that the members of the community association conduct vary and include: selling vegetables, selling clothes, blanket weaving, transport service, neighborhood store, cosmetics, and food sales.

The loan will benefit small businesses in Delia’s group. She says that she is just joining Pro Mujer; She joined through the invitation of one of the institution’s advocates who formed a group in her area. Today she has a blanket and sweater weaving business. She learned this craft from her mother several years ago, and now she makes and sells these same products.
 
The loan she is currently requesting is to increase her merchandise (buy wool wholesale) which she will acquire from the markets in the city of El Alto, and subsequently make products to sell to clients on request. This work will provide her with income to support her family, as she lives with her partner and two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the savings offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy wool wholesale.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not is she is doing her hobby, but she earns an income as well. At age 54 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. 

She grabbed the opportunity to become a full pledge member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative in providing her capital to support her gardening activities. 

Recently, she applied a loan to pay for flower fertilizer. 

In the future, Teofila wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to pay for flower fertilizer

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 53 years old with 3 children; she lives in Pugwan, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur with her husband. Divina and her husband manage their farm very well. They produced a good harvest in the last crop season. 

Divina request for another loan to purchase fertilizer to enhance their production this season.

She wishes that someday her children will finish their studies and they will live the life they dream of.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for rice production

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita finds pleasure in doing her farming activities.  She earns an income as well. 

At the age of 47 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full pledge member of PMPC. She credits her capital to the cooperative in supporting her farming activities. 

Recently, she applied a loan to purchase agri fertilizer.

 In the future, Anita wishes to become the supplier of rice in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase agri fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to feed his crops.

loans.name: Nanette

texts.en:
Nanette works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her general store business and has been in NWTF since 2012.  She requests a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction costs to build a house for her family.

With your help, Nanette will be able to rebuild her devastated life.

Nanette would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction costs.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is a 57-year-old widow with two children.  Fely works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store for ten years and earns additional income raising pigs.

She requests 23,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more groceries for her store and feed for her pigs.  Fely has borrowed and repaid ten previous loans from NWTF. 

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries and feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 47 years old and married; she has six children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. 

Emma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in this business for six years, and also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 59 years old and married with four children. Adela works very hard to provide for them.

Adela's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Adela has restarted her fishing business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Adela has taken a 9,500 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family's home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction costs.

Adela is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future, would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction costs.

loans.name: Edwin Alexander

texts.es:
Edwin de 23 años de edad,  es bachiller, esta acompañado, su pareja trabaja como empleada, no tiene hijos y nadie mas vive con ellos, solamente son dos. Edwin es empleado desde hace un año, no tiene ningún negocio ya que no tiene el tiempo para dedicarse a otras actividades, pero también recibe remesas de EEUU de parte de la madre.

 A su lugar de trabajo se traslada en bus, se horario es de 8.00 am a 4.00 pm. El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar medicinas para su abuela. Le mejorara sus condiciones de salud de su abuela y por lo tanto estará muy bien, la necesidad que tenia será satisfecha ya que podrá ayudarle a su familia cuando mas lo necesitan. Sus sueños son poder hacerse de un pequeño capital para tener un negocio junto a su pareja, pensando en un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Edwin is 23 years old, is a high school graduate, and is married. His wife is a domestic employee. They do not have children and they live alone. Edwin has worked as a domestic employee for the past year. He does not have another business because he doesn't have time to have another job. He receives remittances from his mother in the United States.

He takes the bus to work and his schedule is from 8:00 am until 4:00 pm. He is requesting a loan to purchase medicine for his grandmother. It will help her health to improve so that she can be well. The need to help his family will be satisfied since he will be able to help his family when they need it most. 

His dream is to use his own capital to start a business with his wife to provide a better future.

loans.use: to purchase medicine for his grandmother.

loans.name: Francisca Guadalupe

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 27 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora pues a pesar de ser madre soltera ha luchado sola para sacar adelante a sus dos hijos quienes estudian. Francisca es una mujer de carácter bondadosa pues ha dedicado su vida a apoyar a su familia teniendo que dejar el estudio y dedicarse a la venta de ropa.
Francisca vende ropa desde hace 5 años anteriormente ella se dedicaba a ayudarle a su madre en los oficios domésticos hasta que decidió abrir un negocio del que obtuviera ingresos para mantener a sus hijos, su labor diaria es un poco cansada, ella viaja a los cantones
 y en muchas ocasiones debe caminar largos trayectos visitando a sus clientes y entregando pedidos.
Con el crédito Francisca comprará más ropa como jeans para damas y caballeros, blusas y camisas con nuevos estilos toda para distribuirla en las casas vecinas y en los cantones aledaños, con esta actividad ella obtiene los ingresos necesarios para poder pagar los gastos del hogar los estudios de sus hijos.
El sueño de Francisca es abrir un local donde pueda comercializar la ropa, porque su meta es darles el estudio universitario a sus niños, ella no quiere que sus hijos dejen el estudio por falta de recursos económicos como a ella lo hizo.
texts.en:
Francisca is 27-years old.  She is an enterprising woman.  In spite of being a single mother, she has worked hard by herself to get her two children, who both go to school, ahead.  Francisca is a woman of generous character; she has dedicated herself to helping her family.  She stopped going to school to earn a living selling clothing. 
Francisca has been selling clothing for five years.  She previously dedicated her time to helping her mother with house work until she decided to start a business from which she could earn an income to support her children.  Her daily labors are a bit tiring; Francisca travels to the cantons and a lot of times has to walk long routes to visit her customers and deliver orders. 
With the loan, Francisca will purchase more clothing, like men's and women's jeans, blouses and new styles of shirts, to distribute to her neighbors' homes and in the adjoining cantons.  With this business, Francisca earns the income she needs to pay for her household expenses and her children's schooling.  
Francisca's dream is to open a store where she can sell clothing, because her goal is to provide her children with a university education.  She doesn't want her children to stop going to school for a lack of money, like she had to do.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing, like men's and women's jeans, blouses and new styles of shirts.

loans.name: Marizela Magali

texts.es: Marizela   de 19 años de edad,  soltera y sin hijos, es un agradable estudiante de la facultad de  administración de  hotelería y turismo, lleva 1 año esforzándose de lo cual le falta 4 años restantes, estudia mucho para alcanzar sus metas en la vida. Con la ayuda de sus padres  marizela  ha sabido salir adelante y estudiar mucho, así culminar sus estudios y así poder ser  exitosa en la vida. Con el préstamo otorgado ella podrá realizar los pagos de su matrícula universitaria y la compra de útiles de estudio que necesita. Marizela  se encuentra muy agradecida  por la ayuda brindada y se despide con un fuerte abrazo ah Kiva y diciéndoles que cumplirá la promesa de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Marizela, 19 years old,  single and with no children, is a likeable student of hotel administration and tourism.  She has been striving hard at this one year and must continue for 4 more.  She studies hard to achieve her goals in life.  With her parents' help Marizela has known how to get ahead in life and study a lot, so as to complete her education and be successful in life. 

With the loan award, she will be able to pay her enrollment fees and buy the school supplies that she needs.  Marizela is very grateful for the help and sends a big hug to Kiva, saying that she will fulfill her promise to get ahead.

loans.use: to pay her enrollment fees and for school supplies

loans.name: Futuro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FUTURO” iniciará el trigésimo cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Daría es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de coca, venta de plásticos, confección de deportivos, venta de cosméticos, taller de chapería, taller de cerámicas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Daría es integrante, ella indica que hace diez y seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de mantas de alpaca; da a conocer que la técnica de tejido lo adquirió de su anterior trabajo, donde ella trabajaba como operaria, posteriormente con un pequeño capital decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana de alpaca por mayor) que adquirirá en las ferias de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en las ferias de la Ciudad de Oruro. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de crédito que le ofrece la institución
texts.en:
The “FUTURO” communal bank is starting its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Adela centre. It is made up of eight members and is run by a board of directors of which Daría is the secretary. The businesses which the members of the communal bank run are varied and include selling coca, selling plastics, sewing sportswear, selling cosmetics, a car repair workshop and a ceramic workshop. 

The loan they are taking out will benefit small micro businesswomen of which Daría is a member. She says she joined Pro Mujer sixteen years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution.  Currently she has a business selling alpaca blankets and says she learnt the knitting technique in her previous job, where she worked as an employee. She later decided to set up in business independently using a small amount of capital.  

The loan she is taking out now is to provide working capital to buy alpaca wool wholesale. She will buy the wool at the markets in the city of La Paz and after knitting the blankets she will sell them at the markets in the city of Oruro. This kind of work enables her to earn an income to support her family, since she is married and has seven children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the credit facility which the institution provides.

loans.use: to buy alpaca wool wholesale.

loans.name: Kotognogontala D Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Kotognogontala D  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Konzanso, un des villages de la commune Urbaine de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali : 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec  Fatoumata  debout au milieu. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et de semences agricoles pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Kotognogontala D group are married women who on average are 40 years old with five children. They all live in polygamous families in Konzanso, one of the villages in the Sikasso municipality, in the third administrative region of Mali.

They have been working with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution, and all previous loans have been repaid in full.

The selected crop is maize featuring Fatoumata, who is standing in the middle. She will use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds to maintain one hectare (about 2.47 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level in the markets of Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects to make an average profit of 100,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will enable her to pay off the loan, and also help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy agricultural inputs and seeds

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 52 years old, with eight children, and she lives in Caridad, Dumingag, Zamboanga del Sur with her husband and children. Susan and her husband operate their rice field very well. 

Susan requested a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparation, to enhance their production this season. She wishes that, someday, her children will finish their studies and they will live the life they dreamed of.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation.

loans.name: Avelita

texts.en:
Mrs. Avelita is 48 years old, married, and a resident of D'ban, Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. They are blessed with two children. 

Because it is hard for them to survive if only her husband is working, she decided to engage herself in selling.  She started selling native products with capital of 3,000 PHP. Their primary customers are their neighbors. She is successful because she was able to manage it well, and able to finance the daily needs of her family with the help of Paglaum Cooperative, which she became a member of in September, 2003. She was able to avail herself of three loans, and paid them religiously. 

Now, she applies for a loan of 5,000 PHP to finance the purchase of the additional stock of a variety of native products. 

She is looking forward to expanding her business into export product someday.

loans.use: to buy a stock of native products

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Jernet is 18 years old and is first of four children in her family. Her mother Janet, who is a member of NWTF, supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Jernet is studying to attain a Bachelor of Science in Secondary Education and is currently in the second year of this four year course.

Jernet is borrowing 6,000 PHP to pay tuition fees for the first semester of the 2014 school year.

When she graduates, Jernet plans to be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her daughter

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 52 years old and married, with four children.

Emelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional stocks to sell, like snack foods, dried fish, sugar, rice, soft drinks, and beer.

Emelia has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from pig-fattening.

Emelia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell, like snack foods, dried fish, sugar, rice, soft drinks, and beer.

loans.name: Kotognogontala E Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Kotognogontala E  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Konzanso, un des villages de la commune Urbaine de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali : 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec  Matou  debout au milieu. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et de semences agricoles pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 106.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Kotognogontala E group are married women who on average are 40 years old with five children. They all live in polygamous families in Konzanso, one of the villages in the Sikasso municipality, in the third administrative region of Mali.

They have been working with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution, and all previous loans have been repaid in full.

The selected crop is maize featuring Matou, who is standing in the middle. She will use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds to maintain one hectare (about 2.47 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects to make an average profit of 106,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will enable her to pay off the loan, and also help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy agricultural inputs and seeds

loans.name: Jonna

texts.en:
Jonna is a single entrepreneur who runs a cosmetics business to earn a living. After finishing her studies, Jonna began selling cosmetic products, starting with her friends and then with her community. She successfully repaid her previous loan used for this business. 

In addition, she also put capital into her parents' retail store business. Recently, she took a new loan to buy more grocery goods to sell and add to the inventory capital of the store.
 
She plans to repair the family house using her generated revenue to live comfortably with her parents.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Madeline

texts.en:
Madeline is 27 years old and married with two children.

Madeline works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like snack foods, candies, noodles, cooking oil, detergent soap and shampoo to sell.

Madeline has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Madeline aspires to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like snack foods, candies, noodles, cooking oil, detergent soap and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Rochell

texts.en:
Rochell is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

Rochell has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Rochell has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es:
Ana, sigue atendiendo su negocio de la mejora manera, el financiamiento anterior le permitió mejorar el inventario de la materia prima para elaborar la venta de pupusas y tortillas, con sus ingresos cancelo su deuda y sus hijos siguen teniendo su apoyo para continuar estudiando.
Requiere más capital para comprar aceite, frijoles, quesillo, loroco, harina, maíz, gas propano, bebidas, etc., y continuar trabajando para tener el sustento diario para su familia así como también cancelar sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en: Ana continues to run her business efficiently. The previous loan allowed her to improve her stock of raw materials to make pupusas and tortillas. With her profits she paid off her loan and her children have been able to continue their studies with her support. She requires more capital to buy oil, beans, cheese, loroco, flour, corn, propane, drinks etc. Then she can continue to work to provide the daily sustenance for her family as well as pay her loan installments on time.

loans.use: to buy oil, beans, cheese, loroco, flour, corn, propane, drinks, etc.

loans.name: José Adelmo

texts.es:
José tiene 20 años de edad, es un joven muy activo que se ha dedicado a trabajar el campo desde muy pequeño, lamentablemente solo estudió hasta 6° grado de educación básica pues la situación económica en que Vivian su padres lo limitaron a que siguiera estudiando, actualmente vive está acompañado y tienen un hijo de solo tres años de edad.

José aprendió los trabajos del campo desde que tenía doce años pues siempre acompañaba a su padre en las épocas de siembras de maíz el cual estaba muy cerca de su casa.  

Él está solicitando este préstamo para comprar fertilizantes agrícolas pues por el momento no cuenta con el dinero para comprarlos.

En un futuro él desea reparar su casa y poder seguir estudiando los días domingos, para obtener otro nivel de estudio y así ir superándose para darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 20 years old and is a very active young man who has earned a living at work in the fields since he was quite young.   Unfortunately he only studied till 6th grade because the financial situation of his parents limited his ability to continue in school.  Now he lives with a partner and has a son who is only three years old.  

Jose learned to work in the fields since he was twelve years old.  He always went with his father during the seasons for planting corn in fields which were very near their house.
