He is asking for this loan to  buy agricultural fertilizers since he doesn't have the money to buy them at present.

In the future Jose wants to repair his house and continue studying on Sundays to finish another level of school and thus improve himself and provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural fertilizers since he does not have the money to buy them at present

loans.name: Corazón De Santa María Group

texts.es:
María pertenece a la  Alcancía Comunal “CORAZÓN DE SANTA MARIA”, lleva el cargo de presidenta,  el grupo  está conformado por 6 personas que viven por  la misma zona, madres emprendedoras que trabajan día a día para satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar y familia 
María tiene 43 años de edad es conviviente y madre de tres hijos. Ella tiene  como fuente  de trabajo una bodega; a la vez tiene ingresos adicionales ya que tiene un pequeño taller de costura  en su mismo domicilio. Su calidad de vida de María ha mejorado bastante  ya que ahora tiene más ingresos y así puede ayudar con los gastos de su hogar.
María invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su  negocio. Ella  planea poner un minimarket.
La Sra. María es la persona que se encuentra sentada al costado de las otras señoras.
texts.en:
María belongs to the “CORAZÓN DE SANTA MARIA” communal bank of which she is the president. It is composed of 6 enterprising mothers from the same area, who work hard day to day to provide for the needs of their households and families.

María is 43 years old, is in a common-law relationship and is the mother of three children. Her work is running a store. At the same time she has additional income as she has a small sewing workshop in her house. María's quality of living has improved a lot as she now has more income and thus can help with the household expenses. She will invest the loan in buying merchandise for her store. She plans to open a mini-market. María is the person seated next to the others in the photo.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Nhóm 06 Thôn Lý Tây , Thăng Bình Group

texts.en:
Dung is applying for a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. She works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle.

Dung is 34 years old, married, and has two children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 06 Lý Tây, Thăng Bình solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

In 2007, Dung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Dung has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Dung hopes for her children to do well in school, to maintain a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Dyhrine

texts.en:
Dyhrine is single and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Dyhrine requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase an additional box of fish to sell to her customers.  She has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Dyhrine would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional box of fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall. Elvira has been in this business for 6 years and she earns more income from a general store.

Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 38 years old and married with six children.

Maria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items like soft drinks, beers, snack foods, noodles, detergent soap, etc., to sell.  Maria has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Maria aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like soft drinks, beers, snack foods, noodles, detergent soap, etc., to sell

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Milagros works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing. Milagros is borrowing 19,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional containers of purified drinking water to sell.

Milagros has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional containers of purified drinking water to sell

loans.name: Mariano Alejandro

texts.es:
Mariano un hombre de 25 años de edad que encontró en su mujer el mejor apoyo para lograr ser una persona independiente. 
Con la ayuda de los familiares de la conyugue aprendió el oficio de comercialización de leche, elaboración de postres y suero los cuales se ha dedicado a realizar y vender hace aproximadamente un año. 
Debido a la fuerte competencia en el sector mariano solicita un crédito para la compra de un enfriador y materia prima para la elaboración de sus postres, con los que podrá darle continuidad a su negocio y brindarle una calidad de vida a su pequeña hija de 4 años.
Su principal sueño es poder tener una casa propia con un negocio fuerte y solidó solo para poder darle todos los caprichos que un padre quisiera darle a su hija
texts.en:
Mariano, 25, found in his wife the best support to become an independent person. With the help of his wife’s family he learned the trade of selling milk, making desserts and whey which he has been making and selling for about a year now. 

Due to the tough competition in this field, Mariano is requesting a loan to purchase a cooler and raw materials to make the desserts which will allow him to continue with his business and offer a better quality of life to his little 4-year-old daughter.

His main dream is to have his own house and a strong and solid business so he can give his daughter everything a father would like to give.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and raw materials to make the desserts in order to keep his business ahead of the competition.

loans.name: María Eva

texts.es:
María tiene 65 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora que a pesar de su edad piensa que cada día es una bendición para seguir adelante, ella actualmente vive con su esposo y dos hijos mayores de edad quienes le ayudan en la siembra del maíz. 
María se ha dedicado a vender desde los 10 años de edad, empezó con una venta de charamuscas y chocobananos, ahora que está casada, para aportar ingresos a su hogar decidió fortalecer su tienda invirtiendo sus ahorros en la compra de bebidas y otros productos básicos.
María necesita el préstamo para invertir en la tienda, comprará mercadería como churros, paletas, dulces, bebidas enlatadas, productos del hogar y otros. Aprovechará que su negocio está frente a la escuela y a la orilla de la carretera siendo esta una gran ventaja para ella.
Ella desea tener una tienda surtida con la que pueda cubrir la necesidad de las familias vecinas.
texts.en:
Maria, 65, is an enterprising woman that despite her age thinks each day is a blessing to continue ahead. Currently she lives with her husband and their two older children who help plant corn. 

Maria has worked in this business since she was 10 years old. She started selling charamuscas (frozen juice or coconut milk in a plastic bag) and chocobananos (frozen chocolate-covered bananas). Now that she is married and in order to bring home an income she decided to strengthen her store by investing her savings in the purchase of drinks and other basic products.

Maria needs the loan to invest in her store. She will buy merchandise such as churros, ice-pops, sweets, canned beverages, household products etc... She takes advantage of her business being in front of a school and on the edge of a highway; a big advantage for her.

She wants to have a stocked store which she can cover the needs of the neighbouring families.

loans.use: to invest in her store; buying merchandise such as churros, ice-pops, sweets, canned beverages, household products etc...

loans.name: Dúo Girasoles De Patzun Group

texts.es:
Dúo GIRASOLES DE PATZUN
La señora Agustina, vive en la comunidad de Patzun, ella se dedica a la artesanía elaborando suéteres para damas, caballeros y niños, asi como la elaboración de trajes para bebe, pero debido a que ella no cuenta con suficiente capital para elaborar su producto por docenas, es por eso que solicita a Kiva un crédito para poder trabajar mas, ya que el deseo o sueño de ella es tener pedidos por mayor y obtener asi mas ganancias que les ayudara a sus familias en la superación y darles estudio a sus hijos.  Ellas son personas que les gusta trabajar y superarse.
texts.en:
Dúo Girasoles de Patzun Group

Agustina lives in the community of Patzum. She makes a living crafting artisanal sweaters for women, men and children as well as making clothes for babies.  However, because she does not have enough capital to produce her items by the dozen, she is asking Kiva for a loan so that she will be able to work more since her desire or dream is to receive wholesale orders so that she will have a bigger income. 

This will help their families succeed and give their children an education. They are people who like to work and improve themselves.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for the production and sale of traditional fabric.

loans.name: Gloria Marina

texts.es:
Gloria es una persona muy honesta y responsable, vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Su negocio es la venta de golosinas desde hace 3 años, la cual esta ubicada en una de las salidas mas transitadas e importantes la ciudad. Ella está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de  varios materiales como ser: compra de cemento, bloques, arena, barrillas, alambre de amare, clavos, reglas, entre otras; para realizarle algunas mejoras a su negocio y casa  de habitación.
Gloria espera que el préstamo le sirva de mucha ayuda ya que gracias a el contara con el espacio físico suficiente para atender mejor a sus clientes, como en la imagen se encuentra una clieta de Gloria a quienes quiere mejorar el servicio y así mismo satisfacer las necesidades de estos, de igual manera que sus ventas tengan un aumento considerable, y gracias a este ganar más ingresos que beneficien el estilo de vida de la familia en el hogar. Ella espera aumentar su negocio y seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos puedan continuar con los estudios para que tengan mayores oportunidades en el futuro.

Choluteca, Honduras – Abril 2014
texts.en:
Gloria is a very honest and responsible person. She lives in a community in the south of Honduras with her husband and their 3 children. For the past 3 years her business has been the sale of snacks; it is located at one of the most traveled and important exits of the city. She is requesting a loan to buy various materials such as cement, bricks, sand, rods, tie wire, nails, and frames, among others, in order to make some improvements to her business and her house. 

Gloria hopes that the loan will be a great help, since thanks to the loan she will count on having enough physical space to serve her customers better, like the customer that is pictured in the photo. In the same way, she hopes that her sales will increase considerably and, thanks to this, that she will earn a higher income to improve the quality of life of her family at home. She hopes to add to her business and to continue supporting her family so that her children can continue their studies in order to have greater opportunities in the future.

Choluteca, Honduras – April 2014

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand, rods, tie wire, nails, frames, and other materials to repair her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beauty salon products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inputs like flour, sugar, and flavourings.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa de 23 años de edad, es una joven muy luchadora que a pesar de no haber estudiado por la falta de recursos económicos, ella siempre ha tenido emprendedurismo pues ha salido a vender los productos que su hermano cosecha. Actualmente ella vive con su pareja quien se dedica al oficio de albañil.

Teresa desde que tenía doce años de edad se ha dedicado a vender productos como pipián, ayote, sandía, rábanos y elotes todo cultivados por su hermano y también apoya en la actividad agrícola a su esposo quien además de albañil siembra maíz y frijol, el terreno donde cultiva está a seis cuadras de su casa hasta y Teresa va a dejar los alimentos a su esposo hasta ese lugar.

El crédito lo utilizará para ayudar a que su esposo pueda comprar los insumos que ocupará en la producción agrícola, por el momento lo que necesita es comprar los fertilizantes pues ya sembró la planta de maíz y dentro de poco días debe fertilizar.

Su sueño es poder fortalecer una parcela de hortalizas y distribuirlas en el mercado, así también desea mejorar su vivienda y espera hacerlo con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo.
texts.en:
Teresa, 23 years old, is a very hard-working young woman. Although she did not attend school due to a lack of economic resources, she has always had an entrepreneurial spirit. She has managed to sell the products that her brother harvests. She currently lives with her partner, who works in masonry.

Teresa has been selling products such as squash, watermelon, sweet corn, and radishes since she was 12 years old. Her brother grows all of the items she sells. She also helps her husband in his work, as he plants maize and beans in addition to his work as a mason. The land he cultivates is six blocks away from their home, and Teresa brings food to her spouse over in the fields.

Teresa will use this loan to help her spouse to purchase the inputs that he will use in his agricultural production. For the moment, they need fertilizer, as the maize has already been planted and they will need to apply fertilizer shortly.

Her dream is to grow a vegetable plot and sell the harvest in the market. She also wants to improve her home, and hopes to do so by putting in a lot of effort and work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her maize crops.

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en:
Rose Marie is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Rose Marie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional packs of tempura, hot dogs, juice, etc. for her business.

Rose Marie has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Rose Marie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional packs of tempura, hot dogs, juice, etc. for her business

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario, tiene 25 años de edad, esta soltero, vive con sus padres en una aldea del municipio de las Flores, Lempira. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, hace 5 años comenzó a cultivar café el cual vende a los intermediarios de la zona. Con el fin de mejorar las cosechas ha solicitado un préstamo por 15,000 lempiras para fertilizar, abonar la finca y sembrar mas plantas de café. De esta manera podrá ampliar el cultivo para mejorar los ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mario is 25 years old, single, and lives with his parents in a small village in the municipality of Flores, Lempira. He has always made a living as a farmer. Five years ago, he began growing coffee, which he sells to agents in the area. In order to improve his harvests, he has requested a loan of 15,000 lempiras to buy fertiliser and compost for his farm and plant more coffee plants. In this way, he will be able to expand his crop to increase his earnings and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and compost for the farm and plant more coffee plants.

loans.name: Emerilyn

texts.en:
Coming from a failed marriage, Emerilyn works diligently to support her four children.

In 2009, she began to operate a small grocery store within the premise of the house she is renting in the community. Barely two years after, Emerilyn came in contact with SEED and was able to avail a first loan amounting to PhP 5,000. From then on, Emerilyn took proper stewardship of the loan extended to her and was able to improve her grocery store and expand into other business ventures. To date, she is able to set-up a stall that sells cooked-meals in her community. She is also able to buy two motorcycles with passenger carts which are being used for public transport service.

On her 8th loan cycle now, Emerilyn hopes to increase her stocks in her grocery store and food stall business to further her income. She is hoping that with the increased revenue she will be able to continue supporting her children in their education and in the long-term save money in order to buy a house their family can finally call their own.

loans.use: To buy rice, canned goods, snack items and school supplies for her store which are highly demanded by customers in time for school opening.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
53 years old and a widow for four years now, Irma lives in Rosario, Cavite with her 17-year old son. 

Formerly working as a quality controller in a garments factory in the Cavite Apparel Export Processing Zone, Irma began venturing into business in 1990. She would then sell pork meat to her co-workers and was able to earn an extra PhP 5,000 per month. Seeing the potentials of this business, Irma resigned from work in 1996 and decided to do full time business. 

In 1997, she had the opportunity to rent a stall in a flea market where she sells meat. In 2013, she availed a loan from SEED amounting to PhP 10,000 and was able to add up fruits and vegetables in her inventory. From then on, her business grew and she is now generating PhP 12,000 average sales in a day. Irma also employed a neighbor as helper in her stall, thereby creating income opportunity also for other underprivileged individuals in her community. Apart from the growth in this line of business, Irma was also able to invest in room rentals where today she has already 20 rooms for rent generating at least PhP 30,000 per month.

Recently, Irma was able to acquire another stall for her business expansion. At this point, Irma is in need of financing to purchase stocks of meat, fruit, vegetable and grocery items for the new stall. She also plans to hire out another helper from her community.

loans.use: To buy fresh meat, fruits and vegetable and hire an extra helper from the community in  her second flea market stall.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es: Don Porfirio, tiene 46 años de edad, esta soltero, tiene dos hijos, reside con su familia en una aldea del municipio de Talgua, Lempira. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura al cultivo de café, este café lo vende a intermediarios de la zona. Don Porfirio ha solicitado el cuarto ciclo de préstamo que es por 17,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar fertilizantes para asistir sus cultivos y sembrar mas plantas de café. su propósito es aumentar la producción y ganancias para tener bienestar familiar.
texts.en: Porfirio, age 46, is single and has two children. He lives with his family in a village in the city of Talgua, Lempira. He has always worked in agriculture, planting coffee. He sells this coffee to intermediaries in the region. Porfirio has requested the fourth loan cycle for 17,000 Lempiras, which he will use to buy fertilizers for tending to his plants and planting more coffee plants. His goal is to increase production and earnings for his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for tending to his farm and planting more coffee plants.

loans.name: Annalita

texts.en:
A single mother supporting her 9 year old daughter, Annalita was obliged to make ends meet for her family. 

From 1999,Annalita worked as a recorder in garments factory in the Cavite Export Processing Zone until the closure of the factory in 2007. With her separation pay, she decided to put up a bakery which sells consigned breads from her sister. Initially, earnings from the small bakery was able to cover the needs of her family. However as her child began to attend school, Annalita finds her income not sufficient anymore.

It was in 2013 that she joined SEED after having been invited by a neighbor who is also a member of SEED. Her first loan was at PhP 8,000 which she used to set up an eatery and a small general merchandise store. With progressive business expansion, Annalita has now rented a bigger space in a commercial strip in Tanza for her eatery, bakery and general merchandise store. She is also able to employ 4 helpers coming from the community to aid her in her growing business.

By availing a PhP 50,000 loan, Annalita plans to increase the inventory of her general merchandise specifically rice, grocery items and various household supplies which could be sold on wholesale to other small stores in her community and nearby areas.

loans.use: To increase inventory of rice, canned goods, liquefied petroleum gas for cooking for wholesale to other smaller grocery stores.

loans.name: Dúo Orfa Group

texts.es:
DÚO ORFA
María Dali, de 24 años de edad, soltera, es muy trabajadora desde muy pequeña, y está solicitando este crédito porque quiere ampliar su negocio de artículos de consumo diario, que tiene en su casa desde hace mas de 7 años, también ella vende ropa típica en la aldea Montufar 2 días a la semana, y quiere que fape la pueda ayudar, ya que hay algunos productos que le piden y por falta de capital compra poco y se le termina y la distancia no le permite salir a comprar mucho, espera que fape le pueda ayudar ya que ha sido un gran apoyo para su familia el trabajo que ella desempeña.
texts.en: María Dali is 24 years old, single, and has worked very hard from a young age. She is requesting this loan because she wants to expand her business selling everyday consumer goods, which she has had in her home for over 7 years. She also sells traditional clothing in the small village of Montufar 2 days a week, and would like FAPE's help, as there are certain products that customers ask for but which she doesn't buy often because of her lack of capital. These products then run out and the distance means that she is unable to go and buy much more. She hopes that FAPE can help her since the work she does has given a lot of support to her family.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos tiene 38 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos. Carlos posee una tienda en su hogar de habitación la cual es la que le permite dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Muchos clientes lo prefieren dado que ofrece variedad de productos de primera necesidad como: azúcar, sal, frijoles, jabón, pan dulce, arroz, etc. Su deseo es hacer crecer su negocio y de esta forma dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su negocio en la compra de variedad de productos de tienda como: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, pan dulce, sal, aceite, golosinas y de más productos que los clientes demanden.
texts.en:
Carlos is 38 years old. He lives in his own home with his wife and three children. Carlos has a shop in his home which allows him to give his family a better life. Many customers prefer his shop because it offers a variety of staples such as sugar, salt, beans, soap, sweet bread, rice, etc. 

His desire is to grow his business and thus give his family a better life. Therefore he is asking FUSAI for this credit in order to invest in his business through buying a variety of products for the shop such as rice, sugar, beans, sweet bread, salt, oil, sweets and more products that the customers demand.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, sweet bread, salt, oil and sweets

loans.name: Ana Victoria

texts.es: Ana de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia en casa propia, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la crianza de ganado bovino, es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable con los gastos de su hogar, siempre esta buscando la manera de darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, por esa razón solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito para poder comprar ganado bovino y seguir con su crianza ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así le podrá seguir dando a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Ana is 46 years old and lives in her own home with her family. For a number of years, she has made a living rearing cattle. She is a very hard-working woman who handles the family finances responsibly. She is always seeking ways to offer her family a better quality of life. This is why she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL so that she can buy cattle and continue to rear them, since this is her sole source of work and it will enable her to continue giving her family what they need without any limits.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Jose Esteban

texts.es: Don José Esteban es una persona amable, muy respetado, se ha dedicado toda su vida a las actividades del Campos, el posee su propia parcela que le heredo su padre, con sus ganancias obtenidas de la venta de leche, cultivos agrícolas él ha garantizado el pan de cada día a su familia y ha ido poco a poco mejorando su propiedad, pero con la baja del precio en el ganado y en los productos que ofrece le ha provocado un desequilibrio en su economía razón por la cual necesita crédito para comprar alambres de púas, grapas, postes y pagar mano de obra para reparar cercas y contar con buenos encierros para su hato ganadero que estará en mejores condiciones, pues actualmente los alambres están flojos y en malas condiciones.  don José Esteban solo cuenta con la ayuda del hijo menor en las actividades del campo ya sus otros hijos son independientes.
texts.en: Jose Esteban is a friendly and well respected person who has dedicated his whole life to working the land. He has his own plot which he inherited from his father, and making a profit from selling milk and crops has guaranteed his family their daily bread. He has been improving his plot little by little, but with the decrease in price received for livestock and his products, there is a disequilibrium in his earnings. A loan will help him to repair his fences for his bulls, for which he needs to buy barbed wire, staples, posts and to pay for manual labor. Don José Esteban only has the help of his youngest son in the fields because his other sons are independent.

loans.use: Comprar Alambres, de púas, Grapas, Postes y pagar mano de obra para reparar Cercas.

loans.name: Rina Elizabeth

texts.es: Rina de 43 años de edad vive en casa alquilada con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica  a la venta y elaboración de tortillas desde hace 4 años, tiene mucha clientela por la amabilidad  y los buenos precios con que vende sus tortillas, Rina está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por mayor y cal para seguir elaborando dichos alimentos y así obtener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en: Rina is 43 years old and lives in a rented house with her husband and her three children. She has been making and selling tortillas for 4 years. She has many clients because of her friendliness and the good prices she sells her tortillas at. Rina is requesting a loan to buy corn wholesale and lime to continue making her product. She wants to make more revenue and provide her family with a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy corn and lime wholesale.

loans.name: Enma Delia

texts.es: Enma es Lic. en economía, labora en una empresa privada como encargada de compras, es madre de 1 hijo de 2 añitos, Enma  atraviesa con una dificultad el cual es el techo de su vivienda que con las lluvias que están cayendo durante la temporada de invierno el agua se mete al interior de su casa causando molestias e incomodidad, por lo que solicita el crédito para reparar el techo, con esta mejora la clienta considera estar más tranquila junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Enma is a graduate of economics and works in a private company as purchasing manager. She is mother to one child who is just two years old. Enma is facing a problem with the roof of her home. With the rain that falls during the winter season, water gets inside her house, causing annoyances and discomfort. 

For this reason she is requesting a loan to repair the roof. With this improvement, the client believes that she and her family will be more at peace.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheets and purlins.

loans.name: Huệ

texts.en:
Mrs. Huệ works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Huệ is 27 years old and she is married with two children. Huệ lives with her two dependents in Nong Cong district, in a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Huệ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Huệ has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Huệ has been involved in her business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Huệ faces in her life is not having clean water system and hygienic latrine.She is requesting a loan to buy equipment for a toilet and bathroom.

In the future, Huệ hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her children to find a good job, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to buy equipment for toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase ceramic tiles, cement and adhesive.

loans.name: Liệu

texts.en:
Mrs. Liệu works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Liệu is 41 years old and she is married with two children. She supports her two dependents with her business in Nong Cong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Liệu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

In 2005, Liệu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Liệu has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  The main hardship that Liệu faces in her life is not having a clean water system and a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to buy equipment for a toilet and bathroom.

With her business profit, Liệu hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her children to find a good job, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to buy equipment for toilet and bathroom

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en: Mary Rose is a 41-year-old mother managing a small retail store within the local community. Due to financial insufficiency, she aims to make her business more profitable in order to help her husband in covering their necessities and financing the education of her three children. To further improve the business, she is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, snack foods, canned goods, beverages, noodles and laundry soaps to sell. She believes that her  loan will enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, snack foods, canned goods, beverages, noodles and laundry soaps to sell

loans.name: Mùa

texts.en:
Mrs. Mùa works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Mùa is 43 years old and she is married with two children. Mùa lives with her two dependents in Nong Cong district, in a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Mùa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Mùa has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Mùa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Mùa faces in her life is not having a clean water system and a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to buy equipment for a toilet and bathroom.

In the future, Mùa hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her children to find a good job, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to buy equipment for a toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Cerilo

texts.en: Cerilo  owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting bananas, corn, and coconuts, which he sells to earn a living. He has been farming for many years and earns well to provide for their needs. He has been successfully repaid his previous loan, which was used for farming. Cerilo served recently in their barrio as a barangay official. He just took a new loan to purchase tires for his motorcycle, used for transporting farm produce. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his farm to improve the general standard of living of the entire family,

loans.use: to purchase new motorcycle tires used for transporting farm produce

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Marilyn is 42 years old and has three children who are in school.

Marilyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like fish, spices, meat, vegetables, etc. for her business.

Marilyn has been in this business for one year. In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like fish, spices, meat, vegetables, etc. for her business

loans.name: Aleyda Guadalupe

texts.es: Aleyda es una joven de 17 años de edad que está cursando su segundo año en Derecho. Sus grandes aspiraciones y sueños son llegar hacer jueza o magistrada de la Corte Suprema de Justicia. Aleyda decidió estudiar Derecho porque le gusta luchar por la justicia de igual forma le gusta estar muy pendiente de lo que pasa jurídicamente en el país. Cuando culmine sus estudios le gustaría ayudar a las personas de escasos recursos económicos. Aleyda solicita un crédito para poder pagar sus mensualidades de la universidad y cubrir sus gastos de compra de materiales bibliográficos de sus estudios. Ella considera que el crédito a solicitud le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá ser una persona responsable y puntual con sus cosas. Su principalmente y próxima es la culminación de sus estudios.
texts.en: Aleyda is a 17-year-old young woman who is studying in her second year of law. Her grand aspirations and dreams are to become a judge or magistrate in the Supreme Court. Aleyda decided to study law because she likes to fight for justice and equally likes to keep an eye on what happens judicially in the country.  When she finishes her studies, she would like to help people with limited resources. Aleyda asks for this loan to be able to pay the monthly university fees and cover the costs of the purchase of reading materials for her classes. She thinks that the requested loan will be very helpful to her since she will be able to be a responsible person, punctual with her things. Her principal and next goal is the culmination of her studies.

loans.use: to be able to pay the monthly university costs and cover the expenses of the purchase of reading materials.

loans.name: Janeth Tamara

texts.es:
Janeth de 27 años de edad, estudio hasta educación media, esta acompañada y su compañero de vida trabaja en la albañilería.

Janeth tiene una pequeña tienda desde hace tres años, ya que no encontraba trabajo, decidió emprender su negocio para tener ingresos para los gastos del hogar. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa y trabaja de lunes a domingo de 6:30 am, a 7:00 pm.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, cal, sal, detergentes, galletas, embutidos, artículos para el cuidado personal, entre otros.  

El sueño de Janeth es crecer el negocio, para tener ingresos para darles estudio a su hija, ademas le gustaría mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Janeth, age 27, went to school through middle school.  She is in a relationship, and her life partner works as a bricklayer.

Janeth has had a small store for three years.  She could not find work, so she decided to undertake her business in order to have income for the household expenses.  She has the business at her house.  She works Mondays through Sundays from 6:30 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.

The loan that she is requesting from CrediCampo is to buy rice, beans, sugar, lime powder, salt, detergent, cookies, cold cuts, and personal care items, among others.

Janeth’s dream is to grow her business in order to have income to give her daughter an education.  She would also like to improve her house.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, lime powder, salt, detergent, cookies, cold cuts, and personal care items, among others.

loans.name: Le

texts.en: Mrs. Le is 52 years old .There are five people in her family. Cultivation and husbandry are her main income. She can cover family’s daily cost and education from pig raising income. With this loan, she is able to build a hygienic latrine to improve the health of her family’s member, especially the kids.  She has daily income from garden such as vegetable, chicken and pig.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Tinh

texts.en: Mrs. Tinh is a hard working woman, 40 years old. She is married and has two children, who are still on school’s sit. Her income is mainly from husbandry and agriculture. With more than 20 years experiences and has support from her husband, her income is able to repay the loan monthly as requested. She is interested to improve the living standard for her family and she really needs the loan to build a toilet.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to help her coffee crops this growing season.

loans.name: Martha Lydia

texts.es: Martha Lydia es una persona de 45 años de edad, vive en el municipio de San Andrés Semetabaj, departamento de Sololá, tiene 4 hijos; 2 ya casados con familia, y 2 son menores de edad y estudian, obtiene sus ingresos por la venta de comida que hace, su local lo tiene dentro del mercado del municipio, se dedica a esta actividad porque le deja buena ganancia, tiene ya 10 años de estar trabajando en su comedor, Martha Lydia solicita un crédito por un monto de Q. 7,000.00 para comprar mobiliario para su comedor, Martha Lydia tiene planeado remodelar su casa en el futuro.
texts.en: Martha Lydia is a 45-year-old individual who lives in the town of San Andrés Semetabaj in the Department of Sololá.  She has four children.  Two of them are already married and have families.  The two younger children are in school.  Martha earns her living by selling food that she prepares.  Her business is located at a municipal market.  She has been devoted to this business because it generates a good income.  Martha has been already working at her diner for 10 years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 7,000 GTQ so that she can buy furniture for her diner.  Martha Lydia plans to remodel her house in the future.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her diner.

loans.name: Thuan

texts.en: Mrs. Thuan is 32 years old, married and has three children. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine, which can contribute to improve the health for her family as well as environment protection. Farming is main income source of her family and she is able to pay the loan monthly from chicken raising activity.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Mrs. Huong is a farmer, 41 years old and married. She has four under 18 year’s old children. She would like to improve her living standard, especially her children but lack of capital. The loan can help her to build a hygienic latrine and she is able to repay the loan from selling vegetable and chicken in her garden.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Mrs. Huong, 31 years old, she is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband and two children in a small house and without hygienic latrine. She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the living condition and health for her family, especially her children and also contribute to environment protection. Her main income is from rice & vegetable growing and she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Oksana

texts.ru:
Оксана замужем, у нее есть взрослая дочь Валентина. Оксана занимается реализацией женской одежды на местном Каховском рынке. Оксана уже пользовалась КИВА кредитами. Благодаря прошлому КИВА кредиту она смогла закупить свитера, кофты, куртки и увеличить свой товарооборот.

Оксана запланировала крупную закупку летнего товара и просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 30,000 гривен. Оксана всегда надеется только на лучшее и хочет быть готовой предложить своим клиентам хороший ассортимент товара (брюки, платься, сарафаны) по приемлемым ценам. Дополнительную прибыль Оксана планирует потратить на нужды своей семьи.
texts.en:
Oksana is married and she has an adult daughter named Valentina.  Oksana sells women's clothes at the local market, in Kahovka.  She has already taken some loans with Kiva before.  Thanks to her previous loan with Kiva she has been able to buy sweaters, cardigans, jackets and to increase her turnover.

Oksana is planning to buy large quantities of summer goods and she is requesting a loan of 30,000 hryvnia.  She is a woman with a very positive outlook, and  she wants to be ready to offer her customers a nice inventory of goods (pants, dresses, tunics) at affordable prices.  She plans to use her additional income to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase summer inventories - pants, dressess, tunics, etc.

loans.name: Saodatkhon

texts.ru:
Женщину на фотографии зовут Саодатхон. Ей 44 года. Она с семьей живет на районе Кубадиён. Она в течение 5 лет работает учительницей в школе и параллельно дома выращивает овощи и другие сельскохозяйственные культуры.    
Саодатхон обратилась за кредитом, чтобы обработать посеянный урожай. Она закончила весенний посев и настало время для его обработки. Саодатхон обратилась за кредитом с надеждой на то, что ей помогут, и она получит богатый урожай.
texts.en:
The woman in the photograph is called Saodat. She is 44 years old. She lives in the Qubadiyon region with her family. She has worked as a school teacher for a period of 5 years, and in addition she grows vegetables and other crops at her home. 

Saodatkhon applied for a loan in order to process already sown crops. She finished the spring sowing and it is time for processing it. Saodat applied for a loan in the hope that you will help her, and that she will get a rich harvest.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers in order to get a larger income

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy maize.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy tortillas, plates, napkins, salt shakers, vegetables, sauce bottles, beverages, tin foil, gas, oil, salt.

loans.name: Kokoé Félécité

texts.fr: Kokoé,54 ans est revendeuse et mère de quatre enfants.Propriétaire d'une boutique de produits alimentaires,Kokoé a commencé son activité commerciale en 2011.Elle souffre de manque de financement pour approvisionner sa boutique.Elle rêve d'avoir une boutique plus grande et de faire profiter ses revenus à ses enfants.
texts.en: 54-year-old Kokoé is a mother of four children. She sells food products out of her own shop, a business she started in 2011. Right now, Kokoé lacks the means to properly stock her shop. She dreams of one day having larger premises, so that her children may benefit from the profits.

loans.use: to purchase food products

loans.name: Mah

texts.fr:
Mah  est âgée  de 23 ans et célibataire. Elle vit chez son père dans une famille traditionnelle dans le quartier Médine de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Après son étude supérieure (sans emploi), elle s’essaya à plusieurs activités génératrice de revenu, mais sans succès. Finalement elle décida d’apprendre auprès de sa mère le commerce du ’’pop corn’’. 
Nantie de cet apprentissage aux cheveux de cette dernière, elle évolua seule en exerçant la même activité depuis maintenant un an. Sa force de vente est due à son courage, au sens élevé des affaires et également à son accueille chaleureux. 
Elle est à son 1er  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso et  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une machine à faire le ’’pop corn’’.  
Mah vend au comptant et souvent à crédit  chez elle à Médine à une clientèle mixte et envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel  de 100 000 FCFA, qui lui permettra  de subvenir à ses besoins et aider les parents dans les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en: Mah is 23 years old and unmarried. She lives with her father within a traditional family in the Médine district of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After pursuing higher education, she found herself unemployed. She attempted many revenue-generating activities, but to no avail. Finally, she decided to learn the "popcorn trade" from her mother. Now enriched with her mother's know-how, she decided to strike out on her own, which she has now been doing for the past year. Her strong profits come from her fortitude, her finely-tuned business sense and her welcoming character. This is her first loan with Soro Yiriwaso, which she is planning on using to purchase a popcorn machine. Mah sells popcorn for cash, and often credit, out of her home in Médine to a customer base made up of both men and women. She is planning on making a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA, which will allow her to meet her own needs as well as those of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a popcorn machine

loans.name: Monaliza

texts.en:
Monaliza works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Monaliza requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishing net, etc. for her business.

Monaliza has been in this business for one year now.

Monaliza would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fishing net, etc. for her business

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lorena works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending and raising livestock. Lorena is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fishing net, wood, and nails for fishing boat repair.

Lorena has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, wood, and nails for fishing boat repair

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers. Victoria has been in this business for 25 years. She earns more income from dried fish vending.

Victoria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 36 years old and married with three children.

Merlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, candies, biscuits, noodles, detergent soap, juice, coffee, etc. 

Merlinda has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from dressmaking.

Merlinda aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, candies, biscuits, noodles, detergent soap, juice, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is 25 years old and lives with his parents in the village of Tsovagyugh in the region of Gegharkunik. He has eight cows, two calves, two heifers, two bulls, a pig and ten chickens. He also cultivates wheat and potatoes on his plot of land. His mother sells milk, cheese, butter, meat and eggs to her loyal customers from Sevan city. 
Armen is very clever and hardworking young man who manages his farm well. He also is a first-year student at Yerevan State Pedagogical Institute studying History with the intention of becoming a magistrate. He does his best to manage his farm, earn high scores at university and learn as much as he can about his future profession.
All the income from his farming, however, barely covers the costs of operating the farm and leaves only a little part to meet his family’s needs. In light of his desire to continue his studies Armen is applying for this 250,000 AMD loan through Nor in order to pay his tuition for the second semester. This will greatly help alleviate the monetary burden on his family that is living in difficult financial conditions as it is.

loans.use: to pay his second semester's tuition at the university.

loans.name: Jhon Jaime

texts.es:
Más de 30 años de experiencia dan constancia de los excelentes trabajos de Jaime un mecánico que anteriormente se desempeñaba como conductor y en busca de mejores ingresos decidió volverse mecánico y que gracia a los microcréditos ha logrado la estabilidad de su negocio, brindando ayuda oportuna y de calidad a la hora de reparar un automóvil. 
Con el ánimo de superarse y crecer cada día como independiente solicita un crédito para la compra de herramienta y repuestos comúnmente solicitados por sus clientes, ya que quiere prestar un servicio oportuno y rápido, teniendo todo el material a la mano para cualquier calamidad que se le presente. 
Su gran sueño es poder mejorar y superar las condiciones de vida en las que vive actualmente con su familia constituida por su esposa y dos hijos.
texts.en:
Over 30 years of experience lend constancy to the excellent work of Jaime, a mechanic who used to work as a driver, and who, in search of a higher income, decided to become a mechanic. Thanks to the micro-loans he has received, he has achieved business stability, providing timely and high-quality help in repairing cars.

With the intention of bettering himself and growing as an independent business every day, he is requesting a loan to buy the tools and spare parts that are often requested by his customers. This is because he wants to offer a timely and convenient service, with all the equipment he needs at hand to resolve any problem that comes up.

His great dream is to be able to improve and move on from the living conditions in which he currently lives with his family, made up of his wife and two children.

loans.use: to buy tools and spare parts to provide a more timely and efficient service.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like spices, meat, vegetables, etc for her restaurant business.

Maria has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from buying and selling rice and meat vending.

Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like spices, meat and vegetables

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Basilia works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store.  Basilia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables and spices to sell in her vegetable stall.

Basilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and spices to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more wood for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods (fish, pepper, onion, etc.) in order to increase her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy used clothes for resale

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara tiene 39 años de edad, estudió hasta 6º grado ya que sus padres no la apoyaron por la situación económica,está acompañada y su pareja trabaja de albañil, vive con sus dos hijos que van a la escuela.

Ella se dedica desde hace años a la venta de tamales de pollo, actividad que le inculcó su madre y también 

pues fue la salida que encontraron para poder obtener ingresos para el hogar, su hija mayor le ayuda a repartir la venta en el mercado.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar mesas y sillas para su negocio y para comprar maíz ,de esa forma tendrá mejores ingresos y la necesidad quedara satisfecha.

El objetivo de Sara es seguir incrementando su negocio y que a su familia no le falte nada y seguir trabajando con nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Sara is 39 years old, and went as far as sixth grade in school, as her parents did not support her because of their financial situation. She has a partner, who works in construction. She lives with her two children, who go to school. 

She has been selling corn tamales for some years, a business that her mother taught her. This was also the way she found to obtain income for the household. Her oldest daughter helps her to distribute her product in the market. 

She needs a loan to buy tables and chairs for her business and to buy corn. This way she will have better income and her needs will be fulfilled. Sara's objective is to continue expanding her business, to continue working with our institution, and for her family not to want for anything.

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs for her business and to buy corn.

loans.name: Ana Rubia

texts.es:
Ana tiene 29 años de edad, actualmente vive con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos de edades 3 a 8 años y además espera un cuarto hijo.
Ana se dedica a los oficios domésticos ella cocina, lava,  plancha y hace algunas compras para consumo del hogar. Por su estado de embarazo le es difícil tener un empleo y además tiene la ilusión que después de recuperarse pondrá un negocio. 
El préstamo que ella está solicitando a CrediCampo lo necesita para poner el piso con ladrillo de cerámica y además reconstruir un pila da captación de agua para el consumo del hogar.
Su sueño es  poner un negocio de venta de ropa para generar un ingreso extra para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
29-year old Ana lives with her husband and their three children aged between 3 and 8; she is also expecting a fourth child.

Ana is a homemaker. She does the cooking, laundry, ironing and shopping. Because she is pregnant, it is difficult to have an outside job, and also she is thinking of starting a business once she has had the baby.

The loan she is seeking from CrediCampo is needed for ceramic floor tiles and also to construct a water tank for household use. Ana’s dream is to open a store selling clothing and generate more money to improve her children’s standard of living.

loans.use: buy ceramic floor tiles and also construct a water tank

loans.name: Francisco Evelio

texts.es:
Francisco de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado de educación básica. Esta acompañado, ya tiene nueve años de estar juntos,  es padre de dos hijas ambos menores de edad, una va al kinder que hay en la comunidad y la otra se queda en la casa con la madre. Su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios domesticos. Él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace más de 5 años, su padre es quien le enseño el respeto al trabajo.

Francisco ha sido un hombre responsable, el trabajo lo tiene cerca de su casa, el recorrido lo hace a pie, siembra en las tierras de su familia que es con quien realiza la actividad, y su horario de trabajo es de 6am a 11am.

El prestamo sera invertido en la compra de los insumos agricolas,como 4 sacos de abono, fertilizantes, semilla de maíz, pesticidas y herbicidas, para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados.  Dice que confia en que Dios le dara la oportunidad que su crédito sea aprobado y él pueda dar inicio a su siembra de maiz.

Su sueño es poder tener salud, tener siempre lo necesario para su hogar, trabajar duro para ir ahorrando ya que sueña con tener una casita de ladrillo para sus hijas que son para él lo mas importante. Que un dia ellas sean profecionales y sepan defenderse en la vida.
texts.en:
Francisco is 30 years old and went as far as the second grade of primary school. He has a partner and they have been together for nine years. He is the father of two daughters; both are minors. One goes to the kindergarten in the community and the other stays home with her mother. His life companion is a housewife. He has been farming for more than five years, and his father is the one who taught him to do farm work. 

Francisco has been a responsible man. The area he farms is close to his house and he goes there on foot. He farms his family's land and it is with them that he does his work. His work hours are from 6:00 a.m. to 11:00 a.m.

The loan will be used to purchase agricultural supplies, such as four bags of manure, fertilizers, corn seed, pesticides and herbicides, in order to farm 7000 m² of land. 

He says he trust that God will give him the chance for his loan to be approved, so that he will be able to begin planting his corn. His dream is to be healthy, to always have the basic necessities for his home, and to work hard so that he can start saving; as he dreams of having a brick house for his daughters, who are the most important thing for him. 

He wants them to someday be professionals and know how to get by in life.

loans.use: To buy 4 bags of manure, fertilizers, corn seed, pesticides and herbicides, for farming 7000 m² of land.

loans.name: Tisongmi Taba - Tamalgu Group

texts.en:
Mayisah is a 45-year-old, married woman. She lives with her husband and six children in Tamalgu, a community in Northern Ghana. She is the second squatting person from the right, as you face their group picture. Their group is called ‘Tisongmi Taba – Tamalgu’ women's association.

All the members are involved in the business of picking shea nuts and processing them into shea butter. They have been in the business for the past three years. They process high-premium shea butter, some of which is sold to aggregators (such as Star Shea Ghana) and exported to the European and USA markets. Mayisah sells shea butter to many other customers in Ghana, as well.

The group is therefore requesting for a loan of GHȼ 8,000 and Mayisah will buy 5 bags of shea nuts with her share of the loan for the processing of shea butter.

Mayisah hopes to increase her income. She will use her income to support her family to have regular food to eat, to buy educational materials for her children in school, and to repay this loan.

loans.use: To buy 5 bags of shea nuts with her share of the loan for the processing of shea butter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase damask cloth

loans.name: Liwayway

texts.en: Despite the hardship of living, Liwayway has the determination to uplift the living status of her family. She is 57 years old and blessed with seven children. Her husband is unable to do hard work due to health problems. Therefore, Liwayway is the one who does the household chores and provides the necessities for her family. For this reason, she aims to improve her vegetable vending business in order to earn a higher income. She wants to ask for additional capital of PHP 5,000 to buy more stocks of corn, peanuts, squash, eggplants, tomatoes and more vegetables to sell. Being a hard working mother, she believes that someday, she will improve the business as well as their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more stock of corn, peanuts, squash, eggplants and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Isabel is 59 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Isabel has a sewing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like needles, threads, zippers, and fabric for her business.

Isabel has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like needles, threads, zippers, and fabric

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing net and gasoline for fishing.

Maura has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Maura would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net and gasoline for fishing

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 47 years old and married, with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like shampoo and groceries.

Merlita has borrowed and paid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Ren's Group

texts.en:
Ren is originally from a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is a 32-year-old married mother of three children who are dependent on her and still in school. Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for 10 years. She can earn about 20,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs and manages to save about 13,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Ren has no prior loans with VisionFund. Now, she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 52 years old, married and has four children, two in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming coconuts in the Philippines. Merly requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to pay for the laborers' salaries on her coconut farm.

Merly has been farming coconuts for 16 years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Merly would like to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to pay for the laborers' salaries on her coconut farm

loans.name: Ann's Group

texts.en:
Ann is 61 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Mong Russey district of Battambang province. She has six children to take care of and they are in school in the local area. Rice farming is the primary source of her family’s income and she has been in this business for 15 years. With the current business, she can earn approximately 70,000 KHR per day and save about 20,000 KHR each day for future needs. 
This is the fifth micro loan for Ann with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Ann will use her portion to buy rice seed and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business to earn a larger income to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 37 years old and married with five children, two in school. Milagros works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, sugar, and noodles.

Milagros has been in this business for nine years.

In the future, Milagros would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, sugar, and noodles.

loans.name: Manna

texts.es:
Manna, es propietaria de una tienda en la que ofrece diferentes productos de la canasta básica, la atiende a tiempo completo, también elabora pupusas para vender de cinco de la tarde a ocho de la noche, le colabora su esposo, realizando estas actividades puede tener ingresos para aportar a los gastos del hogar. Ella vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos.
Comprara boquitas, dulces, granos básicos, aceite, bebidas, pan, harina, gas propano, quesillo, chicharrón, loroco, etc., abastecerá la tienda con nueva mercadería y tendrá los materiales que necesita para elaborar la venta de pupusas, espera mejorar su servicio y aumentar su productividad.
Su anhelo es continuar trabajando para tener más ingresos con los que cancelara su deuda y apoyara a sus hijos a culminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Manna is the owner of a store that offers various staple goods. She looks after the store full-time and she also makes pupusas (stuffed tortillas) to sell between 5:00 pm and 8:00 pm. Her husband also contributes. By accomplishing these tasks, she is able to make an income to pay for the household expenses. She lives with her husband and children.

She will buy snacks, candy, dry grains, oil, beverages, bread, flour, propane gas, fresh cheese, pork rinds, loroco (a vine flower bud from Central America, used in cooking), etc. She will stock the store with new merchandise and she will have the necessities to develop her pupusa sales. She hopes to improve her service and increase her productivity.

She hopes to continue working in order to have a larger income with which she will repay her debt and she will support her children to finish school.

loans.use: to buy snacks, candy, dry grains, oil, beverages, bread, flour, propane gas, fresh cheese, pork rinds, loroco (a vine flower bud from Central America, used in cooking), etc.

loans.name: German Enrriquez

texts.es:
German de 27 años de edad,  estudio hasta quinto grado, la necesidad de tener ingresos al hogar lo obligo a dejar la escuela y dedicarse a la agricultura junto a su padre y hermanos. Actualmente esta acompañado con una joven de 22 años, ya tienen 4 años de estar juntos, su pareja es la que se encarga de mantener la casa cuidadita y a la vez hacer todo lo que en la casa se necesita, la niña como esta pequeña pasa todo el dia con ella.

German se dedica a la agricultura desde aproximadamente 4 años,  su padre y su madre fueron quienes le inculcaron esto, él vive en el terreno de sus padres pero hace un mes compro un terrenito pequeño, por lo cual tubo que vender parte de la cosecha que saco del año pasado, porque la persona que le vendio le estaba pidiendo todo el dinero de un solo y dice que tubo que vender sus granos. 

Por esa razón, para poder producir este año no tiene dinero y es debido a eso que solicita el préstamo para poder comprar los insumos agricolas, como abono, pesticidas, herbicidas y semilla de maíz.

El terreno donde cultiva le queda a una distancia de media hora de su casa y lo hace caminando.

Con el préstamo podra solventar la necesidad que tiene de la compra de insumos y para poder terminar de pagar el terreno que compro para construir en un futuro.
Poder tener primeramente lo necesario para su familia, seguir cultivando ya que de eso es que puede sostener a su hija y esposa y en un futuro poder construir su casita don ahorita a comprado el terreno.
texts.en:
German is 27 years old, and left school after the fifth grade. The need bring money into the home forced him to leave education and make a living in agriculture alongside his father and brothers. He currently has a partner of four years, who looks after the house and does the household chores. They have a young daughter, who spends the day with her mother. 

German has worked as a farmer for around four years. His parents taught him the trade, and he lives on his parents plot of land. However, one month ago, he bought a small plot of land, for which he had to sell part of his harvest from last year, as the person selling the land to him was requesting upfront payment of the full amount and he says he had to sell his produce. 

This is why he doesn't have any money to grow crops this year, and, as a result, he is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs such as compost, pesticides, herbicides and corn seeds.

The land he grows his crops on is located half an hour away from his home, and he walks there.

The loan will enable him to buy the inputs he needs and finish paying for the land he bought to build a future. He wants to have what his family needs, continue growing crops, as this is how he supports his wife and daughter, and in the future, build a home on the land he has bought.

loans.use: to buy compost, pesticides, herbicides and corn seeds.

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es: Cruz es una persona de 24 años de edad, viven en el municipio Nahualá, departamento de Sololá, tiene dos hijas, la primera tiene 5 años de edad esta estudiando en la escuela de párvulos de la comunidad y la segunda tiene 2 años de edad todavía no asiste a la escuela, se dedica al cultivo de almácigos de café le genera buena ganancia, cuando no esta trabajando en su almacigo trabaja con vecinos en sus parcelas y le pagan por día trabajado, Cruz necesita un crédito por un monto de Q. 3,500.00 para comprar un lote de terreno, Cruz tiene planeado aumentar el tamaño de su almacigo y comprar más terreno para tener donde cultivar.
texts.en:
Cruz is 24 years old and lives in the municipality of Nahualá in Sololá department. He has two daughters; the first is five years old and goes to the local primary school, and the second is two years old and doesn't go to school yet. He grows coffee seedlings and this generates good earnings. 

When he is not working with his seedlings he works with his neighbors on their parcels of land and they pay him as a day laborer. 

Cruz needs a loan in the amount of 3,500 quetzals in order to buy a piece of land. He plans to increase the size of his coffee seedling operation and buy more land so that he has somewhere to grow them.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Narcista

texts.en:
Narcista is 43 years old, married and works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a buy-and-sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of coconut meat to sell.

Narcista has been in this business for eight years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Prom's Group

texts.en:
Prom is 63 years old and married with two children. He and his wife have been farming rice for 21 years and supplement their family’s income by working for others for a fee. 
Prom has been a member of VisionFund for three loans and completely paid back the past loans. As the group leader, he is asking for a new loan and will use his portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide for his farmland. He hopes this loan will enable him to increase his crop yield and make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for his farmland

loans.name: Chamroen's Group

texts.en:
Chamroen is a resident from a rural village of the Moung Russey district. She is a 49-year-old mother of seven children. The main sources of her family’s income are from rice farming and cassava growing, which she has been doing for 30 years. With her current business, she can earn about KHR 40,000 per day to spend on daily expenses. 
This is the second loan for Chamroen with VisionFund. She successfully paid back the previous loan with VisionFund. Now, she is leading her group to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it on labor and land plowing. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Ren's Group

texts.en:
Ren lives in a thatched-roof house in a rural village of the Mungkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province. Ren is 52 years old and widowed with four children. She earns a living through farming rice and selling grocery items and has been in this business for almost 29 years. To supplement the family's income, she also works as a paid worker. With her current business, she is able to earn approximately 28,000 KHR per day to support her family. 
This is the ninth loan for Ren with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a new loan. As the leader, Ren wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland. She hopes for better crop yields, selling it for a good price to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Nhessa

texts.en:
Nhessa is 40 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, and chips.

Nhessa has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like soap, shampoo, egg, chips, etc

loans.name: Norm's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Norm is 59 years old and married. She has five children. To support the family, she and her husband have been farming rice and working for others for a fee. The current business earns her family about KHR 38,000 per day to meet her family’s needs. 

Norm has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund Cambodia, for five cycles already and she successfully used the past loan to better support her family, so they have sufficient food. 

Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Norm is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Marady

texts.en:
Marady is 27 years old. He lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. He is a student and is also a reservation clerk at a hotel. He earns approximately $5 per day. 

Due to the lack of funds, Marady would like to apply for loan of $200 to pay for his tuition fees. This loan will help him complete his education and fulfill his dream. 

He expects to run a business after his graduation.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. Nora has been in this business for nine years now.

She requested a 29,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stock of bananas to sell.

In the future, Nora would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bananas to sell

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 52 years old and married with four children.  With children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Regina runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items.

She requested a 22,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

In the future, Regina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is 47 years old and married with six children. With one child still in school, Epifania works very hard to provide for them. Epifania's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her food vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 7,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor. Epifania is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is 47 years old and married. She has five children and three of them are currently in school. Genara and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Genara is taking out a housing loan amounting PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. She has been an NWTF borrower since 2013 and plans to recover through her fish vending.

With your help, Genara can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 56 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a retail gasoline business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of gasoline to sell.

Nida has borrowed and repaid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the retail gasoline business for eight years and also earns an income from a general store.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Nelinda

texts.en:
Nelinda is married with five children. She is 48 years old and has two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for eight years.
