Nelinda requested a 28,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy a variety of vegetables to sell.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rodellia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rodellia works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling crabs and seaweeds. 

Rodellia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional wood, paints, bamboo, etc. for her fishing business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional wood, paints, bamboo, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Josephine is 42 years old and has three children who are in school. Her house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her fish vending business and is committed to regaining what she lost. 

She is taking out a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. Josephine has been with NWTF since 2008 in her pursuit of rising out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Rolina

texts.en:
Rolina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years, and she earns more income from fish vending.

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fruit to sell. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruit to sell.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en: Lea is 21 years old and married with two children. With both of them currently in school, Lea works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like soy sauce, vinegar, canned goods, juice, milk, snack foods, soft-drinks, etc. to sell. She has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items. In the future, Lea would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like soy sauce, vinegar, canned goods, juice, milk, snack foods, soft-drinks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Shiela works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and raising pigs.  Shiela is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell for her buy-and-sell rice grains business.

Shiela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Mario is 18 years old and is the last of the three children in the family. His mother, Victorina, who is the member of NWTF, supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Mario is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering degree and is currently in the 1st year of this 5-year course. He is borrowing 14,000 to pay tuition fees for the 2nd semester of the school year 2014-2015. When he graduates, Mario plans to be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
Faustino de 63 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado debido a que su familia tenía pocos recursos económicos, no pudo continuar con sus estudios, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen cuatro hijos.

Faustino se dedica a la agricultura, siembra hortalizas, comenta que decidió dedicarse a este trabajo gracias a que cuando era pequeño le ayudaba a un tío en la siembra y aprendió esta labor y fue cuando decidió hacer su propia siembra de  hortalizas,  tiene mas de 15 años de dedicarse a este trabajo y recibe ayuda de sus 4 hijos para cultivar, no tiene definido un horario de trabajo debido a que las hortalizas necesitan de mucho cuido y en ocasiones están pendiente de su cultivo durante la noche.

Él necesita muchísimo de este  crédito para la preparación de la tierra, la compra de insumos, fertilizantes y abono, el préstamo se servirá de mucho ya que podrá sacar adelante el cultivo.

Sus planes a futuro son tener más terreno para sus cultivos, obtener más cosecha y tener más ganancias para darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia, también desea poder ampliar su casa para poder vivir cómodamente.
texts.en:
Faustino is 63 years old, and has a third-grade education due to the fact that his family had a few financial resources, so he  wasn't able to continue with his studies. He is married and his wife works in the home. They have four children.

Faustino farms, growing vegetables. He says he that he decided to do this work because when he was very young he helped his uncle with the farming and learned this work; and that was when he decided to grow vegetables on his own. He has been doing this work for more than 15 years and he receives help with the farm work from his four children. He has no defined work schedule due to the fact that the vegetables need a lot of care and sometimes they need his attention during the night. 

He greatly needs this loan in order to prepare the land and buy agricultural supplies, fertilizers and manure. The loan will be a great help to him, as he will be able to carry out his farming. 

His future plans are to have more land for his crops, to obtain a bigger harvest and have more earnings to provide better living conditions for his family. He also wishes to be able to expand his home in order to live more comfortably.

loans.use: To prepare the land, to buy agricultural supplies, fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita, 27 years old, started a tailoring business three years ago and she earns around 200 INR per day. She even conducts training for the girls in the village. She is a B.A. graduate. Anita is married and has a son who goes to pre-school. Her husband is a collection agent. His income isn’t stable and keeps fluctuating. So there is a lot of dependency on Anita’s income. The family has a house and some cultivatable land but their productivity is low.
  
Anita is a very confident, enterprising and hardworking woman. She wants to expand her business, as there is an increase in the number of good customers. She is seeking a loan of 15,000 INR to buy a sewing machine so that she can service more customer orders and earn more. She hopes to save enough for her son’s education for a bright future.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Chimbuko Group

texts.en:
Ashely is a father of two sons and two daughters, who are at school. He is thirty and is married. He has had a general store selling dry food items such as sugar, maize, baking flour, salt, soap, etc., for six years now. He starts business from 07am to 09pm daily and is able to make a fair profit each month. 

This is his sixteenth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans (all of which were paid back successfully) to restock his shop with more products. His business now has more items than previously, and he thanks Kiva for the support. He earned a profit which he used to repair his house, covered school fees, and home food expenses. Ashely will use this loan to buy products such as sugar, maize flour, cooking oil, etc., in large quantities. He dreams of owning a car. 

He will share this loan with his loan group" Chimbuko" which totals 8 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy products such as sugar, maize flour, cooking oil, etc., in large quantities

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to achieve her goals within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will be successful. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a  Kiva borrower. She has 2 children. She describes herself as self motivated. She operates a retail business where she sells paints. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area and has a variety of customers. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more paint for her business. Her business goal is to reach higher heights within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a good life. She will use the anticipated profits to add more inventory.

loans.use: to buy more paint for her business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a divorced woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 7 years to 15 years. She describes herself as optimistic. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a populated area and her primary customers are frequent. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

Mary will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have frequent cash flow and a good lifestyle. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 44 years old and has four children. She is married and one of her children is in school. She is in the agricultural business of farming rice in the Philippines. She has been farming rice for 6 years now, and has borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Teresita requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to pay laborers' wages during the harvesting. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to pay laborers' wages during the harvesting.

loans.name: Maria Magdalina

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Maria Magdalina works hard to support her family. She has a business of selling sand and gravel in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising chickens. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more sand and gravel to sell through her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sand and gravel to sell.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic, forty years old, is a hardworking married woman. She has two children who are both in school.

For the past ten years Marivic has sold clothes, towels, curtains etc. to earn an income. She is applying for a 21,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more inventory to sell. Her desire is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of clothes, towels, curtains etc. to sell

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha, who is married, works hard to support her family. For the past eight years she has produced and sold these toasted peanut cakes in the Philippines.

Editha is applying for a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy peanuts and other ingredients for her yummy product. She would like to provide her family with a secure future.

loans.use: to buy peanuts and other ingredients for her product

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 23,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Paz has been in this business for 12 years. Paz earns additional income from a bakery business.

Paz has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Elisea

texts.en:
Elisea is 68 years old, married, and has two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soft drinks, rice, groceries, etc.

Elisea has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soft drinks, rice, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 45 years old, married, and has one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Judith is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Judith has been raising pigs for 4 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready to wear clothing.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell scrap materials business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling dry goods. Josephine is borrowing 9,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more scrap materials to sell for her buy and sell scrap materials business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more scrap materials to sell

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 48 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Teodora has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business direct selling Personal Collection and Natasha products in the Philippines. Nenita has been in this business for nine years now.

She requested a 12,500 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more products from Personal Collection and Natasha to sell.

Nenita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products from Personal Collection and Natasha to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 44 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Sarah runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items like soft drinks, canned goods, sanitary pads, cooking oil, cereals, and juice to sell.

She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, sanitary pads, cooking oil, cereals, and juice. 

Sarah would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like soft drinks, canned goods, sanitary pads, cooking oil, cereals, and juice to sell.

loans.name: Jose Serapio

texts.es: Don José, tiene 54 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en una aldea del Municipio de Gracias, Lempira. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura, de granos básicos, lleva aproximadamente 25 años de dedicarse al cultivo de café, esta producción la vende en la misma zona. Esta finca la ha mantenido en buenas condiciones por la inversión de varios prestamos, actualmente solicita otro por 15,000 lempiras para comprar mas fertilizantes y mejorar la finca. Su idea es seguir produciendo café y lograr tener una familia digna.
texts.en:
.

José, age 54, is married with three children whom he lives with in a village in the city of Gracias, Lempira. He has worked his whole life in farming of staple grains, and for almost 25 years he has worked in cultivating coffee. He sells his products in the same region. José has kept his farm in good condition with the investment of several loans. Currently he requests another for 15,000 Lempiras to buy more fertilizer and improve the farm. His idea is to continue producing coffee and have a dignified family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to improve his coffee farm.

loans.name: Kimeng

texts.en:
Kimeng, 26, lives in a rural area of the Kampong Siem district of Kampong Cham province. She is married with one kid. 

The family’s main sources of income are from planting cassava and farming rice in the local village. She has been in this business for eight years. 

Kimeng has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the loan which has helped relieve the family's burden and improve. 

Now, she is applying for a new loan to pay for the rental land needed in order to continue growing her cassava and rice. With this loan, she hopes to make more income so she can make a better living.

loans.use: to pay for rental land in order to grow cassava and rice

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a forty-four-year-old married female with six children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She sells secondhand clothes, mainly children's wear, along with cocoa farming which helps her to cover her family's daily expenses. She has been in the business for five years and is very hardworking. She is borrowing 500,000 UGX to buy used clothes for selling.

loans.use: to buy used clothes for selling.

loans.name: Norn

texts.en:
Aged 53 years, Norn is a rural villager from the Kampong Siem district, earning a living through planting soybeans and farming rice as her only main sources of the family’s income. She has been in this business for 31 years. She has six children, three of whom are still dependent and in school.

Norn has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. She is now applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yields and sell it for a good price to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Yorn's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Tbaung Khum district of Kampong Cham province, Yorn is a 61-year-old mother of four children. Cassava planting has been the only source of her family’s income to make a living for 42 years. The current business earns her about KHR 27,000 per day. 

Yorn’s Group consists of three members who live in the same village. Yorn is in her second cycle with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund Cambodia. 

Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yield, so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Mangala

texts.en:
Mangala is 50 years old, married and has two sons and two daughters. Both the daughters are married. Her elder son is in the decorating business and is a collection agent.

Mangala started a stationery shop seven years ago and now her younger son is running it. The shop is doing a good business and is the main source of income for the family. Since it is the start of the new academic year, Mangala is requesting a loan to add the collection of school stationery required for the students at her shop. What distinguishes this project is that it is the only one in their area. She hopes with this loan the sales will increase, which will help her improve the family's income and enable them to live in better conditions.

Mangala and her son hope to expand the shop in the future and have a variety of stationery for sale.

loans.use: To buy more school stationery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, beans, and other items

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina is 39 and lives in Jarmundi village, Dumka, Jharkhand. She is married and has a daughter and two sons. Her daughter is married while her sons are studying. Rina is a housewife. Her husband is a carpenter and works from home. Rina also helps him in her free time. The family has four acre of cultivable land but they have mortgaged it for their daughter’s marriage expenses. Rina is requesting a loan of 13,000 INR to repay the mortgage and get back their cultivable land so that she can cultivate crops and earn more income for her family. 

Rina hopes to save enough for her sons’ education so they can get good jobs.

loans.use: to repay the mortgage and get back their cultivable land

loans.name: Murta

texts.en:
Murta is a married, 45 years old, and living in a remote village in Jharkhand, India. She lives with her family of six, including her husband and four children. She is very energetic, hardworking and enthusiastic and always devotes her time to her family. She is a member of the local NGO ‘MESP’.

Murta runs a dairy farm. She started her business with a very small budget. Over the years, the business is doing well and she has gained some profit. She has two buffaloes and one cow on her farm. She sells about 25 liters of milk per day and earns 500 INR, which is not sufficient to nourish her big family.
 
Since there is a good demand for milk in this area, she plans to expand her business. She wants to take a loan of 18,000 INR to buy one more cow for her farm. She wants to secure her family with all the basic needs. She wants her children to be well educated and get a good job.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Sreylim's Group

texts.en:
Sreylim, 39, is married with two children residing in a rural village of the Oun Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province. To support the family, she has been farming rice for twenty years while her husband works as a worker to gain more income to better support the family. Together, they can earn about KHR30,000 per day and can save about KHR10,000 each day for future needs. 

Sreylim is a first cycle client with VisionFund. She is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more rice to increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Monrovia Group

texts.en:
Mohamed, who is in his late 50s, is a father of five schooling children. He is married and supports his family by running a shop selling natural medicines. He has been in this business for six years now and is able to make a small profit each month. Mohamed operates his business from 07:30am to 06:30pm daily. 

This is his fourth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans (all of which were paid back successfully) to buy a fridge and to restock his shop with medicines. Mohamed received a profit which he used to cover his family's welfare expenses and school fees. He also covered house building expenses. He dreams that one day he will be able to expand his shop more. Mohamed will use this loan to buy a motorbike for his business.

He will share this loan with his loan group "MONROVIA" which consist of three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for his business.

loans.name: Rositas De Querarani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSITAS DE QURARANI” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Candelaria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de leche y venta de queso.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Candelaria es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción de leche; da a conocer que este negocio fue un negocio familiar, ya que ella desde niña ayudaba en la lechería de sus padres, cuando se casó decide implementar un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ganado vacuno) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo criará en su estancia para poder comercializar la leche. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le el crédito que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The community bank "Rositas de Querarani" [Little Roses of Querarani] will begin its first semester with Pro Mujer, as part of the Copacabana Focal Center. It is made up of eight members, and is run by a board of directors, of which Candelaria is President.

The businesses that the bank members have are varied, among them: milk sales and cheese sales. The loan that they will take out will benefit small businesses of which Candelaria is a member. She comments that it is the first time she is joining Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a promoter of the institution that went to visit her at her house.

She currently has a milk production business. She informs us that this was a family business, and that she used to help her parents in the dairy when she was a girl. When she got married, she decided to start an independent business.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase capital (purchase cattle), that she will get from the sellers in the city of El Alto, and which she will later raise on her farm to be able to sell the milk.

This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is married and has four children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the loan that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself as patient. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a nice area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase more vegetables. She hopes that in the future, her business will improve financially. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is a 35-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 4 years to 17 years. He describes himself to be determined. 

He operates a retail business where he sells vegetables and cereals. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a village, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be theft. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables and cereals. 

His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be independent.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables and cereals.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Hello World! Meet 22-year-old Jackline, a farmer living with her family on their five-acre piece of land in the Litein area of South Rift Kenya. She loves farming, and it is her main source of income. She raisies poultry, has dairy cows and grows tea. Her biggest challenge regarding her farm is the area’s bad infrastructure.

Jackline wishes to construct a dairy unit for her cows, as she believes that this will help improve her cows’ productivity and so increase her income. This is why she is applying for a 50,000 KES loan through Juhudi Kilimo to help her achieve this. The increase in income will help her cover her child’s school fees and help her venture into more farming projects.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Leones

texts.en:
Leones is 41 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as bread, soft-drinks and other groceries. In the future Leones would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Afusa

texts.en:
Afusa is a forty-year-old divorced female with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She has a food stall where she cooks food for selling. She has been in the business for three years and wishes to have a big restaurant supplying big companies in town and doing outside catering services. 

However, she faces the challenges of thieves and seasonality changes. She is a very hardworking woman who cares for the well-being of her four children. Afusa is requesting a loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is twenty four years old and lives in Hoima Uganda. He is a single, hard working man and works seven days a week. 

He started a milk selling business in January 2014. He hopes to expand his business.  Bad weather and poor storage facilities hinder his business.

He is acquiring a loan to purchase milk and other related equipment like cans.

loans.use: to purchase milk and other related equipment like cans

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
El trabajo del campo es una de las labores más difíciles hoy en día por el gran esfuerzo que se debe hacer para progresar, pero cesar es un hombre que nunca se ha rendido a pesar del clima o las circunstancias que puedan pasar, el siempre está dispuesto a conseguir los recursos para su familia.
Se levanta desde primera hora de la mañana para desplazarse a distintas fincar para cumplir con obligaciones laborales. Este oficio lo alterna con la venta de leche que obtiene de sus propias vacas y adicional a esto tiene unos pequeños cultivos de plátano que también vende en la plaza de mercado.
El desea aumentar su capital de trabajo para garantizar el sostenimiento de sus negocios y es esta la razón que lo lleva a solicitar un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agropecuarios tales como fertilizante, riegos y pesticidas para aplicarlo a sus cultivos y garantizar su calidad.
texts.en: Farm work is one of the most difficult jobs today because of the great effort that one has to do in order to progress, but Cesar is a man who has never given up due to weather or circumstances that can happen. He is always available to obtain resources for his family. He gets up from the first hour of the morning to travel to different farms to fulfill his work obligations. This job he alternates with the sale of milk which he obtains from his own cows, and in addition to that, he has some small banana crops which he also sells in the market. He desires to increase his working capital to guarantee the support of his businesses. This is the reason that brings him to request a loan to invest in the purchase of farming supplies such as fertilizers, irrigation, and pesticides to use them on his crops and guarantee their quality.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to use on his crops.

loans.name: Sreymom's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Kampong Cham province’s Ou Reang Ov district, Sreymom is 22 years old, married, and has two children, all of whom are still small. She has earned a living through farming rice and planting cassava for three years. She can earn about 30,000 KHR per day from the current business and can save about 10,000 KHR each day for the future needs. 

Sreymom’s group consists of three members who live in the same village and they are all in their first cycled with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Chhoern

texts.en:
Chhoern is age 57 and married. She lives in a rural village of the Kampong Siem district of Kampong Cham province. She has eight children. 

To make a living, she has been planting cassava for 39 years and earns about 30,000 KHR per day. 

Chhoern has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now, she is asking for a loan to renovate her old house. She hopes to have a decent house for her family to live in.

loans.use: to renovate her old house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.ru:
Иброхим проживает в Спитаменском районе. Он очень добрый приветливый и трудолюбивый человек. Ему 56 лет. Имеет двоих детей. У Иброхима дружная семья. Его жена Мавлюда заботливая мать. Она  пенсионерка, негде не работает. Помогает мужу в откармливания  крупно рогатого скота. Семья Иброхима вот уже несколько лет подряд занимаются животноводством. Достигнуть успеха в животноводстве дело не легкое, надо иметь не малого опыта в этой сфере. Иброхим откармливает скот до определенного веса, потом продает их на рынке. Он на полученные деньги от продажи скот обеспечивает семью, понемножку откладывая денег, отремонтировал дом. 
Иброхим хотел бы еще увеличить поголовье скатов, но для покупки скота ему не хватает денежных средств. Поэтому Иброхим обратился в МДО Арванд за кредитом. Он очень надеется на поддержку организации и выражает свои благодарности МДО Арванд. Иброхим в будущим планирует  по глубже реализовать свою деятельность и приумножить количество скот.
texts.en: Ibrohim is 56 and lives in the Spitamen district. He is a very kind, friendly, and hard-working person. He has two children and a close-knit family. His wife, Mavluda, is a caring mother. She is retired and helps her husband feed the cattle. Ibrohim's family has been in the animal husbandry business for a few years already. It is a difficult job and requires a good amount of experience. Ibrohim fattens the cattle until they are a certain weight and then sells them at the market. He uses the profits to provide for his family while saving some money to make repairs on the house. Ibrohim would like to have more cattle but does not have enough money to buy them. He has applied for a loan with MDO Arvand. He hopes for their support and expresses his gratitude to the organization. In the future, Ibrohim plans to expand his business and continue to buy more cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Gauri

texts.en:
Gauri, 37, lives in Jarmundi village, Dumka, Jharkhand. She is married and has two sons. She has run a dairy farm for the last ten years. She has two cows and two buffaloes. She sells about 20 liters of milk per day and earns Rs 600. Her elder son helps his mother with the dairy farm, and the younger son is studying in school.

Gauri is a member of “MESP”, a local NGO. She is requesting a loan of 18,000 INR to buy food for the cows and to improve the cow shed.

Gauri hopes to have a bigger shed with more cows, to run the business on a larger scale and put an end to the poverty. She also wishes to give a good education to her younger son.

loans.use: to buy food for the cows and improve the shed.

loans.name: Purni

texts.en:
Purni is a member of the local NGO, “MESP”, which is a good platform for enterprising women located in Jarmundi, Dumka, Jharkhand. She is 49 years old and lives with her husband and two sons. Her elder son helps with his mother’s business, while the younger one is studying in the local school.

Purni has been running a fish trading business for a few years now with the help of her husband. Her husband usually purchases fish from the wholesale market, while Purni sells them to the customers in the weekly markets. She attends weekly markets in five different villages, and they also have a small shop in the market. She sells about 10-20 kg of fish every day and earns a profit of 400 INR. 

Purni wants to increase the volume of her business, for which she is requesting a loan to purchase fish in bulk and then resell them.

Purni dreams of providing a better education for her son, as she believes that education is the pillar of success. She also wants to construct a house for residential purposes.

loans.use: to purchase more fish.

loans.name: Conseleta

texts.en:
Conseleta is a married woman. She describes herself to be passionate. 

She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a populated area, and her primary customers are frequent. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of funds. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have frequent cash flow and a good lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and has five children ranging in age from nine to fourteen years. When asked, she describes herself as passionate.

For the past three years Mary has sold charcoal. She sells in a busy area and has frequent customers. Her biggest business challenge is inadequate capital.

Mary is applying for a 20,000 KES loan through SMEP to buy more charcoal to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to pay the school fees for her children and save. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. She envisions a future with a good cash flow and lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Delsa

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Delsa works hard to support her family. She has a business selling personal products in the Philippines and also earns additional income from clothing sales and her general store.

Delsa has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She is applying for a 10,000 PHP in order to buy more personal products to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school and college.

loans.use: to buy more personal products to sell.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher lives in Hoima, Uganda and sells cement, iron sheets and other hardware items alongside produce, airtime and petrol in jerrycans. 

He is a married, hardworking man charged with the responsibility of taking care of three children, two of whom attend school. He desires to educate his children to higher levels and improve his standard of living. Limited capital and high transport costs affect his business.

Christopher is acquiring a loan to buy more cement, nails, paint, iron bars and iron sheets to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cement, nails, paint, iron bars and iron sheets to sell.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells bananas, tomatoes, eggs and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a vibrant location and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of eggs. Her business goal is to own a bigger stall within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. This is her first loan with SMEP Micro Finance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy stock of eggs

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en: Felomina, 44 years of age, is married to a farmer and blessed with three children. She has managed a retail store in their village for almost three years and earns a net income of PHP 200 daily. Her net income is usually spent on the school allowances of their children. Due to insufficient capital to run her business she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to purchase noodles, milk, eggs, cooking oil, and beverages to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase noodles, milk, eggs, cooking oil, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a produce dealer in Hoima, Uganda. She sells maize, beans and rice and she works six days a week. She is single and charged with the responsibility of taking care of one child age two. Violet started her business in 2011 to boost her family's income. She intends to expand her business into new markets. However, price fluctuations hinder her business.

Violet will use the money to buy rice, maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice, maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio, es acompañado, tienen la dicha de ser padres de una niña de un año, ambas dependen económicamente de él, todos viven juntos, trabaja de forma independiente en el cultivo de maíz y frijol, su jornada de trabajo inicia a las 6:00 a.m. y finalizan a la 1:00 p.m., oficio que aprendió dentro de su familia. 
Con el inicio de la temporada de lluvia está planeando todo para realizar sus cultivos, comprara abono, fertilizantes, semilla e insecticidas, son materiales de mucha utilidad para preparar el terreno y evitar el peligro de plagas. Espera que sea una productividad mayor, mejorar las ventas e ingresos con los que resarcirá la deuda y cubrirá las necesidades básicas de su familia.
Su sueño es apoyar a su hija para que en futuro sea una profesional y remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Julio is married, and has the joy of being a parent to a one year-old girl. He lives with his daughter and wife, who are both financially dependent on him.  He works independently farming corn and beans: a trade he learned from his family. His work day starts at 6:00 am and ends at 1:00 pm. 

With the onset of the rainy season, he is in the midst of planning for his crops; he will use the loan to buy manure, fertilizer, seeds, and insecticides, which are very useful materials to prepare the soil and avoid the risk of pests. He hopes that this will cause him to increase production, and improve sales and revenues to repay his loan and cover his family’s basic needs.

His dream is to support his daughter so that she can be a professional in the future, and to renovate his home.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, seeds, and insecticides.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Doña Ana, tiene 56 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y reside junto a ellos en un sector del Municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Siempre le ha gustado el comercio y por necesidad de obtener sus propios ingresos, hace dos años que decidió vender mercadería como ser ropa nueva y usada, calzado, carteras y otros productos que le piden. Este negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante y por encargos. También recibe un ingreso por alquilar un apartamento. El préstamo que solicita es por 6,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar ropa para vender y va cancelar una pequeña deuda que tiene con una persona. Su plan es seguir creciendo con el negocio y seguir invirtiendo.
texts.en: Ana is 56 years old.  She is a single mother with two children and she lives with them in a sector of the Municipality of Choloma, Cortes.  She has always liked the trade business and, out of the need to earn her own wages, two years ago she decided to sell merchandise, such as new and used clothing, footwear, wallets and other goods that she is asked for.  Business is carried out by traveling door-to-door and by order.  She also receives income for renting out an apartment.  The loan that she is requesting is for 6,000 lempiras, with which she will buy clothing to sell and cancel a small debt that she has with someone.  Her plan is to continue growing her business and keep investing.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell and to cancel a small debt the she has with another person

loans.name: Rithy's Group

texts.en:
Rithy is the leader of this two-member group applying for a 1,400,000 KHR loan. She has two schoolchildren and lives in a village in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She grows rice on her two-hectare paddy, which works out to earn her about 31,000 KHR a day.

Rithy received a previous loan through Vision Fund, which she successfully paid back. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crop. She highly believes that she can get a good yield to better support her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her rice crop

loans.name: Mayra Esther

texts.es: Mayra tiene 24 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida. Ella trabaja junto con su suegra en la venta de antojitos típicos desde hace un año aproximadamente. Mayra es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora quien junto a su compañero de vida mantienen la economía del hogar. Mayra solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un cuarto dado que las paredes se encuentran deterioradas. Con el monto solicitado comprará ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro.
texts.en:
Mayra is 24 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner. For about a year she has been working with her mother-in-law selling traditional snacks. Mayra is a very hard working and enterprising woman who, along with her life partner, maintains the household economy. 

Mayra is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the construction of a room given that the walls have deteriorated. With the amount requested, she will buy bricks, cement, sand and iron.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand and iron to build a room.

loans.name: Serena Group

texts.en:
Chufaa is in her mid 30s and has three schooling children. She is a divorcee and supports her family by managing a shop selling clothes and other women's beauty products. She has been in this enterprise for three years now. Chufaa sells from 7 am to 6:30 pm daily and is able to receive a very good profit each month. 

She has been a borrower of Tujijenge Tanzania before, but she took a rest after a long period of taking loans. She is now getting back to improving her business. She has seen more benefits from Kiva's support and she believes that through Kiva, she will be able to manage another big shop and greatly improve her family life. Chufaa is applying for a loan to be apportioned among Serena, her six-member group. The group members will be accountable for paying back the loan. 

Chufaa will use her portion of the loan to buy new inventory of clothes for her shop.

loans.use: to buy new inventory of clothes for her shop.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Being a responsible housewife, Irene runs a small retail store within her community to help her husband gain income. She is now 36 years old and blessed with three siblings. Together with her husband, they aspire to become financially stable in the future. In this regard, she is aiming to improve her small retail store in order earn a higher income. Having inadequate capital, she would like to take a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, soft drinks, snack foods, candies, laundry soaps and beverages to resell. Through this loan, she is hoping that she will be able to further improve the business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, snack foods, candies, laundry soaps and beverages to resell

location.town: Brgy. Ineangan, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Dúo Lirio De Los Valles Group

texts.es:
Dúo: Lirio De Los Valles

Dúo formado por José Luis de 26 años de edad eñ se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos como lo son: maíz, frijol, chile pimiento, chile picante. Por medio de sus créditos han logrado crecer en sus ventas e invertir más. Agradece a Kiva porque por medio de la ayuda de la que le han dado está superándose y esto es de alegría para ellos porque está ayudando a su familia. Sus pago los ha hecho con puntualidad.esta solicitando este credito para la compra de semillas para el cultivo.
texts.en:
Duo: Lirio De Los Valles

The Duo consists of José Luis who is 26 years old and makes a living planting basic grains such as corn, beans, bell peppers and hot peppers. Through their loans, they have managed to increase sales and invest more. He thanks Kiva because through the help they have given him, he is doing better, and that brings them happiness because it's helping their family. 

He has made his payments on time. He is asking for this loan in order to buy seeds for cultivation.

loans.use: to buy seeds for cultivation

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes to sell. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a competitive area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to own a big shop within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Micro Finance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to add more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.use: to buy stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel is 42 years old and married with one child.  

She is in the agricultural business, raising pig in the Philippines. Anabel requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Anabel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Banabas

texts.en:
Banabas, age 28, lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is married with one child who is five months old. He is an electrician who has been in service for the last four years. Produce buying and selling supplements his income. He desires to expand his business although debtors affect his business as they take a long time to pay.

Banabas is acquiring credit to restock his supply of beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans to sell

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Antonieta is 44 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

She has a buy and sell of dried fish business in the Philippines. Antonieta requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell.

Antonieta has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Hajie

texts.en: Hajie, 23 years old, is from Calabuanan, Baler, Aurora. His father is a farmer while his mother stays at their house to do the household chores. His dream is to have a diploma. To have a decent and profitable job drives him to take the Microfinance Technology Course. However, his parents cannot provide the money for his tuition fee. Thus, he is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 from Kiva lenders thru ASKI. Hajie shared that he will be very happy if the lenders will grant his loan request for it will open doors for him to help his family financially.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition fee

loans.name: Fedencia

texts.en:
Fedencia is 60 years old and married with three children.

Fedencia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Fedencia has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and earns additional income from raising livestock.

Fedencia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pineapples, melons, chayote, cucumbers, potatoes, tomatoes, cabbage, watermelon, green beans, beans, corn, rice, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy urea, fertilizer, foliar spray and Gramoxone to help her cultivation of coffee

loans.name: Mirando Al Exito Group

texts.es:
Sofía pertenece a la  Alcancía Comunal “MIRANDO AL EXITO”, lleva el cargo de tesorera,  el grupo está formada por vecinos que viven en la mismo zona, es un grupo unido con muchas ganas de seguir adelante para obtener prosperidad.
Sofía tiene 38 años de edad es conviviente y madre de cinco hijos. Ella se  dedica a la venta de tamales desde niña; a la vez  también se dedica  a la  venta  de bebidas  en su mismo domicilio. Su calidad de vida de Sofía  ha mejorado bastante  ya que ahora tiene más ingresos y así puede ayudar con los gastos de su hogar.
Sofía invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su  negocio. Ella  planea poner un restaurante.
La Sra. Sofía es la persona que se encuentra sentada con polo celeste  alrededor  de los más integrantes del grupo.
texts.en:
Sofía belongs to the group "Mirando al exito" (looking for success). She is the treasurer of the group. The group is made up of neighbors who all live in the same zone. It is a group with a sense of solidarity and a desire to get ahead and achieve prosperity. 
Sofía is 38 years old, married, and has 5 children. Since she was a young girl, she has made a living selling tamales. She also sells drinks with the tamales, an enterprise she runs from home. Sofía's quality of life has improved a lot now that she is making more money and she is able to help with household expenses. 
Sofía will invest the loan in purchasing more merchandise for her business. She plans on opening a restaurant. 
Sofía is the one sitting in a blue shirt in the picture.

loans.use: purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, trabaja en el campo cultivando granos básicos (maíz y frijol), lo hace con ayuda de su abuelo, traba de seis de la mañana a una de la tarde, su ventaja es que trabaja en el mismo lugar de su residencia, vive solo y no tiene hijos.
Utilizara el crédito para comprar abono, insecticidas,  fertilizantes, plaguicidas y semilla, son los insumos necesarios que utilizara para aumentar su producción, mejorar la calidad de su cosecha y continuar generando ingresos con los que cumplirá puntualmente con sus compromisos económicos.
Su sueño es aumentar la rentabilidad de su negocio para tener un estilo de vida más digno.
texts.en:
José works in the countryside growing corn and beans. His grandfather helps him. He works from six in the morning to one in the afternoon. He is lucky in that his fields are in the same place as his house. He lives alone and has no children.

José plans to use the loan money to buy manure, insecticide, fertilizer, and seeds. These are the items he needs in order to increase production, improve the quality of the harvest, and continue generating income so he can make his repayments on time.

His dream is to make his farm more profitable so he can have a better standard of living.

loans.use: buy manure, insecticide, fertilizer, and seeds

loans.name: Zokir

texts.ru:
Зокир мужчина  в возрасте 54 года. У него большой двор где держит скота. Он женат и имеет 4 детей. Он обратился в Арванд узнав, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку. Он живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. У него среднее  образование,  Жена  Зокира также имеет среднее образование. Он  занимается садоводством , а также  подрабатывает строя  и ремонтируя дома. Жена работает в дехканском хозяйстве,и помогает мужу содержать семью. Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Зокир занимается садоводством и от продажи фруктов и овощей содержит большую семью.Дети помогают семье внося свой вклад в семейный бюджет. Старший сын на заработках в Российской Федерации . Жена также помогает ему по уходу за земельным участком и скотом.
Для получения хорошего урожая и увеличения доходности  Зокиру надо лучше ухаживать за садом и во время вносить удобрения  в почву. Поэтому она обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку минеральных удобрений и инвентаря для ухода за садом. Зокир заранее благодарит "Арванд" в оказании помощи.
texts.en:
Zokir is a 54-year-old man who is married and has 4 children.  He has decided to seek Arvand's help in getting a loan after finding out about them.  He lives with his family in a rural area, and both he and his wife have the equivalent of a high school education.  He grows fruits and vegetables for a living, and also has a large yard where he keeps cattle.  In addition, he earns money on the side by building and repairing peoples' houses.  His wife works on a dekhan farm, and helps her husband support their family.  Their children also do their part to support the family.  His oldest son is a migrant worker in Russia.  Zokir's wife also does her part by helping tend to their crops and cattle.  

To have a good harvest and be as profitable as possible, Zokir needs to take better care of his plot of land and sow it with fertilizer at the right time.  With this in mind, he's seeking a loan through Arvand to buy mineral fertilizers and gardening tools, and would like to thank Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and gardening tools

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel tiene 43 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán, departamento de Sololá, tiene dos hijas; la primera tiene 21 años de edad trabaja en una maquila, y la segunda tiene 19 años de edad también trabaja en una maquila, se dedica a comprar y vender banano, en su terreno tiene plantaciones de banano y café, Miguel solicita un crédito por un monto de Q. 8,000.00  para comprar banano y luego venderlo, tener una buena cantidad de mercadería le deja una mejor ganancia y con ello darles una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Miguel is 43 years old and he lives in the municipality of Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán in the department of Sololá.  He has two daughters; the oldest is 21 years old and works in a factory and the youngest is 19 years old and also working in a factory.  He makes a living buying and selling banana plants.  His land consists of banana and coffee plantations.  Miguel is requesting a loan of the amount of Q. 8,000.00 to buy banana plants and later sell them.  Having a good quantity of merchandise will leave him with greater profits which he will use to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy and sell banana plants

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María una adorable mujer de 47 años de edad que junto a su esposo monto una tienda con la intención de mejorar sus ingresos y tener unos ahorros para los tiempos difíciles.
Madre de 5 hijos los cuales viven todos con ella que aún son dependiente de ella y su esposo pesto que ella prefiere que estudien y en un futuro le devuelvan los cuidos y sacrificios que realizo por sus amados hijos.
Trabajo junto a una empleada que le colabora y a la cual le paga diariamente.
María en una estrategia por ganar mayor clientela solicita un crédito para la compra de un refrigerador y poder vender carnes frías y productos que necesiten refrigeración como refresco, vegetales, leche entre otros, quiere convertir su tienda en un granero en el que los clientes encuentren todos los productos de la canasta familiar aumentando sus ingresos dándoles un beneficio a sus clientes, también surtida su refrigerador con variedad de productos con el simple propósito de mejorar cada día la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
47-year old María is a lovely woman who, together with her husband, opened a store in order to increase their income and have some savings for when times were hard. She has five children, all of whom live at home and are still dependent on her and her husband. She prefers that they study and one day return the care and sacrifice that she has made for her beloved children. She employs one person whom she pays on a daily basis.

In a plan to attract more customers, María is seeking a loan to buy a refrigerator so she can sell frozen meat and other products that need to be kept cold such as drinks, vegetables, milk etc. She wants to turn her shop into a grocery store where customers can find all their daily needs. Then she will earn more money and her customers will also benefit. María will stock the refrigerator with a variety of products with the sole aim of improving her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: buy a refrigerator and stock frozen meat and drinks, etc.

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 38 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado debido a la economía le tocó abandonar la escuela para dedicarse a trabajar, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y también le ayuda en la siembra de maíz, tiene dos hijos pero solo una está estudiando.

Carlos se dedica a la siembra de maíz y de maicillo desde la edad de 10 años, trabajo que aprendió de sus padres, trabaja en el horario de 4:30 am en adelante, para llegar a su trabajo Carlos camina 40 minutos. Ademas le gusta ayudar a su comunidad en el desarrollo local.

El préstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO es para invertirlo en la siembra de una hectárea de maíz, comprará semilla, abono y veneno.

El sueño de Carlos es ver a su hija graduarse en una profesión, comprar un solar para darles a sus hijos donde construyan una casa y pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Carlos is 38 years old and studied to the 6th grade. For economic reasons, he had to abandon school and dedicate himself to work. He is married and his wife takes charge of the house and, also, helps him sow corn. He has 2 children but only one is studying.

Carlos has dedicated himself to sowing corn and sorghum since the age of 10, working with and learning from his parents. His work schedule begins at 4:30 am. To reach his fields, Carlos travels for 40 minutes.  In addition, he likes to help his community in local development. 

The loan he is soliciting through CREDICAMPO is to be invested in sowing a hectare of corn and purchasing seeds, manure and pesticides.

Carlos' dream is to see his daughter graduate as a professional, and to buy land to give his children where they can construct a house, and to pay off this loan.

loans.use: to invest in sowing a hectare of corn, and purchasing seeds, manure and pesticides.

loans.name: Señor De La Esperanza De Huaripache Group

texts.es: “SEÑOR DE LA ESPERANZA DE HUARIPACHE” está conformado por 05 socias dedicadas a diversas actividades del comercio minoristas. Carmela tiene 43 años de edad es soltera. Ella se dedica a prestar servicios de cocinera hace varios años. Ella desea aperturar  su negocio  de comida es por eso que el crédito lo invertirá en la comprar una cocina vajillas y víveres. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Carmela es la primera del lado izquierdo.
texts.en: “SEÑOR DE LA ESPERANZA DE HUARIPACHE” is made up of 5 members dedicated to diverse commercial activities. Carmela, 43, is single. She's has been offering her cooking services for many years. She wants to open a food business and that's why she'll invest the Kiva loan in a stove, dishes and provisions. The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for their support. Carmela is the first on the right.

loans.use: buy a stove, dishes and provisions.

loans.name: Diama's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 12 Juillet 2008 le groupe au sein du banc villageois de Dabo compte des femmes qui de par leur travail et sérieux ont atteint leur douzième cycle dans programme des bancs villageois. Elles sont  très actives dans leurs activités génératrices de revenu et  principalement dans le petit commerce  petit commerce.

Madame Diama (assise à droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants dont 06 filles et 02 garçons. C’est une dame très dynamique, elle tient un restaurant dans sa commune sur la route nationale depuis plus de cinq. Elle est une femme réfutée très bonne restauratrice. Elle sert à midi et le soir.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter : 03 sacs de riz pour 42 000 FC FA, 40 litres d’huile à 32 000 FC FA, une dizaine de tablette d’œufs, 05 boîtes de tomate concentrée et divers ingrédients pour la préparation des mets.

Ses bénéfices lui servent d’une part à renforcer son épargne, d’autre part à acheter des chèvres et moutons en plus du soutien qu’elle apporte à son mari pour la gestion des tâches quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Founded on July 12, 2008, the group from the "banc villageois" of Dabo is made up of women who are on their 12th loan cycle from the "banc villageois" as a result of their dedication to their businesses. They are very active in their individual small businesses. 

Diama (sitting on the right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is married and the mother of 8 children--- 6 girls and 2 boys. She is a very dynamic woman. 

Diama has run a restaurant in her community on the main national road for over 5 years. She has a reputation as a good restaurateur. Diama serves lunch and dinner. 

With this new loan, Diama plans to purchase 3 bags of rice for 42,000 francs CFA, 40 liters of oil for 32,000 francs CFA, ten cartons of eggs, 5 boxes of concentrated tomatoes, and various other ingredients to prepare her dishes. Diama's earnings will allow her to put some into savings and to use the rest to purchase goats and sheep and to help her husband provide for the daily expenses of their household.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bags of rice at 42,000 francs CFA, 40 liters of oil at 32,000 francs CFA, ten cartons of eggs, 5 boxes of concentrated tomatoes, and various ingredients to prepare dishes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise in order to stock her bodega, and to make some repairs to her home.

loans.name: Jose Horacio

texts.es:
José, se siente satisfecho por los buenos resultados que tuvo al invertir el financiamiento anterior en la compra de insumos agrícolas para cultivar granos básicos, sus condiciones familiares han mejorado.
José opta por un nuevo crédito para continuar invirtiendo en su negocio comprara abono, semilla, fertilizantes, plaguicidas y herbicidas, de esta manera tendrá una mayor calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Jose feels satisfied with the good results he had upon investing the previous financing, which was used to purchase agricultural inputs for cultivating basic grains. His family's conditions have improved.

Jose opted for a new loan to continue investing in his business. With this loan, he will purchase manure, seeds, fertilizers, plaguicides, and herbicides. In this manner, he will harvest better quality products.

loans.use: buy pesticides, seeds, fertilizers, plaguicides, and herbicides for his crops.

loans.name: Maria Carmen

texts.es:
María, posee su negocio desde hace ya 20 años, el cual consiste en elaborar y vender tortillas, además ofrece variedad de lácteos, su madre le enseño dicho oficio, su horario es de 6:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m., su mayor ventaja es que en la zona no tiene competencia. María es acompañada, vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo de 13 años de edad, el cual está estudiando.
Invertirá en comprar leña, maíz, cal, quesos, crema, quesillo, cuajada y bolsas, con su compra por mayoreo espera ahorrase un poco y tener buenas ganancias que le servirán de respaldo para cancelar sus cuotas y mejorar el estilo de vida de su familia.
Su aspiración es continuar trabajando para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María has already been in business for 20 years. She makes and sells tortillas, and also offers a variety of dairy goods. Her mother taught her this profession. Her hours are from 6:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. One major advantage is that she has no competition in her area. María is in a relationship. She lives with her life partner and her 13-year-old son, who is in school.

She'll invest the loan in kindling, corn, lime, cheese, cream, quesillo (soft cheese), curds and bags, which she'll buy wholesale in order to save a little and generate a good income that will help her make loan payments and improve her family's lifestyle.

She aspires to continue working so she can improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: buy kindling, corn, lime, cheese, cream, quesillo (soft cheese), curds and bags.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 59 años de edad, es un agricultor que vive en la zona rural, logró estudiar hasta 9° grado en la escuela, actualmente está acompañado y tiene una hija de 4 años de edad.

Miguel tiene mucha experiencia en la actividad productiva, ya tiene 10 años de dedicarse al cultivo de maíz y este año tiene planeado cultivar tres hectáreas de terreno, el lugar donde trabaja le queda a una distancia de 1 km, y esta actividad fue la aprendió por su padre.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar los insumos como abonos, insecticidas, herbicidas entre otros ya que la temporada de siembra está muy cerca y necesita el capital de trabajo para invertir en el cultivo de maíz.

Miguel tiene planeado cultivar tres hectáreas de terreno ya que esta actividad le generara muchas ganancias y así podrá pagar su crédito sin problemas, además el próximo año su pequeña hija tendrá que empezar sus estudios y quiere estar preparado para comprar todos los útiles escolares y sabe que todo esto lo puede lograr con la ayuda y financiación de su crédito.
texts.en:
Miguel is 59 years old.  He is a farmer who lives in a rural area.  He managed to study through the ninth grade.  He is in a relationship and has a four-year-old daughter now.

Miguel has a lot of experience in this field; at this point he has been growing corn for ten years.  He learned this line of work from his father.  This year he is planning to cultivate three hectares of land.  His place of work is about one kilometer away.

He needs this loan to buy supplies such as fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides, among others, because the sowing season is already very near and he needs working capital to invest in his corn crop.

Miguel has planned to cultivate three hectares of land because this work generates good earnings.  In this way he will be able to pay back his loan without a problem.  Additionally, next year his young daughter will have to begin her schooling, and he wants to be prepared to buy all her school supplies.  He knows that he can do all of this with the help and financing of his loan.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides

loans.name: Saul Osmin

texts.es:
Saul de 27 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado pues prefirió trabajar, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a vender tortillas, por lo cual ella y su único hijo dependen de el.

Saul actualmente se dedica a trabajar en la carpintería y lo ha hecho desde que era un niño, lo aprendió de unos vecinos que tenían un taller cerca de donde él vivía, también trabaja en la agricultura, siembra maíz, frijol, y lo realiza en un horario de 7:00 am a 5:00 pm.

El préstamo será invertido para comprar una moto-cierra que le servirá en su trabajo y para comprar leña para la venta de tortillas de su esposa.

El sueño de de Saul es ver crecer a su hijo y darle todo lo que necesita, también sueña en tener su propio taller de carpintería.
texts.en:
Saul, age 27, studied through the ninth grade, because he preferred to go to work.  He is in a relationship, and his partner works selling tortillas.  His partner and his only son are his dependents.

Currently Saul works in carpentry.  He has done this since he was a boy.  He learned this work from some neighbors who had a workshop near where he lived.  He also works in farming, sowing corn and beans.  He does this on a schedule from 7 a.m. until 5 p.m.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of a chain saw which will help him in his work, and to buy firewood for his partner’s tortilla sales.

Saul’s dream is to see his son grow up and to give him everything he needs.  He also dreams of having his own carpentry workshop.

loans.use: to buy a chain saw

loans.name: Sally Group

texts.en:
Hermenia is the featured borrower of Sally group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua. They formed the group because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines, seeking a better income to improve their families' living.

Hermenia is a 57-year-old married mother of three. She is a hardworking mother who puts in so much effort to provide her beloved children with a good education. Her income is barely enough to cover all their school costs; for this reason, her acquired loan will be invested in settling her children’s increasing school fees.

Hermenia is wearing a purple top and standing at the center of the picture; Tita is the lady on the left side, while Rosalina is on the right side.

loans.use: to pay for her children's increasing school fees.

loans.name: Lidubina Ines

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos un Cantón de clima cálido húmedo su gente es muy amable y trabajadora, este Cantón cuenta con varios atractivos turísticos como lo es hostería mirador rio blanco, en el mismo su gente es alegre y le gusta disfrutar de todas sus festividades organizando conciertos y bailes populares, en este Cantón vive y tiene el negocio la señora Lidubina una mujer luchadora de 28 años mantiene una relación en unión libre de la cual tienen 3 hijos la mayor tiene 10 años y la ultima 1 año 8 meses por los cuales lucha día a día para salir adelante. 
Ella tiene una tienda de víveres en general, aprendió de este negocio cuando trabajaba en una tienda del sector, a la tienda le dedica un promedio de 13 horas por día, el esposo pasa trabajando no tiene quien le ayude en el negocio tiene que buscar la manera de atenderlo personalmente sin descuidar sus pequeños hijos  
Solicita este crédito para invertir en el negocio y arreglará el local para atraer mayor clientela, con esto mejorarán sus ingresos económicos y su calidad de vida, la señora Lidubina agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos is a canton with a humid, warm climate and whose people are very friendly and hard working. The canton has several tourist attractions like the viewpoint at the Inn Rio Blanco.  In the canton the people are cheerful and like to enjoy all festivities, organizing concierts and popular dances.  

In this canton, Lidubina, lives and has her grocery store.  Lidubina is a fighting woman of 28 years old and maintains a relationship with a partner in which they have three children.  Their oldest is 10 and the youngest is 1 year, 8 months.  Because of her children, Lidubina fights day after day to get ahead.  She has a convenience store and learned of the business while working at a store in the sector.  In her store she dedicates an average of 13 hours a day.  Since her husband works she does not have someone to help her in the business.  She has to find a way to attend to the store personally without neglecting her young children.  She requests this loan for the purpose of inverting in her business and fixing the store so that it attracts more customers.  This loan will improve her earnings and her quality of life.  Lidubina is thankful for the Fundacion Alternative and to Kiva for the support and this opportunity.

loans.use: to invert in her business and fix her store.

loans.name: Ana Miriam

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su esposo de 67 años de edad, sus hijos ya tienen su propio hogar, como una forma de tener ingresos para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos familiares, hace quince años instalo una tienda de productos varios, como ventaja tiene la buena ubicación, por la alta presencia de estudiantes y no tiene mucha competencia, su labores inician a las seis de la mañana y finalizan a las nueve de la noche.
El capital lo invertirá en la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, bebidas, boquitas, lapiceros, lápiz, borradores, cuadernos, etc., abastecerá su negocio con productos de primera necesidad y algunos útiles escolares, con ello espera mejorar la rentabilidad.
Su sueño es trabajar día a día para mantener activa su fuente de ingresos y tener una vida más digna.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her 67 year old husband.  Her children now have their own households.  As a way of getting income to help her husband with the family expenses, she set up a store 15 years ago.  She sells various products at her store.  The location is an advantage with the large presence of students, and she does not have much competition.  Her work starts at six in the morning, and she finishes at nine at night.

She will use the loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, drinks, snacks, pens, pencils, erasers, and notebooks, etc.  She will stock her business with basic needs products and some school supplies.  By doing so she hopes to improve the profitability.

Her dream is to work day to day to keep her source of income active and to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, drinks, snacks, pens, pencils, erasers, and notebooks, etc.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es:
