Pedro Vicente Maldonado un Cantón de clima cálido húmedo lleno de gente amable y trabajadora este Cantón es el punto de llegada de muchos turistas ya que a los alrededores del mismo tenemos muchas hosterías en las que se puede descansar y ser tratados con amabilidad y respeto, a unos pocos minutos de este Cantón en el Recinto la Célica vive y tiene el negocio el señor Miguel un hombre luchador de 48 años es soltero no tiene hijos casi toda su vida paso viviendo con los papas y ayudándolos en la finca, actualmente ya es independiente tiene su propia finca en la misma se dedica a la producción de le leche 
Aprendió de este negocio desde su niñez junto con los papas, entre el empleo como jornalero que en ocasiones realiza y el negocio trabaja un promedio de 10 horas por día, solicita este crédito para invertir en el negocio para realizar un corral para el ordeño de las vacas, con esta inversión mejorara el cuidado de las vacas y estas incrementaran la producción de leche, el señor Miguel está pensando en pronto formar un hogar y tener hijos, por ese motivo quiere que sus ingresos económicos mejoren, Miguel agradece a Fundación Alternativa y Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Pedro Vicente Maldonado is a canton with a humid climate.  It is full of kind and hardworking people.  This canton is the arrival point for many tourists because there are many inns all around where tourists can rest and be treated with friendliness and respect.  A few minutes from this canton is the La Célica precinct, where Miguel lives and has his business.  

Miguel is a 48 year-old man, a fighter who had spent almost all his life living with his parents and helping them with their farm.  He is single and doesn’t have children.  At this point in time, he is living independently and has his own farm, where he works in milk production.

He learned this line of work beginning in his childhood from his parents.  Between the work as a day laborer that he does occasionally and his own business, he works an average of 10 hours a day.  

He is asking for this loan to invest in his business, to build a corral for milking his cows.  With this investment he will improve the care of his cows and they will increase their milk production.  Miguel is thinking of starting a household and having children, so he wants his finances to improve.  Miguel is thankful to Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the support and opportunities provided.

loans.use: to build a corral for milking his cows

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Por El Progreso Group

texts.es: Verónica tiene 29 años de edad es conviviente con 03 hijos educando. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida hace 07 años. Años atrás se dedicaba a la venta de gaseosas y cerveza.   El crédito lo invertirá en la renovación de sus utensilios de  negocio sillas mesas ollas y cubiertos. Ser parte del grupo “MUJERES UNIDAS POR EL PROGRESO” le ha permitido obtener créditos y darle a una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Verónica es la segunda persona sentada del lado derecho viste buzo rojo.
texts.en:
Verónica is 29 years old. She lives with her partner and 3 children, who are in school. She has been selling food for 7 years. Before that she made a living selling soft drinks and beer.

She will invest the loan in upgrading her business equipment: chairs, tables, pots and cutlery.  Being part of “MUJERES UNIDAS POR EL PROGRESO” Communal Bank has enabled her to obtain loans and give her family a better quality of life.

The group is grateful to KIVA investors for the loan provided.
 
Verónica is the person seated second from the right in red pants.

loans.use: to purchase chairs, tables, pots and cutlery.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Alfonso es un joven soltero y vive en el Distrito de San Juan de Miraflores junto a su hermano, debido a que sus padres viven en Provincia y ellos llegaron a Lima para salir adelante y esperando un futuro mejor para su familia.
Desde hace 2 años este joven emprendedor trabaja con su mototaxi en el trasporte de pasajeros a diversos destinos de la Zona donde reside. Es una persona muy amable y luchadora y respetuosa.
Alfonso está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que con el apoyo brindado él podrá realizar arreglos y mantenimiento a su mototaxi, de esta manera tendrá mayores clientes y por lo tanto ingresos y seguirá ahorrando para poder cumplir su más grande sueño: “Estudiar Ingeniería de Minas” y mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia
texts.en:
Alfonso is a young single man who lives in the San Juan de Miraflores District with his brother, since their parents live in Provincia and they came to Lima to get ahead and envision a better future for their family.

For the past two years this young, enterprising man has been working with his motorcycle taxi carrying passengers to various destinations of the district where he resides. He is a very friendly and respectful person, who is struggling to get ahead.

Alfonso is grateful to Kiva lenders since with the help provided he will be able to make repairs and do maintenance on his motorcycle taxi. By doing so, he will have more passengers and, in turn, earn more income. He will continue saving in order to fulfill his greatest dream: “Studying Mining Engineering” and improving the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to repair and do maintenance on his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is a married woman, with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Luzminda is 45 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Luzminda has a fishing and fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional materials and gear for her business.

Luzminda has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her business.

loans.name: Gilberto Gustavo

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos un Cantón de clima cálido húmedo lleno de gente amable y trabajadora tradicionalmente se realiza las festividades por el aniversario del mismo, este Cantón es un atractivo turístico muy visitado por su variedad de flora y fauna silvestre, en los feriados de carnaval que se realizan todos los años aquí en este Cantón toda su gente se dirige a la cascada del amor a pasar un momento agradable en familia.
En este Cantón vive y tiene el negocio el señor Gilberto un hombre de 34años el mantiene una relación en unión libre de la cual tienen 2 hijos el mayor de 4 años y la ultima de 2 años la esposa no trabaja, ella pasa en casa cuidando los niños y le ayuda en el negocio, se dedica a la producción de cerdos, aprendió de esta actividad en su niñez junto con los papás ya que ellos se dedican a esta actividad diariamente trabajan un promedio de 10 horas entre el negocio y el empleo como albañil, el viene de una familia de bajos recursos económicos lo que le impidió prepararse el solo tiene la primaria. 
Solicita este crédito para invertir en el negocio para ampliar y arreglar la chancheras, con esta nueva inversión mejorara su calidad de vida y la de su familia, el señor Gilberto gradece a Fundacin Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas.
texts.en:
The canton of San Miguel de los Bancos has a hot and humid climate, and is full of friendly hard-working people. They traditionally celebrate festivals on each anniversary here, and the canton is an attractive tourist destination visited for its variety of plants and wildlife.  During the carnival holidays which are celebrated every year, all of the people in this canton head for the waterfall of love to spend some quality time with their family.

Gilberto lives and has his business in this canton.  He is 34 and in a common-law marriage with his spouse with whom he has two children; the oldest child is 4 and the younger is 2.  His spouse doesn't work outside; she takes care of the children at home and helps Gilberto with his business, which is raising pigs.  Gilberto has learned this business working along with his parents since he was young.    Gilberto and his spouse dedicate themselves to this activity, and Gilberto works an average of 10 hours a day between his own business and his outside job as a mason.  He comes from an economically disadvantaged family which prevented him from preparing himself fully for life; Gilberto has only a primary education.

Gilberto is requesting this loan to invest in his business to expand and fix his pig pens. With this new investment he will improve the quality of life for himself and his family.  Gilberto is thankful to the Fundacin Alternativa and to Kiva the support and opportunities they provide.

loans.use: to expand and fix pig pens

loans.name: Paz De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Paz tiene 33 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto grado debido a los escasos recursos económicos que vivió con su familia, está casada y su pareja trabaja de seguridad, sus dos hijos están estudiando por lo que son dos personas que dependen de ella.

Paz se dedica a vender tortillas desde hace años, trabajo que aprendió de su madre. Para llegar a su trabajo ella camina un kilómetro desde su casa. Trabaja en el horario de 8:00 am a 6:00 p.m 

El préstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO es para comprar leña y maíz al por mayor ya que le sale mas barato.

Paz sueña con darles estudios a sus hijos, mejorar su vivienda y poder ampliar mas su negocio de tortillas para obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia lo necesario.
texts.en:
Paz, 33, only went to school until the 5th grade because her family lacked the financial resources for her to continue. She's married and her husband works in security. Both of her children go to school and are dependent on her.

Paz has been selling tortillas for years. She learned this business from her mother. To get to work, she walks 1 Km from her home. She works from 8:00 am to 6:00 p.m.

The loan she is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy kindling and corn wholesale, as it's cheaper.

Paz dreams of providing her children with an education, improving her home and expanding her tortilla business in order to generate more income and meet her family's needs.

loans.use: buy kindling and corn, wholesale.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel tiene 53 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Nahualá, departamento de Sololá, es soltero, se dedica a comprar y a vender banano, actividad que lo realiza en la comunidad donde vive y lo hace desde hace 20 años. Manuel necesita un crédito por un monto de Q. 4,500.00 para comprar banano y luego venderlos, el comenta que entre más mercadería tiene más es la ganancia que le deja, la meta de Manuel conseguir más compradores y vender en cantidades grandes.
texts.en: Manuel is 53 and lives in the town of Nahualá in the department of Sololá. He is unmarried and has made a living buying and selling bananas in his community for 20 years. Manuel needs a loan of 4,500 quetzals to buy bananas and then resell them. He says that the more stock he carries, the more money he is able to earn. Manuel's goal is to gain more customers and sell his product in larger quantities.

loans.use: to buy and sell bananas.

loans.name: Julibeth

texts.en:
Julibeth works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now

Julibeth requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish, ice, plastic bags, etc.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish, ice, plastic bags, etc.

loans.name: Gargenia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Gargenia works hard to support her family.

She has a nipa roof-making business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food-vending.  Gargenia is borrowing PHP 21,500 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional materials for her business, like bamboo sticks and nipa leaves.

Gargenia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business, like bamboo sticks and nipa leaves.

loans.name: Set El Kol

texts.en:
Set El Kol is a 60-year-old married mother of nine whose husband is a carpenter. Set El Kol used to live in the city, but had to go back to her village later. Since the standards of living are poor in the area, she considered opening a small grocery shop as an easy source of income. Four years ago she successfully established her own grocery shop, despite a lack of savings and capital. 

Set El Kol is an ambitious woman who believes in chasing every opportunity on the path to success. She acquired a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to buy more merchandise for her shop. 

Since her shop lacks some of her customers’ requested goods, she is planning to stock it with the products her customers suggest in order to prevent them from seeking other grocers in the surrounding areas.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her shop so she can stock her customers' requested goods.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita, 56 years of age, is married to a tricycle driver and blessed with two children. She has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost ten years and is earning a net income of PHP 300 daily. Her net income is usually spent on their food expenses. She also owns a motorcycle transport for additional income. Due to insufficient funds, she would like to obtain a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to purchase biscuits, beverages, noodles, sugar, coffee, milk, and canned goods to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, beverages, noodles, sugar, coffee, milk, and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food cooking ingredients like 100 kg of rice, 25 kg of maize flour, 1 bucket of cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Precilla

texts.en:
Despite hardships, Precilla believes that, someday, she will be able to improve the living status of her family through hard work and strong determination. She is 58 years old and blessed with eight children. She engages herself in buying and selling vegetables to help her husband in gaining income. 

Precilla aims to acquire more stocks of vegetables to sell, but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy cabbages, sweet potatoes, beans, eggplants, bitter melon, and other leafy vegetables to sell. She believes that her loan will help her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, sweet potatoes, beans, eggplants, bitter melon, and other leafy vegetables to sell.

location.town: Brgy. Ineangan, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman of 44 years. She lives in Nakuru Kenya. Together with her husband, she is blessed with five children between the ages of 15 years and 6 years. Alice is a farmer who rears livestock as well as cultivates different cash crops. She has done this business for 10 years now, receiving an income of 10,000 KES per month.

Alice has requested a loan from VisionFund Kenya of 30,000 KES which she will use to pay school fees for her children.

Alice desires to see her children educated for life as her family prospers.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Yafes

texts.en: Yafes is a 38-year-old married man. He has 2 children who are 5 years and 10 years old. He describes himself to be visionary. He operates a retail business where he sells bread, cooking oil, salt and other items. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be theft. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, cooking oil, rice, and flour. His business goal is to be the best within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will raise the living standard of his family. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, cooking oil, rice, and flour.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela busies herself with backyard hog raising. She earns a promising income of PHP 8,000 doing this type of work. 

Marcela enjoys her membership with PMPC, and having access to insurance and credit. 

Currently she is in need of  PHP 4,000 to purchase animal feed. 

Marcela hopes that being a widow, she will still be able to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is a married woman. She has 7 children. She describes herself to be focused and sincere. She operates a farm where she keeps cows which produce milk. She has been involved in this business for 30 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough cows. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more cows. Her business goal is to have a large dairy farm within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more cows.

loans.name: Emilicar

texts.en:
Emilicar works hard to support her family. Emilicar is married and has a buy and sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines.

Emilicar requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

Emilicar has been in this business for 5 years now.

Emilicar would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 57 years old and widowed with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Flora has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 40 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school. Florence works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like soap, canned goods, milk, shampoo, etc.

Florence has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Florence would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like soap, canned goods, milk, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Marline

texts.en:
Marline is 45 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Marline is borrowing PHP 21,500 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Marline has been buying and selling livestock for 4 years and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 60 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Emma works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business selling school supplies in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy notebooks, plastic bags, glue, paper, etc to sell.

Emma has been in this business for 20 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, ballpoint pens, glue, paper, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Edwin De Jesus

texts.es:
Edwin, vive bajo el calor de sus padres y dos hermanos, es soltero, en busca de mejorar las circunstancias familiares trabaja de manera independiente en el cultivo de maíz y frijol, su jornada inicia a las seis de la mañana y finalizan a las dos de la tarde, por el momento no representa dificultades en realizar esta actividad.
Utilizaré el préstamo para comprar tres sacos de abono, semilla, insecticidas, plaguicidas y herbicidas, preparar el terreno, eliminara la maleza y evitara que el cultivo sea vea afectado por alguna plaga, espera aumentar la productividad que le deje mayores ingresos para cumplir con los pagos de su deuda y apoyar a sus padres.
Su sueño es construir su propia casa, para en un futuro formar su propia familia, además incorporar la crianza de ganado.
texts.en:
Edwin lives with his parents and two siblings. He is single. He seeks to improve his family's circumstances by working in growing corn and beans. He begins work at six in the morning and finishes at two in the afternoon. He doesn't have any difficulties doing this work.

He will use the loan to buy three sacks of manure, seed, insecticide, fungicide and herbicide, to prepare his earth, eliminate maladies and avoid that the crops will be affected by any pestilence. He hopes to increase the productivity resulting in greater income to make his debt payments and support his parents.

His dream is to build his own home, have his own family, and also incorporate the raising of cattle.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of manure, seed, insecticide, fungicide and herbicide.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and been in NWTF since 2013; she is now requesting a PHP 9,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Divina will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Divina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 62 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lucia has been raising pigs for five years, and also earns additional income from a general store.

Lucia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy piglets, feed, and vitamins.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Sreyroth

texts.en:
Sreyroth is a resident of the Bovel district, located in Battambang province. She is a 21-year old married mother with two children. The primary business for the family is crop farming, which she has been doing for about four years.

She has been a borrower of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle already. She has successfully repaid the past loan, and it allowed her to raise the living condition of her family to a better level.

Now Sreyroth is seeking another loan of 2,000,000 KHR in order to pay for the plowing fee. 

She strongly believes that the loan will enable her to continue her farming business in order to earn a living to feed her children.

loans.use: To pay for the plowing fee

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 53 years old and married with five children. Esterlita works very hard to provide for them.

Her business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Esterlita has restarted her fishing business, and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Esterlita has taken a PHP 7,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

She is committed to rebuild her devastated life and would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde is 53 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Matilde is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed.

Matilde has been pig fattening for three years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed.

loans.name: Doeun's Group

texts.en:
Doeun is a 64-year-old married mother of three children. She lives in Moung Russey district of Battambang province, where her paddy rice is grown.  

Doeun is the group leader of a group of three borrowers. The total amount of the loan is 3,000,000 KHR, of which Doeun’s portion is 1,400,000 KHR. This is the first cycle for her group members and the third cycle for Doeun to seek a microloan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. 

She plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and crop seed to use on her farm. She hopes that the loan allows her to uplift the living condition of her family at a gradual pace.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and crop seed to use on her farm.

loans.name: Dúo Los Claveles De Santiago Group

texts.es: Dúo Los claveles de Santiago, representado por doña Rosa Maria, quien se dedica a la venta y elaboración de piñatas desde hace 9 años, ha buscado variar productos y capacitarse para poder elaborar todo tipo de piñata ya que hay pedidos depende de que personaje nuevo aparezca en películas y caricaturas, también ahora cuenta con venta de golosinas, bolsas de sorpresas y gorros, está feliz por el resultado y desea ahora comprar una vitrina para presentar sus productos, ya solo tiene a su cargo una hija quien aun estudia y desea ayudar a culminar sus estudios como lo ha hecho con sus otros hijos.
texts.en:
Doña Rosa Maria is one half of Dúo Los claveles de Santiago [The Two Carnations of Santiago], and has specialized in making and selling piñatas for nine years. She and her partner and attempting to offer a greater variety of products and learn to make any kind of piñata so they can meet demand for piñatas  showing new characters appearing in movies and cartoons. The pair now also sells snacks, gift bags, and hats, and are happy with the results they've achieved. They want to save money to purchase a window where they'll be able to display their products. 

Only one of Doña Rosa Maria's children still lives with her, a daughter who is still in school. Doña Rosa Maria aspires to help her daughter finish her studies and graduate as her other children have.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making and selling piñatas.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Elena Camey, casada su hija quien cursa el ciclo básico, su esposo se dedica a la venta de carbón por mayor doña Elena sigue creciendo en su tienda ya que en ella vende frijol por libra, arroz, maíz, pastas, gaseosas, golosinas, también vende embutidos y si le ha ido bien, tambien ahora vende pollo,es asi como doña Elena sale adelante con su familia dia a dia, en esta oportunidad esta solicitando nuevamente el apoyo para comprar mas mercaderia por mayor asi tener una baja en los precios al comprar por mayor.
texts.en: Elena Camey is married, has a daughter in elementary school, and her husband sells charcoal at wholesale. Elena continues to grow her store where she sells bulk beans, rice, corn, pasta, soda pop, candy and also canned goods. Her business is going well. She also sells chicken.  In this way Elena helps her family survive day by day. Today she seeks a new loan to support the purchase of more merchandise at wholesale in order to take advantage of low prices when buying wholesale.

loans.use: To buy food products to sell.

loans.name: José Medardo

texts.es:
José, estudio bachillerato, está acompañado y su esposa tiene una pequeña tienda, por lo que también contribuye a  los gastos familiares.

Por su parte José se desarrolla en la agricultura desde hace 18 años años.  Lo aprendido de sus padres, ya que en la zona es la actividad  a la que se pueden dedicar, también a trabajado como panificador  y como vendedor de pan,  actividad que realizan en su tiempo libre todas las tardes.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar semilla, abono, fungicidas, para cultivar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. Gracias al crédito podrá tener una mejor cosecha y con una mejor cosecha podrá tener mejores ingresos  para su familia

El cliente manifiesta  que en un futuro planea mejorar su vivienda e invertir en la tienda que tiene su esposa. También,  manifestó que  solo con los créditos  lo lograra y con las ganancias de su negocios y el esfuerzo que él ponga.
texts.en:
Jose completed high school and is married.  He and his wife have a small store which also helps contribute to the household expenses.

Jose has been a farmer for the past 18 years and learned this from his parents, since this is what they are able to do in the area.  He also works as a baker and bread seller and does this in his spare time in the evenings.

He is asking for this loan through CREDICAMPO to buy seeds, compost, and fungicide, to plant 14,000 square meters of corn.  Thanks to this loan, he will be able to have a better harvest, allowing him to have a better income for his family. 

He says that he plans to make improvements to his house and invest in his wife’s store.  He also says that he is only able to make a profit with the help of the loans and his efforts.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Omar Antonio

texts.es:
Omar, trabaja desde hace 12 años en la agricultura, cultiva maíz y pipían, el maíz lo comercializa en sus diferentes etapas como lo son jilotes, elotes y en granos, sus productos son distribuidos en el mercado para su reventa, trabaja junto a su hermano en un horario de 5:00 a.m. hasta las 2:00 p.m., Omar es soltero, vive con su mamá y un hermano.
Invertirá en la compra de insecticida, fertilizante, plaguicida, semilla y abono, será cuidadoso en comprar lo necesario para realizar la siembra y tener mejores beneficios de la inversión, con las ganancias podrá cancelar su deuda y continuara ampliando su productividad.
Su aspiración es mantener su trabajo y ayudar económicamente a su familia.
texts.en:
Omar has worked as a farmer for 12 years growing corn and squash. He sells the corn in different forms, such as by the ear or in grain. His products are distributed in the market for resale. He works with his brother from 5:00 AM until 2:00 PM. Omar is single and lives with his mother and brother.

He will invest in buying insecticide, fertilizer, fungicide, seed and fertilizer. H will be careful in buying what he needs to continue expanding his productivity. His goal is to keep working and help his family economically.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, fertilizer, fungicide, seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sambath's Group

texts.en:
Sambath is a forty-eight-year-old married woman. She is currently living in Moung Russey district of Battambang province. In the house there are seven children, three of whom still count on her. 

Sambath does rice farming as the main source of income. She has been engaged in the crop farming business for decades. The farm can earn an average income of 26,700 KHR per day, which is barely enough to support her family. 

She is the group leader of a group of two borrowers. This is not either the first cycle or fifth cycle for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), as she is in the eighth cycle already. She has repaid back her past loan completely and it has enabled her to lift up her lifestyle at a gradual pace. 

The loan amount for her entire group is 2,400,000 KHR, of which 1,400,000 KHR is her loan portion. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her crop. She hopes that this purchase will boost her yield on time.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide for her crop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, a sus 23 años de edad ya cuenta con un negocio que tiene 8 años de estar funcionando el cual consiste en cultivar maíz y frijol, este oficio lo aprendió de su padre, en su tiempo libre apoya a su papá en sus diferentes actividades. Miguel es soltero y vive en compañía de sus padres.
Con el objetivo de fortalecer su negocio y tener una cosecha abundante invertirá el financiamiento en la compra de abono, fertilizantes, semilla, herbicidas y plaguicidas, espera recuperar lo invertido con ganancias superiores y cancelar la deuda adquirida.
Su sueño es tener recursos económicos suficientes para autofinanciarse la universidad y ser Lic. En Contaduría Pública.
texts.en:
Miguel is 23 years old and has had a business growing corn and bean for 8 years. He learned this trade from his father. In his free time he helps his dad with various activities. Miguel is single and lives with his parents.

With the goal of strengthening his business and having an abundant harvest, he will invest the financing in the purchase of manure, fertilizer, seed, herbicide and fungicide. He hopes to recoup the investment with increased earnings and make his loan payments. His dream is to have sufficient economic resources to pay for his university schooling and become a licensed public accountant.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, seed, herbicide and fungicide.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos tiene 33 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y muy responsables, su grupo familiar está conformado por su hija de 2 años de edad, y su compañera de vida que se dedica a los oficios domésticos.
Marcos siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde que tenía 11 años de edad, cultivando maíz, frijol y maicillo. Así con la ayuda de su papá y sus hermanos alcanza a cultivar 2 hectáreas.

Él solicita este préstamo a CrediCampo para comprar 3 sacos de fertilizantes y una caneca de herbicida para darle un buen manejo agronómico a los cultivos.
Su sueño es seguir cultivando granos básicos para la alimentación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marcos is a 33-year-old hardworking and very responsible man. His household consists of his 2-year-old and his life partner who works doing domestic chores.

Marcos has been farming since he was 11 years old, growing corn, beans, and sorghum. With the help of his father and brothers, he has managed to  cultivate 2 hectares of land.

Marcos is requesting a loan through CrediCampo to buy three sacks of fertilizer and a pot of herbicide to care for his crops. His dream is to continue cultivating basic grains to feed his children.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of fertilizer and a pot of herbicide to care for his crops.

loans.name: Dúo La Joya De Buena Vista Group

texts.es: Dúo la Joya de Buena Vista La encargada de este grupo es la señora Laura Angélica quien tiene una venta de gas propano desde hace 12 años en la colonia de su aldea. Cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo quien la ayuda en todo y no le hace falta el amor único de sus dos hijos para cada mañana luchar por su sueño la cual es ser una gran distribuidora de gas en su colonia.  Tiene varios pedidos de gas pero los cilindros que tiene no le alcanzan y se ve en la necesidad de comprar otros de diferentes libras ya que no quiere quedarles mal a sus clientes.  El dinero que tiene no le alcanza y por eso nuevamente pide otro préstamo.
texts.en: Laura Angélica is in charge of the group called Dúo la Joya de Buena Vista. She has been selling propane gas for 12 years in a neighborhood in her town. She has the unconditional support of her spouse who helps her with everything, and the love of her two children, which drives her to work towards her dream of being a large-scale distributor of propane gas in her neighborhood. She has several orders, but doesn't have enough cylinders, and she needs to buy cylinders of different sizes to satisfy her customers. She doesn't have enough money for this, and so she is requesting another loan.

loans.use: to buy propane gas to sell.

loans.name: Joveliza

texts.en:
Joveliza works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and been in NWTF since 2013, and she is now requesting a PHP 7,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Joveliza will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Joveliza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Porferia

texts.en:
Porferia is 50 years old and married with three children.  With two children in school, Porferia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Porferia has been in this business for 5 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 59 years old and married with five children. Lorna works very hard to provide for them.

Lorna's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Lorna has restarted her fishing business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Lorna has taken a PHP 7,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Lorna is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 48 years old and widowed with nine children, two of whom are in school.  Rosita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks like canned goods, eggs, cream, etc. to sell.

Rosita has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Rosita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like canned goods, eggs, cream, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Veronica Alexandra

texts.es:
Verónica es una joven de 19 años de edad, casada tiene una hija de 9 meses, gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres logró terminar la escuela primaria y luego la falta de recursos económicos la llevó a trabajar desde muy joven para poder sustentar sus necesidades y poder mantener a su pequeña hija que en la actualidad tiene 9 meses de edad  y ayudar de esta manera a su esposo. Ahora Veronica vive en la ciudad de Latacunga junto a su esposo y su pequeña hija en una casa de los padres, por ende no pagan arriendo.
El mayor obstáculo que han tenido ha sido la falta de financiamiento para poder hacer que su negocio crezca, actualmente tiene una pequeña maquiladora, aprendio de esta actividad ya que trabajaba con una vecina, trabaja de 8 a 10 horas diarias, le ayuda en ocasiones su mamá.
Requiere el crédito para invertir en la compra de tela ya que ella ganó un concurso del gobierno para la elaboración de uniformes y con esto poder cumplir con los pedidos pendientes esto también ayudará a que Veronica pueda mejorar sus estilo de vida y la de su familia, dándole la educación que ella no tuvo y la oportunidad de salir adelante. Además a Veronica le gustaria en un futuro que su taller crezca cada día mas. Verónica  agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Veronica is a young woman of 19 years of age. She is married and has a 9 month old daughter. Thanks to her parent’s efforts she was able to complete primary school.  Later on the lack of economic resources led her to start working from a young age in order to keep up with her necessities and to be able to provide for her young daughter who is currently 9 months old and thus help her husband. Currently Veronica lives in the city of Latacunga with her husband and young daughter in their parent’s house; therefore they do not pay rent.

The biggest obstacle that they've had has been the lack of financing to be able to make their business grow. She currently has a small textile factory; she learned this activity from working with a neighbor. She works 8 to hours a day and her mom helps her on occasion.

She is requesting this loan to invest it in buying fabrics since she won a government competition to make uniforms and in this way she will be able to fulfill her outstanding orders. This will also help Veronica improve her way of living and that of her family, giving her daughter the education that she didn’t have and the opportunity to get ahead. As well, Veronica would like for her factory to continue growing in the future. Veronica is thankful to Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for making the growth in her work and personal life possible.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to make uniforms.

loans.name: Wazawa Group

texts.en:
Florida is a mother of four children, two of whom are at school and the rest are grown.  She is a widow and for four years now makes her family living by managing a mama lishe (café). She runs her business from 6am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good range of profit per month. 

This is her first loan request from Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy cooking ingredients for her business store including kilos of rice, baking flour, sugar, maize flour, etc.  She dreams of managing a hotel in the future. Florida will share this loan with her loan group "WAZAWA" which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients like kilos of rice, baking flour, sugar, maize flour etc. for her business.

loans.name: Sreypov's Group

texts.en:
Sreypov is a resident of Komreag district of Battambang province. She is 33 years old and a married mother blessed with two dependent children: one under schooling age and one schoolchild. In order to earn a living for the family, she has been planting cassavas to sell. She also raises pigs to sell to earn extra income. 

This is the second microloan for Sreypov and her co-borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid back her past loan with success and it has enabled her to improve her lifestyle at a gradual pace. For this cycle, she leads a group of two to get a new loan. For Sreypov, she will spend her loan portion to pay a plowing fee and to pay for labor costs.  She optimistically hopes that the loan will allow her to earn a higher income and pave a way for her to uplift her family living conditions and provide her children with sufficient basic needs.

loans.use: to pay a plowing fee and labor costs.

loans.name: Dorine

texts.en:
Dorine is a married woman. She has three children ranging in age from nine to seventeen years. She describes herself to be determined. 

Dorine operates a retail business where she sells clothes, and she has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are frequent. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to own a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future she will have frequent cash flow.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.en: Eusebio is a responsible father who supports his family doing retail. He is "tuba" (native wine) gatherer in Lopez Jaena. Eusebio has mastered gathering "tuba" - a raw ingredient for vinegar. Doing this type of work has sufficiently provided daily consumption for their family. He saves his "tuba" into empty gallons. Recently, he applied a loan to purchase plastic gallons for "tuba" refill. Eusebio wishes to see all his children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase plastic gallons for "tuba" refill

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena , Misamis Occi

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is a 32-year-old married woman.  She has 1 child.  She describes herself as visionary.  She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in the seasons. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more clothes to sell. Her business goal is to be the best within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will raise the living standards of her family. This is her first loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Dúo Alicia Y Helen Group

texts.es: Dúo Alicia y Helen La encargada de este grupo es la señora Alicia quien tiene una tienda desde hace 15 años, tiene la necesidad de pedir un préstamo porque le hacen falta varios productos como gaseosas por jumbos, litros, latas, normales también tiene la necesidad de comprar arroz, frijol, azúcar por quintal ya que así ahorra buen dinero.  Su sueño es seguir creciendo cada día y llegar a tener un depósito en su sector.  Su esposo la apoya en todo y sus hijos nunca la han dejado sola.
texts.en: Alicia is in charge of the group called Dúo Alicia y Helen, and she has had a shop for 15 years. She is requesting a loan as she need several products, such as cans and various sizes of bottles of soda, as well as rice, beans, and sugar in bulk to save money. Alicia's dream is to continue growing  and to eventually have a warehouse in the area. Her spouse helps her with everything, and her children are always with her.

loans.use: to buy day-to-day products.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and been in NWTF since 2013, and she is now requesting a PHP 9,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Remedios will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

Remedios would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: A villager from Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Mom is 33 years old and a married mother blessed with five children; three of them still need her support, as one is too young for schooling and two are in school. Mom relies on a single source of income via rice farming, which she has been involved with for 20 years, earning about 27,000 KHR per day. Including this loan, she is a fifth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has completely repaid her past loan which has helped her to uplift her lifestyle at a gradual pace. Mom is a group leader of a group of three borrowers. The entire group requests a total loan amount of 3,600,000 KHR, of which Mom will take a portion of 1,400,000 KHR. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline to use on the farm. She also plans to use a portion of her loan to buy an additional plot of land for the purpose of expanding her farm. She strongly believes that the loan enables her to be able to uplift the living conditions of her family and also provide a chance for her children to get higher education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and gasoline to use on the farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Selvin Jhony

texts.es:
Selvin tiene 25 años de edad, solo pudo estudiar hasta bachillerato, está soltero y vive en casa de sus padres y hermanas, y él es quien les ayuda a sus hermanas para que estudien.

Él es empleado de una cooperativa desde hace un año, es asesor de créditos y su trabajo le queda cerca y se va en motocicleta.

El préstamo que está solicitando lo necesita para comprar una máquina de cortar pelo, comprar productos de primera necesidad, el préstamo le servirá de mucho ya que tendrá mejores ingresos y será de gran ayuda para su familia.
Su sueño es tener más equipo de trabajo y que en su pequeña tienda obtenga mejores ingresos y mas clientes.
texts.en:
Selvin is 25 years old; he was only able to study up to high school. He is single and lives in his parent’s and sister’s house. He is the one who helps his sisters so that they can go to school. 

For a year he has been an employee of a cooperative, as a credit assessor and his work is close that he travels by motorcycle.
The loan that he is requesting is needed to buy a machine to cut hair and to buy basic household products. The loan will be of much use to him since he will have better earnings and will be of great help to his parents. 

His dream is to have more work equipment and for better earnings and more customers  in his small store.

loans.use: to buy a machine to cut hair and to buy basic household products.

loans.name: Srin's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Kampong Cham province, Srin is a mother of three children, one of whom is in school.  To earn a living, she weaves cotton scarves called “Krama ” as the main source of her income. To supplement her income, she works for others for a fee. This is the first microloan for Srin and her joint borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The total loan amount of her entire group loan is 3,400,000 KHR in which 1,000,000 KHR is her loan portion. 

As a group leader, she plans to use the loan to buy materials for making Krama including thread and artificial color dye for her cotton scarves. She strongly hopes that the loan will enable her to expand her current business and earn a higher income so that she will be able to achieve a dream of sending her children to university.

loans.use: to buy materials for making Krama (cotton scarves)

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Pum's Group

texts.en:
Pum, 40 years old, is a resident of Koh Sotin district in Kampong Cham province. Rice cropping is her primary business and she earns extra income from her occupation as a school teacher. Pum presently earns up to 22,000 KHR per day to deal with her family's daily costs of living. 

Pum has fully repaid her previous loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and her living conditions have improved. For this loan cycle, she is leading a group consisting of three borrowers. Pum will spend her entire loan portion to buy a cow to help her business. She hopes that she can support her business promptly.

loans.use: To buy a cow to help her business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new wheels for her arepas cart, an umbrella for the sun, and lots of raw materials, such as corn.

loans.name: Sokkea's Group

texts.en:
Sokkea, 30, is a resident of Koh Sotin district located in Kampong Cham province. She has three children to support as one is too young for schooling and one is still a small child. To provide decent food for her children, Sokkea weaves krama (a sturdy traditional Cambodian garment with many uses) as her main source of income and works as a laborer to supplement her income. She has operated this business for five years. 

Sokkea is quite new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three to get a new loan. Sokkea and one other group member are applying for 1,400,000 KHR each whereas the remaining borrower is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. Sokkea will spend her entire loan portion to buy thread and to pay for labor fees for help in dying the krama colors. She hopes that she can earn a good income to provide sufficiently for her children

loans.use: to buy thread and to pay for labor fees for help in dying the krama colors

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a freezer to increase the amount of storage for products and be able to sell them in large quantities.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy urea, 12-24-12 fertilizer, 18-46-0 fertilizer, Gramoxone herbicide, and nitrate to help with her coffee crops.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom, a 39-year-old mother of six children, resides in Tbaung Khmum district, Kampong Cham province. Five children still rely on her; three of them are too young for schooling and the remaining two attend school. Mom struggles for a living by farming cassava and rice. She has operated this business since she was 20 years old and it returns her about 28,000 KHR per day. 

This is Mom's sixth loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has successfully repaid her past loans and is gradually improving her lifestyle. Mom and her two group members are requesting a loan of 3,800,000 KHR. Mom's portion of the total is 1,000,000 KHR, which she plans to use to buy fertilizer and cassava seedlings. She hopes that this purchase will allow her to timely replant this crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and cassava seedlings

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Conie Group

texts.en:
Cornelia is the featured borrower of Conie Group. She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines seeking a better income to support their families.

Cornelia is a 50-year-old widowed mother of three.  She came to Lebanon to work as a housekeeper after her husband passed away.  She wanted to provide her beloved children a better living, so she seeks to work hard and unite with them in the future.

Her acquired loan will be sent to her family in Philippines to cover home maintenance expenses after a disastrous tornado hit their village and destroyed a big part of their house. 

Cornelia is the first lady from the right with a red top, Jonavie is the second from the right, Akinha is the second lady from the left with a white veil, and Jennifer is the first from the left.

loans.use: To cover the home maintenance expenses following a tornado

loans.name: Zulieta

texts.en: Zulieta, 48 years old, is married and has five children, one in school. Zulieta works very hard to provide for them. For the past 4 years, Zulieta has run a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock, such as canned goods, spices, eggs, etc. Zulieta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock, such as canned goods, spices, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita, 62 years old, is widowed and has four children. She is in the agricultural business, farming bananas in the Philippines. Rosita has been farming for 7 years and has previously borrowed 6 times from NWTF to sustain her business. Rosita has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Rosita would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: José Maria

texts.es:
José de 58 años de edad,  estudio hasta sexto grado en su vida a tenido dos hogares, con el primero tubo 3 hijos de los cuales ya todos estan acompañados, pero en ese hogar por razones personales se dejo con la señora, actualmente esta acompañado con otra señora, en este hogar él a procreado dos hijos, ambos menores de edad. 

Su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios domesticos y sus dos hijos viven con ellos. Él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace más de 20 años, su padre y madre son quienes le enseñaron el respeto a la vida y a los demás y a sí mismos. Por el hecho de no haber podido seguir estudiando dice que decidio dedicarse a la agricultura viendo que no tenia otra forma para generar ingresos solamente a la agricultura, ha sido un hombre responsable que sabe de su compromiso como padre y esposo apesar que a tenido dos hogares dice que en su relación tiene buena comunicación con sus hijos. 

El lugar de trabajo esta  lejos de su casa, el recorrido lo hace a pie y cuando pasa algun carro pues aprobecha, nadie más se dedica a la actividad, y su horario de trabajo es de 6 am a 11am. Sus hijos como van a la escuela no pueden ayudarle.

El préstamo será invertido en la preparación de la tierra para la siembra, hoy que viene la época de invierno, comprara abono, fertilizantes, pesticdas, herbicidas y semilla de maíz.  Esta con la esperanza que este año le ira bien, ya que de lo que cosecha paga el alquiler del terreno, dice que por 14,000 metros cuadrados de terreno, le cobran 4 sacos de maiz mas 1 de maicillo. Especificamenete comprara dos sacos de formula, dos de abono y dos de sulfato los demas fertilizantes que utiliza los ira comprando en el camino. 

Con el préstamo se vera beneficiado, ya que no cuenta con ese dinero para comprar los fertilizantes. El poder tener primero lo más necesario para la familia, por lo que espera trabajar siempre mientras Dios le regale salud y vida.
texts.en:
José is 58 years old and he studied until grade six. During his life he has had two households. In the first he had three children who are now all married, but he left his wife for personal reasons. Now he is living with another woman and he has two children with her who are both minors. His partner works as a housekeeper and their two children live with them. 

He has been working in agriculture for more than 20 years. His mother and father taught him to respect life, other people and himself. Due to the fact that he was not able to continue studying, he said that he decided to work as a farmer because he realized that the only way he could make money was by farming. He is a responsible man who is aware of his commitment as a father and a husband, despite the fact that he has had two households, he says that he communicates well with his children. 

The area where he works is far from his house, but he walks and when a car passes by, he makes the most of it. Nobody else works with him and his work schedule is from 6:00 am until 11:00 am. Since his children go to school they are unable to help him. 

The loan will be spent on getting the land ready for planting season, now that winter is on its way. He will buy manure, fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides and corn seeds. He hopes that everything will go well this year, since he rents the land from what his crops grow. He says that for 14,000 square meters of land, he pays four bags of corn plus one bag of sorghum. More specifically, he will buy two bags of fertilizer, two bags of manure and two bags of sulfate. The other fertilizers he uses he will buy gradually.

He will benefit from the loan, since he does not have the money to buy the fertilizers. In order to be able to have the most important things for his family, he expects to work as long as God gives him the gift of life and good health.

loans.use: to buy two bags of fertilizer, two bags of manure, and two bags of sulfate. He will buy the other fertilizers he uses gradually.

loans.name: Khadidiatou Kindy's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 12 Juillet 2008 le groupe au sein du banc villageois de Dabo compte des femmes qui de par leur travail et sérieux ont atteint leur douzième cycle dans programme des bancs villageois. Elles sont  très actives dans leurs activités génératrices de revenu et  principalement dans le petit commerce  petit commerce.

Madame Kadidiatou Kindy  (debout à l’extrême droite en boubou blanc), est l’emprunteuse vedette  du groupe. Elle est âgée de  45 ans, mariée et mère de 08  enfants dont 04 garçons et 04 filles. Elle est vendeuse de tissus, articles vestimentaires et chaussures qu’elle achète dans le plus souvent à la capitale pour la revente au détail dans sa commune. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l’avoir pratiqué pendant plus de cinq ans. 

Avec son nouveau prêt elle compte acheter des chaussures pour une valeur de 75 000 F CFA, des tissus d’été pour une valeur de 100 000  F CFA.

Les bénéfices de cette activité lui permettront en plus d’apporter son soutien dans le foyer, mieux assister ses enfants dans leur scolarité.
texts.en:
Founded on July 12, 2008, the group of the "banc villageois" of Dabo is made up of women who, through their hard work and dedication, are on their twelfth loan cycle with the banc villageois. The women are very active in their respective small businesses.

Kadidiatou Kindy (pictured standing on the far right in a white "boubou") is the featured borrower of the group. She is 45 years old, married and the mother of 8 children, 4 girls and 4 boys.

Kadidiatou Kindy is a seller of fabric, clothing, and shoes, which she purchases most often in the capital to resell at retail in her community. She has good experience in this business after having done it for more than five years.

With this new loan, Kadidiatou Kindy plans to purchase 75,000 francs CFA worth of shoes and 100,000 francs CFA worth of summer fabrics. The proceeds from this business will allow her to better provide for her household and to better help her children with their schooling.

loans.use: to purchase shoes for 75,000 francs CFA, and summer fabric for 100,000 francs CFA

loans.name: Sonia Maribel

texts.es:
Sonia, ha tenido un efecto positivo con el crédito anterior, pudo reparar el vehículo y actualmente su compañero de vida lo utiliza para trabajar ofreciendo el servicio de instalaciones de  líneas telefónicas, por su parte Sonia se dedica a elaborar hamacas y vender tortillas, su negocio está más diversificado.
Comprará maíz, cal, leña, hilo y manguillos, su inventario contara con lo necesario para trabajar por una larga temporada y sus ingresos seguirán siendo estables.
texts.en:
Sonia´s former loan has had a positive effect. She was able to repair her vehicle, and currently her common law husband is using it to work, offering his services installing telephone lines. 

For her part, Sonia is making a living selling tortillas and making hammocks. Her business is more diversified. She will buy corn, lime, firewood, thread and hammock handles. She will have the inventory necessary to work for a long season, and her income will continue to be stable.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, firewood, thread and hammock handles.

loans.name: Luz Davira

texts.es:
Luz es una reconocida peluquera del sector la cual tiene un recorrido de más de 17 años como estilista, presta servicios de peluquería, corte, cepillado, tintura y otros, es apoyada por una de sus hijas, cuando sus clases se lo permiten. 
Luz muestra mucha preocupación por sus clientes y le genera mucha insatisfacción que en ocasiones no tenga la herramienta adecuada o un producto solicitado por sus clientes ya que para ella es esencial el servicio y la calidad por esta razón solicita un crédito para la compra de herramientas más optimas y tecnológicas y surtir su negocio con productos que en el momento carece lo que admiran las personas de luz es que ella siempre piensa en su familia y lucha sin descanso pro construir una casa para ella y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luz is an experienced and well-known beautician in her area.  She has worked as a stylist for over 17 years.  She offers services such as haircuts, styling and dying. One of her daughters helps her in her business, when her class schedule allows.

She pays a great deal of attention to her clients, and when she occasionally doesn't have adequate tools to do her job, or she doesn't have a product that one of her customers wants, she gets quite frustrated.  Service and quality are essential to her, and for this reason she is seeking a loan.  She will use the funds to purchase better tools and technologies and to supply her business with products that she currently needs.  What people admire about her is that she always thinks of her family and is working tirelessly to build a house for herself and her children.

loans.use: to purchase tools and merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Navy's Group

texts.en:
Navy, a mother of three kids, is a resident from Sithor Kandal district of Prey Veng province. She deals with her daily cost of living by her Krama and silk weaving business, as well as buying from others to sell. She can earn more income via her job at a factory. 

Navy is the first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group consisting of three members to get a new loan. 

The group requests a loan with total amount of 3,400,000 KHR in which 1,200,000 KHR belongs to Navy’s portion. 

She plans to use the loan to buy thread to weave more Krama, and to buy silk to sell. 

She strongly hopes that the loan will allow her to earn a higher income to support her family, so that she can upgrade their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy thread to weave more Krama and to buy silk to sell

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Thyda's Group

texts.en:
A resident from the Sithor Kandal district of Prey Veng province, Thyda is 33-year-old married mother of two children. To make a living, she has a silk weaving business as the main source of income, and supplements her income from her paid working job. 

In a group of three borrowers, Thyda is the group leader. This is the first cycle for her and her co-borrowers. They seek a micro loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The total amount of loan that the group requested is 2,600,000 KHR, of which Thyda owns a portion of 1,000,000 KHR. 

She plans to use the loan to buy materials to make silk. 

She optimistically hopes that the loan helps her to earn more income so as she can live in better conditions, and her children will be healthier.

loans.use: To buy materials to make silk

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Han's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Han is 48 years old and has four children. She tackles her basic needs via rice farming and her paid working job. This business earns her about 25,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first-time loan for Han with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She teams up a group of two to get a new loan. 

As the leader, Han will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor cost for her crop. 

She hopes that she will be able to increase the income for her family and be able to uplift the living condition of her family in a gradual pace.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for labor cost for her crop

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Saky's Group

texts.en:
Saky is a villager from the Srey Snorm district, located in Siem Reap province. She is 47 years old and has four children to support, as they are still in school. 

Three hectares of rice cropping and one hectare of cassava farming are the main source of income for her entire family, and it generates about 35,000 KHR. 

This is the third loan for Saky with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid back her past loan completely, and it enables her to uplift her lifestyle in a good pace. For this cycle, she and her co-borrower are applying for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. 

Saky plans to use a portion of the loan to pay for land plowing fee and another portion to buy fertilizer. 

She strongly hopes that the loan enables her to earn a higher income to better support her family, and allows her to have financial support to buy school materials for her four children.

loans.use: To pay for the land plowing fee and to buy fertilizer

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pieces of rich brocade

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia, 50 years of age, is married to a farmer and blessed with two children. She has owned and managed a retailing business in their village for almost three years and earns a net income of PHP 300 daily. She also has a retail store for additional profits. Her net income goes through her savings immediately. Due to insufficient funds, she would like to take a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to purchase vegetables, fish, pork, meat, and grocery items to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and improve.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, fish, pork, meat, and grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en: Amelita is 47 years old and chose to be single. She lives in a rural community with her beloved mother and some of her nieces and nephews. Since her mother is now old and incapable, she is the one who earns their living. Aside from being a farmer, she runs a small variety store to earn additional income. She aims to strengthen this business and make it more profitable but she has limited capital. For this reason, she wants to take a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy additional stocks of snack foods, soft drinks, laundry soaps, canned goods, noodles, pampers and beverages to sell. Through patience and hard work, she believes that she will become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of snack foods, soft drinks, laundry soaps, canned goods, noodles, pampers and beverages to sell

location.town: Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be disciplined. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a motorcycle. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha is a hardworking mother from Lopez Jaena. She is 51 years old and a businesswoman who makes copra. She buys whole coconuts for this. Editha has signed her membership with the cooperative to gain access to insurances and credit. She applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts for making copra. Editha hopes to succeed in this business to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts to make copra

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase urea, 12-24-12 and 18-46-0 fertilizers, Gramoxone, and nitrate for her coffee crop

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 48 years old and married with three children. With one child still in school, Adelaida works very hard to provide for them.

Adelaida's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Adelaida has restarted her food vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Adelaida has taken a PHP 5,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Adelaida is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Friends2 Group

texts.en:
Annabelle is the featured borrower of Friends2 group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippine seeking a better income to support their families.
Annabelle is a 47-year-old divorced woman with five children. She is a caring, devoted mother who works hard to cover all of her children's increasing needs.

Annabelle is acquiring a loan in order to pay for a necessary surgery that her daughter has to have. Annabelle wishes to stay with her children but her family's needs force her to be apart in order to support them.

She is standing on the far left side of the picture. As for the other group members, Ce Arell is standing at the center of the picture and Reynavic is on the far right side.

loans.use: To pay for surgery for her daughter

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita finds pleasure in her coco farming activities. Not only is she doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. At the age of 61 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for her family. She has grabbed the opportunity to become a full-pledge member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative . 

Esterlita credits the cooperative for her capital in supporting her coco farming activities. Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for land preparation. 

In the future, she wishes to become the supplier of copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production) in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 50 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Evangeline and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Evangeline is taking a housing loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Evangeline has been an NWTF borrower since 2013 and plans to recover through her food vending business.

With your help, Evangeline can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by Super Typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business. She has been with NWTF since 2013 and is now requesting a PHP 9,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Grace will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

Grace would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
María, ha mejorado mucho su estilo de vida familiar, cancelo su deuda adquirida y compro un vehículo que utiliza para  trasladar con mayor facilidad la mercadería que necesita para continuar trabajando, esto lo realizo gracias a la inversión del crédito anterior ya que fortaleció su negocio con todos los materiales necesarios para crecer como comerciante.
En esta oportunidad el capital que requiere lo utilizara para comprar sodas, papas, aceite, pan, embutidos, jugos, gas propano, etc., y reparara el coche que utiliza para elaborar las papas fritas y hot dogs. Continuara trabajando y teniendo los ingresos que necesita.
texts.en:
María has greatly improved her family's life. She paid the debt she had acquired and she bought a vehicle that she uses to easily move the merchandise that she needs to continue working. She accomplished this thanks to the investment of the previous loan, since it boosted her business with all the necessary items she needed to grow as a businesswoman.

This time she will use the money to buy soft drinks, potatoes, oil, bread, lunch meats, juice, propane gas, etc. She will also repair the vehicle that she uses to prepare the french fries and hot dogs. She will continue working to have the income she needs.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, potatoes, oil, bread, lunch meats, juice, propane gas, etc

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es:
Mateo, se decidió por un nuevo crédito para seguir invirtiendo en el cultivo de granos básicos, comprara semilla, abono, pesticidas, plaguicidas, herbicidas e insecticidas. Lo necesario para incrementar su cosecha y la calidad.
Con la ayuda del préstamo anterior Mateo logro una buena producción con la que abasteció a su familia y a sus compradores, su situación económica ha mejorado positivamente.
texts.en:
Mateo decided to request a new loan in order to continue investing in the cultivation of basic grains. He will purchase seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, fungicides, herbicides, and insecticides, which is what is necessary for him to increase the yield and quality of his crops.

With the help of the previous loan, Mateo achieved a good production, which he used to supply his family and his customers. His economic situation has improved positively.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, fungicides, herbicides, and insecticides.

loans.name: Edis Marleni

texts.es:
Edis, necesita capital para mejorar la mercadería y el buen trato que ofrece a sus clientes comprara lociones, cremas corporales, tratamientos de belleza, cosméticos, tintes, esmaltes, etc., así responderá a las demandas que tiene en su negocio de manera inmediata.
Con el préstamo anterior surtió su inventario con nuevos productos que han sido del agredo de sus clientes, su salón de belleza cada vez es más popular, actualmente la cartera de clientes ha crecido,  la estabilidad económica es estable, su familia se encuentra muy saludable y ha podido cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Edis needs capital to improve the merchandise and good service that she offers her clients. She will buy lotion, body cream, beauty treatments, cosmetics, hair dye, nail polish, etc. to respond to the immediate demands of her business.

With the previous loan, she stocked her inventory with new products that her clients have enjoyed. Her beauty salon is continually increasing in popularity; her list of customers has gotten longer. Her economic situation is stable, her family is very healthy, and she has been able to pay back her debts.

loans.use: to purchase lotion, body cream, beauty treatments, cosmetics, hair dye, nail polish, etc.

loans.name: Aracelys

texts.es: Aracelys de 36 años de edad, madre de un hijo de 6 años, inició su negocio hace 8 años, cuando para responder a los gastos familiares debió trabajar como comerciante con el fin de mejorar su situación económica en su hogar. Ella empezó con poco capital vendiendo uno a uno mercancía hasta llegar a organizar una pequeña miscelánea con la que hoy tiene muchos sueños de fortalecimiento., para generar mucho mas bienestar y sobre todo brindar en el futuro,  una educación e calidad  a su hija.  Aracelys comercializa calzado, artículos para el hogar, ropa, perfumería, y otras variedades, de contado y a crédito, trabajando diariamente durante 12 horas continuas. Sus principales clientes pertenecen a su vecindad,  son sus amigos, referidos, y familiares en general. Aracelys tiene un gran desafío y es justamente el acceso a capital de trabajo para invertir en su negocio y crecer. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará   una vitrina exhibidora y mercancía variada, con el propósito de aprovechar la temporada de incremento en las ventas, que inicia desde el segundo semestre del año, la cual hace  que su credikiva  bien invertido,  tenga un total éxito en sus finanzas.
texts.en:
