Aracelys is 36 years old and the mother of a 6-year-old child. She started her business 8 years ago when, due to family expenses, she needed to work as a shop-keeper in order to improve her household's economic situation.

She began with little capital, selling items one by one until she was able to start a small corner shop. She dreams of strengthening this business to provide much more well-being and, above all, to provide her daughter with quality education in the future.

Aracelys sells footwear, household supplies, clothing, perfume, and other items, for cash or credit. She works 12 hours in a row every day. Her main customers are from her neighborhood: they are her friends, aquaintances, and relatives in general.

Aracelys' greatest challenge is finding access to capital to invest in the growth of her business. This is why she is requesting a Kiva loan, the first financing that she has requested through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase a display case and various merchandise. She would like to take advantage of the high sales season, which starts in the middle of the year, so that her Kiva loan, well-invested, will be a complete success.

loans.use: to purchase a display case and various merchandise

loans.name: Silva

texts.en:
Silva is from Jrashen village. She lives there with her husband and three children (in the photo). Silva and her husband are agronomists. They have been running a small farm for over five years. They are involved in cattle breeding, in aviculture, and in cultivation of wheat, potatoes and alfalfa.  With the help of her husband, Silva sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is a very important source of their income. To be able to meet the growing needs of her family, Silva wants to enlarge her agribusiness a little bit.

The requested loan of USD 3,000 will be a big help for the family to purchase four oxen, four piglets, fertilizer, and fuel for land cultivation. Silva and her large family will be very thankful to the lenders for their good will and support.

loans.use: to purchase four oxen, four piglets, fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Chhem's Group

texts.en: Residing in the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Chhem is 59 years old and a mother of four children. She covers her daily cost of living via cassava and rice farming. To supplement her income, she works for others for a fee. This business earns her about 21,000 KHR per day. This is the first microloan for Chhem with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, she leads a group of four to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay the plowing fee for her crop. She strongly hopes that she will be able to collect a higher yield on the rice crop farm and cassava plantation so that she can earn a better income to support her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fees for her crop

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es: José de 49 años de edad, es el propietario de una panadería desde hace 3 años, cuando despues de tener una tienda en la que no le fué muy bien, aprovechó sus conocimientos en la preparación de productos derivados de la harina de trigo, para emprender su propia aventura de negocios y sostener su familia, conformada por su cónyuge y sus dos hijos pequeños. Los principales productos de su oferta son el pan de queso, el croissant y el pan de sal, los cuales vende de contado, en su mercado conformado por tenderos, vecinos y particulares que transitan por su barrio.  Su meta es mejorar la infraestructura de negocios y con ello la calidad de vida de su familia, pero su mayor desafio para lograr resultados inmediatos es lograr fuentes de financiación. En la actualida destá aplicando a un credikiva mediante el cual comnrpará en mayor volumen Harina de trigo, grasas, azucares queso etc., con los cuales preparar nueva producción y sostener inventarios sufieintes para incrmentar el volumen de sus ventas y hacer d esu credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
José is 49 years old and has owned a bakery for the past three years. After running a shop that was not very successful, he took advantage of his knowledge of baked goods preparation to start his own business to support his family (his wife and their two young children).

The main products he offers are cheese bread, croissants, and salt bread, which he sells for cash. His shopkeepers, neighbors, and those who pass through his neighborhood are the people who make up his business.

His goal is to improve the infrastructure of his business and his family's quality of life, but the greatest obstacle to immediate results is locating financial resources. He is requesting a Kiva loan which he will use to buy a larger amount of wheat flour, fats/oils, sugar, cheese, etc. He will use these to prepare more products and sustain an adequate inventory to increase his sales volume and make his Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, lard, sugar, cheese, etc.

loans.name: Dúo Los Apocentos Group

texts.es:
DUO LOS APOSENTOS
La señora María Estela de 37 años, casada,  desde hace 12 años posee una Tienda en Los Aposentos, que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio ella  ha mantenido y  a sacado adelante a su familia.
El sueño de doña  María Estela es poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando a FAPE; con el préstamo quiere comprar productos de consumo diario  para seguir creciendo con su tienda.
texts.en:
DUO LOS APOSENTOS
María Estela is 37 years of age, married, and for the last 12 years she has owned a store in Los Aposentos. Through her efforts she has established it and improved her home. She has supported and provided for her family thanks to her business.
María Estela dreams of being able to improve her quality of life and that of her family through the microcredit she is requesting from FAPE; with the loan, she wants to buy everyday consumer products in order to continue growing her store.

loans.use: to purchase food products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of washing soap, cooking fat and other items

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel es un joven emprendedor, vive en el Distrito de Calleria junto a su familia.
Desde hace 6 años tiene su pequeño negocio de mecánica y le va muy bien porque es una persona muy trabajadora y amable.
Tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y por eso lucha cada día con mucho empeño para poder lograrlo.
También tiene su terreno y se dedica al cultivo de  cacao y plátano, ofreciendo al mercado productos de excelente calidad y a un precio competitivo.
Daniel está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que con el apoyo brindado él podrá sembrar Cacao y realizará mantenimiento al cultivo de plátano para que pueda ofrecer productos de mejor calidad al mercado, de esta manera llegará a cumplir su gran sueño: “Ser un gran empresario Agricultor”.
texts.en:
Daniel is a young entrepreneur who lives in Distrito de Calleria with his family.
He has had a small mechanics business for the last 6 years, which is going very well as he is a very hard-working and friendly person.
He is very keen to get ahead and he struggles very hard each day in order to achieve this.
He also has his land on which he grows cocoa and banana crops, providing the market with excellent quality produce, and at a competitive price.
Daniel is grateful to the Kiva lenders, as with the support provided he will be able to plant cocoa and carry out maintenance on the banana crops, thereby providing the market with higher quality produce. In this way he will be able to achieve his greatest dream: "To be a big farming entrepreneur".

loans.use: to purchase seeds for cocoa planting and to maintain the banana crop.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La elaboración y venta de picadas para fiestas y de comidas rápidas, es la mayor expresión del gusto de Maria por la actividad culinaria. Ella inició ayudando a sus vecinos en la fiestas y poco a poco fue incrementado su oferta, hasta hacerla cada dia mas conocida en su vecindad. Picadas, como chuzos, hayacas, pasteles entre otras delicias, forman parte del menú que tiene para la venta Maria, quien trabaja de viernes a domingo, desde las 5 de la tarde hasta la media noche. Su meta de crecimiento no se detiene, pero su capital de trabajo es su mayor desafio, pues necesita aumentar la productividad y vender mucho mas, para brindarle a sus hijos los niveles educativos que le permitan ser exitosos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará en mayor volumen, harina, grasas y aceites, una vitrina calentadora de mayor tamaño, una freidora . Con esta inversión planea aumentar sus posibilidades de compra en menor precio y tener una infraestructura que genere mayor comodidad en la producción y mas efectividad en su negocio. Esta es justamente lo que garantiza el éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en: Making and selling hors d'oeuvres for parties and fast food is Maria's greatest expression of her enjoyment of the culinary business.  She started out helping neighbors with their parties.  Little by little she increased her offerings until she become well-known in her neighborhood.  Hors d'oeuvres, like skewers, tamales and cakes, among other delicacies, make up part of the menu that Maria has for sale.  She works from Friday to Sunday, from 5pm until midnight.  Maria's goal for her business's growth is unending, but working capital is a great challenge.  She needs to increase her productivity and sell a lot more in order to offer her children a level of education that will allow them to be successful.  Maria is currently applying for a Credikiva, the first financing she is requesting from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With the loan, she will purchase a greater volume of flour, fats and cooking oil, a larger-sized warming display case and a deep-fryer.  With this investment, Maria plans to increase the likelihood of purchasing her supplies at a lower price and having an infrastructure that generates greater ease of production and effectiveness in her business.  All of this guarantees the success of her Credikiva.

loans.use: to purchase a greater volume of flours, fats, and cooking oils, a larger-sized warming display case and a deep-fryer.

loans.name: Dúo Jardin Ll Group

texts.es:
Dúo Jardin ll
la señora Kimberly de 27 años de edad casada, tiene un hijo de 3 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo Inicio su negocio hace 4 años, ella cayó en depresión  y busco una manera para distraerse , y fue así como inicio a vender, al principio su inversión fue de Q.500.00 y le gusto trabajar y obtener sus propios ingresos, y así obtener otra fuente de ingresos actualmente solicita el crédito para vender más y así obtener más ganancias, agradece  a Dios las oportunidades que Kiva otorga para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Kimberly is 27, married and has a three year old son. She sells cosmetics from a catalogue. She began this business four years ago after falling into depression and looking for a way to distract herself. This is how she began selling cosmetics, initially investing 500 quetzals. Kimberley likes working, earning her own money and having another source of income. 

At the moment Kimberley is requesting a loan to sell more items so that she can increase her earnings. She thanks God for the opportunities that Kiva has given her to keep moving forward.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Ana Edith

texts.es:
Ana es una joven de 21 años de edad, soltera y vive en el Distrito de San Luis junto a su familia.
Actualmente está estudiando la carrera de Obstetricia porque quiere salir adelante y darle un mejor futuro a su familia.
Es una persona muy emprendedora, a su corta edad tiene un exitoso negocio de venta de calzados y con ese dinero obtenido ha podido pagar sus estudios en la Universidad
Ana es una trabajadora ejemplar, siempre atendiendo con amabilidad a los clientes y con mucho respeto.
Ana está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, la ayuda que le han brindado lo destinará a sus estudios, ella podrá llevar cursos de Capacitación en su carrera, de esa manera tendrá mayor conocimiento en su especialidad y podrá cumplir su sueño: “Ser una excelente profesional”.
texts.en:
Ana is a young woman of 21 years old. She is single and lives with her family in the district of San Luis. She is currently studying to be an obstetrician as she would like to get ahead and give her family a better future.

Ana is very enterprising, running a successful business selling shoes at a young age. With this money she has been able to pay for her university fees. She is an exemplary worker and always attends her customers with warmth and great respect.

Ana is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the help they have given her which she will put towards her studies. She will be able to undertake training courses in her degree and gain greater knowledge in her area of specialisation. Finally she will be able to realise her dream: 'to be an excellent professional".

loans.use: to undertake an obstetrician training course

loans.name: Jennylyn

texts.en:
Jennylyn is 26 years old and married with three children. Jennylyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jennylyn's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Jennylyn has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with a safe shelter.

Jennylyn has taken a PHP 6,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Jennylyn is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Jacinto Eustacio

texts.es:
Jacinto es un hombre de 51 años, casado, con cuatro hijos, viven en un hogar humilde y sencillo pero lleno de amor; el amor mutuo que se tienen se manifestó en 4 hijos, dos chicas y dos barones, dos de ellos ya terminaron los estudios secundarios gracias al esfuerzo y dedicación de sus padres, sus hijos residen en Santo Domingo debido a sus estudios ya que salir todos los días de su pueblito se dificulta por la falta de recursos y por el largo tiempo que esto les representa, no por esto olvidando a sus padres a los que visitan todos los fines de semana y cada vez que el tiempo les favorece.
Jacinto y su esposa viven en una pequeña y humilde vivienda ubicada en la vía a San Cristóbal Valle Hermoso, hermoso pueblito con atractivos turísticos, de clima adecuado y agradable caracterizado por la producción de cacao; junto a su esposa hace 5 años, surgió el sueño de crear un pequeño negocio de comida, el cual por la falta de capital es muy sencillo pero con el empeño que le ponen se ha mantenido hoy en día el gran sueño de Jacinto es remodelar su negocio con el fin de atraer clientes, quien se encarga de preparar los platos es su querida esposa, que hace su trabajo con amor y dedicación características que han llevado a su pequeño negocio a llevarse la gratitud y los buenos comentarios de quienes lo visitan debido a la delicia y variedad de sus platos.
Jacinto ya ha trabajado con Fundación Alternativa, el crédito que necesita hoy en día es para la compra de una maquina chapeadora para el jornal diario que él también se dedica en las fincas aledañas, con ello se facilitará su trabajo.
Jacinto y su esposa agradecen a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Jacinto is a 51-year-old man, who is married and has four children. They live in a modest, simple, loving home. Their love for each other presented them with 4 children - two girls and two boys. Two of them already finished their secondary education thanks to the efforts and dedication of their parents. Their children live in Santo Domingo because of their studies, since travelling every day from their small town would be difficult due to the lack of resources and the length of time it would take. Still, they haven't forgotten their parents, who they visit every weekend and whenever the weather is favorable. 

Jacinto and his wife live in a small, modest home located on the route to San Cristóbal Valle Hermoso, a beautiful little town with tourist attractions that has a suitable, agreeable climate characterized by the production of cacao. Five years ago, together with his wife, the dream was born to create a small food business, which, due to a lack of capital, is very simple. But with the efforts they put into it, it is still going. These days, Jacinto's big dream is to remodel their business in order to attract customers. His beloved wife is the one in charge of preparing all the dishes. She performs her work with the love and dedication characteristic of her that she has brought to her tiny business and which has led to the gratitude and favorable comments from whoever visits it, thanks to the delicious and varied menu. 

Jacinto has already worked with Fundación Alternativa, the loan he needs today is to purchase a brush cutter for day labor, because he also works on neighboring farms. This will make his work easier. 

Jacinto and his wife thank Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and Kiva for making it possible for their working and personal lives to grow.

loans.use: To purchase a brush cutter.

loans.name: Naren's Group

texts.en:
Naren is a resident from Ou Reang Ov district located in Kampong Cham province. In the family consisting of two dependents, she secures the basic needs for her family via rice and cassava cropping as the main source of income and works as a paid-worker as the secondary source of income. This business earns her about 24,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first cycle for her group to get a new loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The whole group requests a loan with a total amount of 3,500,000 KHR of which 800,000 KHR is Naren’s portion. She plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and pay for labour fees for her rice crop farm and cassava plantation. She optimistically hopes that the loan will enable her to increases her income to better support her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for labour fees for her rice crop farm and cassava plantation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to support her coffee crop.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Reyna de 34 años de edad tiene una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, tiene mucha clientela por la calidad de los productos y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas loga solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Reyna está solicitando un crédito para la compra más productos como: granos básicos, golosinas, leche, sopas, refrescos, etc. todo por mayor y así poder tener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica sin limitaciones algunas.
texts.en:
Reyna is 34 years old. She has run a store out of her home for many years. She has many customers due to the quality of her products and her reasonable prices. With the earnings from her sales she is able to meet some of the household costs. 

Reyna is requesting a loan to buy more products such as staple grains, lollies, milk, soup, soft drink, etc. in bulk so that she can increase her earnings and give her family better financial security without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, lollies, milk, soup, soft drink, etc. in bulk

loans.name: Dúo Señor Esquipulas Group

texts.es:
Dúo Señor Esquipulas
Doña Vicenta de 52 años de edad,tiene 3 hijos, se dedica  a la venta de ropa, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa sus ventas han incrementado y es por eso mismo que solicita el crédito porque necesita cubrir las necesidades del cliente,  anhela con tiempo tener un hogar propio  ya que actualmente alquila, agradece a Dios por que le brinda salud a toda su familia, espera que le puedan ayudar con su negocio, ya que a visto como otras personas se superan en su negocio con la ayuda que kiva les da.
texts.en:
Vicenta is 52 years old, has three children and sells clothing. Her sales have been increasing, which is why she is applying for a loan so that she can meet the needs of her customers. She has yearned for her own home for a long time as the one she currently lives in is rented. She gives thanks to God for blessing her family with good health. 

Vicenta hopes that you will be able to help her with her business since she has seen how other people have surpassed themselves in their own business with the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wholesale yucca, potatoes, plantains, cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 28 años de edad es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, hace 2 años decidió poner en su lugar de residencia un negocio de venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, tiene mucha clientela por los buenos precios y la calidad de la ropa que comercializa, vive en casa de un familiar con su madre, la clienta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de ropa por mayor para seguir con su negocio y asi tener una mejor estabilidad económica junto con su madre.
texts.en:
This client is 28 years old and is a very responsible and hardworking woman. Two years ago she decided to set up a store in her home selling clothing for men, women and children. She has a lot of customers due to her good prices and the quality of the clothing she sells. She lives in the home of one of her mother's relatives. 

This client is applying for a loan to buy clothing in bulk so that she can continue her business and she and her mother can have greater financial security.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es: Olivia de 53 años de edad se dedica desde hace 8 años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada por esa razón posee mucha clientela, Olivia vive en casa de un familiar con su hija quien trabaja y ayuda en los gastos del hogar, Olivia está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal, y asi poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias y junto con su hija puedan tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Olivia is 53 years old and for the last eight years she has made and sold tortillas. She runs her business out of her own home in an area which sees a lot of passerbys, which is why she has a lot of customers. Olivia lives in the home of one of her relatives with her daughter who works and helps her with the household costs. 

Olivia is applying for a loan to buy flour by the hundredweight and lime. She would like to continue working as it provides her with a good income and it gives her and her daughter the possibility of having greater financial security.

loans.use: to buy flour by the hundredweight and lime

loans.name: Kossi Améléwom

texts.fr: Kossi, 36ans est marié avec un enfant.c'est un revendeur de friperie.Il sollicite un crédit pour acheter des friperies et réinvestir les bénéfices afin d'agrandir son activité.Il remercie  les prêteurs de Kiva pour leur geste.
texts.en:
Kossi, 36 years old, is married with one child. He is a re-seller of used clothes.

He is requesting a loan to buy second-hand clothes and reinvest the profits to expand his activity. He thanks Kiva lenders for their gesture.

loans.use: buy second-hand clothes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy smoked fish

loans.name: Marcos Tulio

texts.es:
Marcos, tiene buenos ingresos al utilizar crédito para fortalecer de inmediato su negocio, opta por un nuevo préstamo que utilizara para comprar afrecho, harinilla, abono, plaguicidas, insecticidas y herbicidas, podrá alimentar  a su ganado, cerdos y contara con los insumos agrícolas para cultivar granos básicos.
E financiamiento anterior le dio un impacto positivo en su negocio, logro tener la cosecha en el tiempo justo, las ganancias han incrementado y las ha utilizado para mejorar el estilo de vida familiar, cancelar sus cuotas e incorporar el servicio de un molino nixtamal para tener otros ingresos.
texts.en:
Marcos has good income when he uses credit to immediately strengthen his business. He has opted for a new loan that he will use to buy bran, meal, fertilizer, pesticides, insecticides and herbicides. He will be able to feed his cattle, pigs and he will have the agricultural supplies he needs to plant basic grains. 

The previous financing produced a positive impact on his business. He was able to bring in the harvest at the perfect time. His profits have increased and he has used them to improve his family's lifestyle, to make his payments and to introduce the service of a hominy grinder to have another source of income.

loans.use: To buy bran, meal, fertilizer, pesticides, insecticides and herbicides.

loans.name: Tubiyage Group

texts.fr:
Jacques  fait partie du groupe Tubiyage  et  habite à  Bujumbura. C’est un veuf de 40 ans  3enfants âgés de 7 ans  à 12  ans tous étudient.

Il fait le commerce de boutique (riz, haricot, chaussures,…) depuis  10 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva  qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’articles de sa boutique (riz, haricot, chaussures,…) à revendre   pour gagner plus.

Dans les années prochaines, il voudrait acheter un véhicule    et  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Jacques is a member of the Tubiyage group and he lives in Bujumbura.  He is 40 years old and a widower.  He has three children between the ages of 7 and 12, and all three go to school.  Jacques has been working in retail for ten years and he sells various goods (rice, beans, shoes...).

This is his first loan with Turame.  This loan, financed by Kiva, will allow him to increase his capital and buy large quantities of retail items (rice, beans, shoes...) which he will resell in order to increase his income.

In the years to come, he would like to purchase a vehicle and make sure that his children are still in school.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of retail merchandise (rice, beans, shoes...) for resale.

loans.name: Remberto

texts.es:
Remberto de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta 9º grado, está acompañado, su esposa se dedica a criar cerdos, tiene 2 hijos que estudian y también trabajan la agricultura. 

Remberto se desempeña como motorista de estudiantes desde hace 7 años, aparte de este negocio se dedica a cultivar maíz y frijoles y a criar cerdos. El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar semillas, abono y pesticidas para comenzar la siembra y así tener granos suficientes para su consumo y vender. Planea que su cultivo se desarrolle y tenga un buen rendimiento y tener más ingresos para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Remberto is 34-years old.  He went to school until 9th grade.  He is married, and his wife makes her living raising pigs.  He has two children who go to school and also work in agriculture. 

Remberto has worked as a driver for students for the last seven years.  Aside from that business, he makes a living growing corn and beans and raising pigs.  The loan will be used to purchase seeds, compost and pesticides to start planting so he can have enough grain for his consumption and to sell.  Remberto plans to develop his crop and to have a good output which will generate a greater income for himself and for his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticides to start planting.

loans.name: Baara Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    BAARA est constitué de  5 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires  dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 9ème prêt. Les 8 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  d’articles divers à l’image de MARIAM qui est la 1ère femme debout  dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 10 cartons de savons, 5 sacs de piments et 5 sacs de potirons  avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Baara group consists of five married women who on average are 41 years old with five children. They live in nuclear families in the Heremakono Nord neighborhood of the city of Bougouni.

They became acquainted through neighborhood ties, friendship and commerce. To strengthen their financial capacity to improve their business, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso institution where they are on their ninth loan. All eight previous loans have been fully repaid.

This group of women are retail merchants of various items such as Mariam, who is the first woman standing in the photo from right to left.

She intends to use her loan to buy 10 cartons of soap, 5 bags of peppers and 5 bags of pumpkins from wholesalers in Bougouni. She conducts her retail sales at the market and at home, for cash and on credit, to a mixed clientele.

She expects to attain average monthly profits of 40,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: buy various items

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, vegetable oil and condiments.

loans.name: Waleska Milagros

texts.es: Waleska es casada y tiene 4 hijos, todos menores de edad. Su esposo vive en Costa Rica y desde allá aporta para los gastos del hogar. Anteriormente Waleska tenía una pulpería en su vivienda, pero la cerró porque tuvo que irse a vivir a Costa Rica. De regreso en el país construyó un cuarto en su vivienda para alquiler para obtener ingresos extras para apoyar en los gastos de su familia. Waleska está solicitando el crédito para invertir en la mejora de su hogar, pondrá la cerámica en el piso y hará las instalaciones eléctricas. Comprará, cemento arena, y cerámica. Espera en un futuro poder construir otra habitación para alquiler.
texts.en: Waleska is married and has four minor children.  Her husband lives in Costa Rica and helps with the household expenses from there.  Waleska used to have a store in her home, but closed it because she had to go live in Costa Rica.  When she returned to the country, she added a room to her house so she could rent it and have an extra income for the household expenses.  Waleska is asking for this loan to make improvements to her home.  She will install a tile floor and electrical wiring.  She will use the money to buy cement, sand, and tiles and hopes to build another house to rent out in the future.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Sabrina Yamileth

texts.es:
Sabrina,  estudio hasta sexto grado,  está casada y es madre de dos hijos,  uno de 5 años y el otro de12 años de edad vive junto con ella y están estudiando; su esposo trabaja como seguridad y Sabrina la actividad que realiza es la agricultura y  la venta de cosméticos por revistas.

la agricultura la realiza desde hace 10 años,  por lo que tiene mucha experiencia en dicha actividad, aprendió de sus padres dado al índice de pobreza de sus padres no pudo estudiar mucho.  Por lo tanto,  no pudo optar a otra actividad, los trabajos los realiza a pocos metros de su casa,  y los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de pupusas.
                                  
El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar semilla, abono y otros insumos para su cultivo de maíz, espera que gracias al crédito podrá tener una mejor producción en su cosecha y mejores ingresos a su familia y poder cancelar el crédito con la ganancia cubrir algunos gastos de su familia. Anteriormente solicito un crédito para este mismo fin y le ha ido muy bien y por eso soliicta este nuevo para continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Sabrina has a sixth grade education, is married, and the mother of two children, ages 5 and 12.  They live with her and attend school.  Her husband works as a security guard and Sabrina is a farmer and also sells cosmetics via catalog.

She has been farming for 10 years and has lots of experience.  She learned from her parents and was not able to attend school for very long, given their level of poverty, and she was not able to do anything else.  She works a few meters from her house and sells pupusas on the weekends.

She is asking for this loan to buy seeds, compost, and other supplies for raising corn.  She hopes that this loan will allow her to have better production and income for her family so she can pay some family expenses.

She has had one previous loan and things went well, so she is requesting a second one so she can continue working.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies..

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es: Ana de 50 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con su esposo y sus hijos, ella posee un puesto de venta de comida su negocio lo tiene ubicado en una zona muy transitada por esa razón posee mucha clientela, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Ana está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos para preparar su comida como: pollos, carnes, frutas, verduras, frijoles, arroz, etc. y así poder variar el menú para atender mejor a sus clientes y obtener más ganancias para que ella y su familia puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 50 years old and lives in the home of a relative with her husband and her children. She has set up a food stall in an area which sees many passers-by which is why she has a lot of customers. With the earnings from her sales she is able to cover some of the household costs. 

Ana is applying for a loan to buy more items to prepare her meals such as chicken, meat, fruit, vegetables, beans, rice, etc. In this way she will be able to vary the menu to better meet her customer's needs and earn a greater income so that she and her family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, fruit, vegetables, beans, rice, etc.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Marta de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre y su hijo, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Marta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería como: sopas, granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, fruta, etc. y así poder tener mejore ingresos y ella su familia tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marta is 50 years old and lives in her own home with her mother and her son. She has a small store which she has run out of her home for many years. With the income from her sales she is able to cover some of the household costs. 

Marta is applying for a loan to buy more merchandise such as soup, staple grains, lollies, soft drinks, fruit, etc. In this way she will be able to make a greater income and she and her family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soup, staple grains, lollies, soft drinks, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Carlos Andrés

texts.es: Carlos tiene dos negocios , por un lado elabora piezas de marmol y por otro lado se dedica a alquilar maquinarias. Su idea empresarial inició desde hace 15 años, cuando reconociendo su experincia como empleado de una empresa dedicada a la producción de márnol, logró ahorros con los cuales inició su actividademprendedorra que aun no se ha detenido. En su negocio elabora mesones, y articulos que diseña y a los que aplica las técnicas aprendidas durante toda su vida productiva, en la que ha trabajado, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, para generar ingresos que benficien su estructura familiar, conformada por su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 4 a 14 años. Carlos tambien genera ingresos alquilando máquinarias, para quienes requieran hacer trabajos en la actividad constructiva. Su meta mas adelante es ofrecer todo tipo de maquinaria especializadas en la construcción y poco a poco aumentar la calidad de vida de su familia, aunque su mayor desafio sea el logro de fuentes de financiación para poder avanzar rapidamente. En la actualidad Carlos está aplicando a un credikiva, primer finaciamineot que hace a la Fudación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una brilladora industrial para aumentar la productividad y la generación de ingresos, lo cual es tambien el éxito de un credikiva.
texts.en:
Carlos has two businesses. On one hand, he works with pieces of marble and on the other, he rents machinery. His business idea began 15 years ago, when, recognizing his experience as an employee in a business dedicated to the production of marble, he managed to save up and start his entrepreneurial activity that he hasn't stopped yet. In his business, he makes counters and articles that he designs using the techniques learned throughout his productive life, and in which he has worked, from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m., to generate income to benefit his family structure. His family consists of his wife and 3 children, ages 4 to 14. 

Carlos also generates income renting machinery to people who need to do jobs in the construction sector. His goal for the future is to offer all types of specialized machinery for construction and, little by little, improve the quality of life for his family. His biggest challenge is achieving sources of financing to be able to progress quickly. Currently, Carlos is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing he is requesting from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will buy an industrial polisher to increase his production and generate more income, which is also the success of a Kiva loan.

loans.use: To buy an industrial polisher.

loans.name: David

texts.es: Es un hombre trabajador y luchador, originario de Waspam, tiene 70 años de edad, casado con 6 hijos, mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposa es ama de casa. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingreso, estableció un taller de ebanistería. Desde su juventud dedico a su negocio y ha inculcado a sus hijos ser un hombre de bien, con mucho esfuerzo y con sus ahorros compró una cepilladora y cortadora de madera, cuyo costo fue de  $ 1, 300 (Un mil trecientos dólares) y construyo un pequeño local, para establecer su taller. Solicita financiamiento para comprar materiales y herramientas para su negocio: maderas preciosas, pega para madera y barniz, para elaborar escritorio y puertas de madera. Su sueño es tener un negocio próspero y construir de concreto el local.
texts.en: He is a hardworking and striving man from Waspam.  He is 70 years old, married, and has six adult children on their own.  His wife works as a housewife.  He started a cabinet shop in order to generate his own income and has been in this business since he was a boy and he has instilled in his children to be men of means.  With great effort, he used his savings to buy a sander and saw, which cost him $1,300.  He also built a small building in which to set up his workshop.  He is asking for a loan to buy tools and supplies for his business, such as high end lumber, wood glue, and varnish so he can make wooden desks and doors.  His dream is to have his own business and build a concrete building for his workshop.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Benko Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    BENKO est constitué de  7 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires  dans le quartier  MEDINE de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 2ème prêt. Le précédent prêt a été correctement remboursé. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  d’articles divers
à l’image de AWA qui est la femme assise devant  dans la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 6 cartons de savon, 4 pièces de pagnes et 2 dizaines de complets d’habits pour enfant avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Benko group consists of seven married women who on average are 41 years old with five children. They live in nuclear families in the Medine neighborhood of the city of Bougouni.

They became acquainted through neighborhood ties, friendship and commerce. To strengthen their financial capacity to improve their business, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso institution where they are on their second loan. The previous loan has been repaid in full.

This group of women are retail merchants of various items like Awa, who is the woman sitting in front in the photo.

She intends to use her loan to buy 6 cartons of soap, 4 lengths of pagnes (colorful West-African fabric) and twenty full sets of children's clothing from wholesalers in Bougouni. She conducts her retail sales at the market and at home, for cash and on credit, to a mixed clientele.

She expects to attain average monthly profits of 15,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: buy various items

loans.name: Marilis Monserrate

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito Esperanza y Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Marilis, tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos, uno mayor de edad y dos de 17 y 14 años que estudian en Universidad y colegio, todos ellos viven en su casa. Su esposo es maestro de escuela.
Doña Marilis trabaja de maestra  en una escuela de la localidad pero además de esto también se dedica al comercio en sus ratos y días libres, vende ropa de todo tipo, zapatos y varios productos que le envían de los Estados Unidos, actualmente esta vendiendo sabana y cortinas que le llegó recientemente, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta  aunque la mayoría de la mercadería vende bajo pedido que sus clientes le realizan con anticipación, ella entrega a crédito y cobra cada quince días, lleva con este negocio por más de 18 años con lo cual se gana algo extra.
Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar sabanas, cortinas y ropa. Lleva más de 3 años  en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y a bajos intereses. Sus sueños son tener una gran boutique.
texts.en:
The community bank 'Esperanza y Progreso' (Hope and Progress) meets every fortnight in the canton of Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts which are recognised on a national and international level. It is also famous for its straw hats.  

In this town lives Marilis, 51. She is married and has had three children from this relationship, one of whom is already an adult and two who are 17 and 14 years old and studying at university and high school respectively. They all live with her at home. Her husband is a school teacher. 

Marilis works as a school teacher in town however as well as this she also runs a business in her spare time and on her days off. She sells all types of clothing, shoes and many items which are sent to her from the United States. She is currently selling sheets and curtains which recently arrived. She sells door to door even though the majority of her merchandise is sold to order. Her customers place an order in advance, she accepts their payment on credit and recoups the loan every fortnight. She has worked in this business for more than 18 years, giving her some extra income. 

This loan will be used to buy sheets, curtains and clothing. Marilis has been with this community bank for more than three years and she likes it because the loans are quick and low in interest. Here dream is to have a grand boutique.

loans.use: to buy sheets, curtains and clothing

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    DJIGUISSEME est constitué de  5 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 4ème prêt. Les 3 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  d’articles divers à l’image de KADIATOU qui est la 1ère femme debout  dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 5 pièces de pagnes, des produits de beauté tels que les lotions, crèmes et savons avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17.500FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Djiguisseme group consists of five married women who on average are 34 years old with five children. They live in nuclear families in the Heremakono Nord neighborhood of the city of Bougouni.

They became acquainted through neighborhood ties, friendship and commerce. To strengthen their financial capacity to improve their business, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso institution where they are on their fourth loan. All three previous loans have been fully repaid.

This group of women are retail merchants of various items like Kadiatou, who is the first woman standing in the photo from right to left.

She intends to use her loan to buy 5 lengths of pagnes (colorful West-African fabric), beauty products such as lotions, skin creams and soaps from wholesalers in Bougouni. She conducts her retail sales at the market and at home, for cash and on credit, to a mixed clientele.

She expects to attain average monthly profits of 17,500 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: buy various items

loans.name: Maria Daysi

texts.es:
María, opta por un nuevo crédito por los resultados tan positivos que tiene en su negocio al hacer buen uso de ellos, en esta oportunidad comprara huevos, harina, manteca, aceite, pollo, leña, condimentos e insumos agrícolas, continuara elaborando los antojitos (pan y tamales) así como también podrá tener los materiales que le ayuden a cultivar granos básicos para el consumo familiar y para elaborar parte de su venta.
Con el financiamiento anterior María se ha  mantenido trabajando para tener ingresos que utiliza en cancelar su deuda, ofrecer a su familia una mejor alimentación, vestuario y salud
texts.en:
Maria is asking for a new loan because of the positive results on her business when she gets one.  This time she will buy eggs, flour, lard, cooking oil, chicken, firewood, condiments, and farming supplies.  She continues making snacks (bread and tamales) and will have the supplies she needs to raise basic grains for her family and for sale.

The previous loan allowed Maria to continue to work to have the income she needs to pay her debt and better feed, clothe, and provide for her family’s health.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies.
